Ensure product quality for systems and applications by performing functional, regression, and integration testing. Test Web UIs and RESTful APIs, validating responses, performance, and data accuracy. Collaborate with the development and DevOps teams to identify and resolve issues quickly and effectively. Automate repetitive test cases using tools and frameworks like Selenium, Cypress, or equivalent. Monitor and maintain product health using testing pipelines integrated with CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, AWS, Mongo Atlas). Perform cross-platform testing for mobile and desktop apps (e.g., React, MAUI). Track and document bugs in collaboration with development teams, ensuring resolution within sprint cycles. Conduct performance and security testing for both on-premise and cloud-hosted solutions. Tech Stack & Tools Tech Stack & Tools Languages & Frameworks: JavaScript, React, NextJS Test Automation Tools: Cypress, Swagger, CI/CD Tools: GitHub Actions, AWS Code pipeline Databases: PostgreSQL, Mongo Hosting Environments: AWS (S3) Languages & Frameworks: JavaScript, React, NextJS Test Automation Tools: Cypress, Swagger, CI/CD Tools: GitHub Actions, AWS Code pipeline Databases: PostgreSQL, Mongo Hosting Environments: AWS (S3)

About the job Senior Recruiter-Fully Remote Company Overview: Our client, a renowned hospitality entity which strives to continuously revolutionize the local culture through their passion of food, creativity, and leading brands. They are considered one of the top leading powerhouses in the F&B industry, and operate across the GCC with more than 40 existing branches. They are seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Senior Recruiter with a solid background and experience in the F&B and Hospitality sectors. The successful candidate will lead the End-to-End Recruitment Process and possess a solid track record of filling requisitions in an efficient and effective manner. Position Summary: The Senior Recruiter will be a strategic partner to hiring managers, overseeing the full recruitment cycle with a focus on delivering exceptional candidate and client experiences. You will own recruitment for key roles across the F&B and hospitality landscape front of house, back of house, and corporate ensuring a steady pipeline of top-tier talent. This is a role for a dynamic, organized, and people-centric professional who thrives in high-volume, fast-paced environments. The ideal candidate will have a strong grasp of the F&B operational environment, a passion for people, and the technical aptitude to leverage modern recruitment tools for efficient and effective hiring. This role requires a dynamic personality, strategic mindset, and exceptional relationship management skills to ensure a high-quality experience for both candidates and internal stakeholders. Key Responsibilities & Role: Own the Full Recruitment Lifecycle: Manage end-to-end recruitment: requisition creation, sourcing, screening, interviewing, offer negotiation, onboarding, and post-hire follow-up. Lead recruitment efforts for high-priority roles across kitchen, service, operations, and management functions. Sourcing & Talent Mapping: Develop and execute innovative sourcing strategies using multiple platforms: LinkedIn Recruiter Lite, job boards (Indeed, Bayt, Naukri Gulf, Foundit, etc.), industry-specific networks, and social media. Build and maintain active talent pipelines for current and future hiring needs. Implement Boolean search techniques and passive talent engagement strategies. Stakeholder & Client Relationship Management: Partner with F&B department heads and HR leadership to define hiring strategies aligned with operational needs and business growth. Act as a trusted advisor, providing insights on talent availability, compensation trends, and hiring best practices. Lead regular recruitment updates with stakeholders to manage expectations and drive accountability. Provide consultative support and market insights to guide hiring decisions and workforce planning. Candidate Experience Management: Deliver a professional, transparent, and engaging candidate journey from first contact through onboarding. Conduct effective screening interviews to evaluate candidates' technical fit, soft skills, and alignment with company culture. Ensure timely feedback loops and clear communication throughout the hiring process. Process Optimization & Reporting/Tech-Savvy Recruitment Execution: Leverage the Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and recruitment analytics to drive operational efficiency and data-driven decision-making. Track key performance metrics: time-to-fill, quality of hire, offer-to-acceptance ratio, and candidate satisfaction. Utilize LinkedIn Recruiter Lite, job boards (Bayt, Naukri Gulf, Caterer Global, Indeed, Foundit), and Boolean search techniques to source and engage high-quality talent. Monitor and analyze recruitment metrics such as time-to-hire, source of hire, candidate experience ratings, and pipeline conversion rates. Employer Branding & Talent Attraction: Collaborate with Marketing and HR teams to enhance employer brand visibility and promote the company as an employer of choice in the F&B sector. Represent the company at job fairs, networking events, and industry forums to boost talent acquisition efforts within the F&B and hospitality space. Collaborate with marketing and HR to enhance employer branding efforts on social platforms and career pages. Qualifications & Skills: Professional Experience: Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in full-cycle recruitment; F&B and hospitality sector experience is strongly preferred. Proven track record of managing high-volume and fast-paced hiring needs, particularly across GCC markets. Demonstrated success in hiring a wide range of roles from line staff and chefs to restaurant managers and regional directors. Technical Competence: Proficient in using ATS platforms (e.g., Greenhouse, Workable, BambooHR, Lever) and recruitment CRMs. Skilled in sourcing with LinkedIn Recruiter Lite, niche job boards, and Boolean search. Able to interpret and act on recruitment metrics and analytics to improve performance. Soft Skills & Personality Traits: Dynamic and personable professional with the ability to build rapport quickly and influence key stakeholders. Strong interpersonal, negotiation, and decision-making skills with a high level of emotional intelligence. Self-starter with exceptional organizational, time management, and multitasking abilities. Able to work independently and collaboratively across diverse teams and time zones. Industry Knowledge: In-depth understanding of the F&B and hospitality talent landscape, including job structures, labor trends, and regional market dynamics. Familiar with local labor laws and recruitment compliance standards across the GCC. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Professional certifications (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR, LinkedIn Certified Recruiter) are a plus. Multilingual skills (e.g., English, Arabic, or French) are an advantage. Aspire Software is looking for a talented Senior Software Developer,(C# /.net/ Angular) to join our team in Lebanon Here is a little window into our company: Aspire Software operates and manages wholly owned software companies, providing mission-critical solutions across multiple verticals. By implementing industry best practices, Aspire delivers a time sensitive integration process, and the operation of a decentralized model has allowed it to become a hub for creating rapid growth by reinvesting in its portfolio. Key Responsibilities Front-End Development Design, develop, and maintain responsive web applications using modern front-end frameworks (Angular) that provide an intuitive user experience. Collaborate with the design team to translate UI/UX wireframes into functional and visually appealing interfaces. Ensure cross-browser compatibility and optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability on the client side. Back-End Development Develop and maintain server-side logic, database schemas, and APIs using frameworks like C# or .NET. Implement secure, scalable RESTful APIs and integrate third-party APIs where necessary. Optimize server-side code for high performance and reliability, with a focus on data security and privacy. Collaboration & Project Management Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, QA, and design, to deliver high-quality, timely software solutions. Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and collaborative troubleshooting, contributing to a positive team culture. Document development processes, code, and application structures to facilitate knowledge sharing and future maintenance. We are growing! We are currently looking to hire a Senior Graphic Designer to work with us remotely from Lebanon! Who we are: Founded in 2006, our story started with two entrepreneurs. Today, we’re proud to be a global business. From Shanghai to Paris, we have 12 offices and operate across four continents in 70 countries. We are home to over 160 professionals from around the world, working together to serve more than 200 luxury clients. At CXG, we love to evolve, elevate, and transform experiences while bringing brand promises to life. We offer strategic solutions that impact performance and elevate the customer experience of some of the world’s most iconic premium and luxury brands. What you will be doing: We’re seeking a Senior Graphic Designer to join our Marketing team. This role is critical to supporting CXG’s B2B and thought leadership initiatives while creating visually stunning content for social media, presentations, and high-level consultancy reports. The ideal candidate will be innovative, detail-oriented, and experienced in creating impactful designs for global consultancy firms. Key Responsibilities: 1- Design for Social Media: Create compelling posts, carousels, and graphics that align with CXG’s brand identity. Enhance visuals with advanced photo editing, color grading, and manipulation using Adobe Photoshop. 2- Thought Leadership and Report Design: Develop creative concepts and layouts for professional reports using Adobe InDesign. Create infographics, charts, and visual elements to enhance complex written content. Innovate on long-form designs, ensuring readability and aesthetic appeal. 3- PowerPoint Presentations: Design visually engaging slides for internal and external audiences. Transform data-heavy content into digestible, visually appealing presentations. Support the commercial, data science, and research teams in upscaling reports and proposals. 4- AI-Assisted Design Full competency and experience in AI generation models like MidJourney to create unique and brand-consistent visuals. Integrate AI-generated imagery seamlessly into CXG’s content strategy. 5- Internal Communications Support Quickly produce visually appealing content for internal updates and team communications. Ensure materials are easily repurposable by internal stakeholders. 6- Illustration and Vector Design Create vector-based designs and web-ready SVGs using Adobe Illustrator. Design infographics and icons that elevate digital and print assets. We are growing! We are currently looking to hire a Senior Graphic Designer to work with us remotely from Lebanon! Müller`s Solutions is looking for an experienced and results-oriented Digital Solutions Sales Manager to join our growing team. In this role, We are seeking a motivated Digital Solutions Sales Manager to drive business growth across multiple regions.The ideal candidate has experience in one or more digital solution domains such as ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft, Temenos), enterprise content management (OpenText), IT operations and service management (BMC Software), AI technologies, managed services, and integration platforms (Boomi). You will manage the full sales cycle — from prospecting and relationship building to solution presentation and deal closure — working closely with technical and delivery teams to bring value-driven solutions to our clients. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy for the digital solutions portfolio. Identify potential clients and engage with them to understand their needs and challenges. Prepare and deliver persuasive presentations and proposals that align with client requirements. Manage the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing deals. Collaborate with marketing and product teams to develop effective go-to-market strategies. Provide insightful feedback to enhance product offerings based on client interactions and market trends. Achieve and exceed sales targets, contributing to the overall growth of Müller`s Solutions. Build and maintain long-term relationships with clients to foster loyalty and repeat business. Müller`s Solutions is looking for an experienced and results-oriented Digital Solutions Sales Manager to join our growing team. In this role, We are seeking a motivated Digital Solutions Sales Manager to drive business growth across multiple regions.The ideal candidate has experience in one or more digital solution domains such as ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft, Temenos), enterprise content management (OpenText), IT operations and service management (BMC Software), AI technologies, managed services, and integration platforms (Boomi). You will manage the full sales cycle — from prospecting and relationship building to solution presentation and deal closure — working closely with technical and delivery teams to bring value-driven solutions to our clients. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy for the digital solutions portfolio. Identify potential clients and engage with them to understand their needs and challenges. Prepare and deliver persuasive presentations and proposals that align with client requirements. Manage the entire sales cycle from prospecting to closing deals. Collaborate with marketing and product teams to develop effective go-to-market strategies. Provide insightful feedback to enhance product offerings based on client interactions and market trends. Achieve and exceed sales targets, contributing to the overall growth of Müller`s Solutions. Build and maintain long-term relationships with clients to foster loyalty and repeat business. Company Description Nucleus Ventures (NV) is a boutique innovation and venture-building organization with a strong track record in entrepreneurship programs, corporate innovation, and advisory services. Based in Beirut and active across France, the UK, and Cyprus, NV designs and runs incubation, acceleration, and capacity-building programs for startups, corporates, and development partners. Working through a network of subject matter experts, entrepreneurs, and international partners, NV helps organizations and ecosystems grow by connecting innovation, purpose, and impact — all under the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) framework. Job Description Role Overview The Programs & Partnerships Manager will lead and expand NV’s programs and venture-building activities, managing the design and delivery of incubation, acceleration, and capacity-building initiatives. This role combines hands-on program management, donor relations, and strategic partnership development — ideal for someone who thrives in a small, entrepreneurial team with a big regional mission. Rather than joining a large organization, this person will help shape and grow NV’s Programs and Venture Building division, while growing professionally alongside it. Key Responsibilities 1. Program Management Design, implement, and manage NV’s incubation, acceleration, and capacity-building programs. Develop program frameworks, budgets, KPIs, and reporting tools. Ensure programs meet performance targets, impact objectives, and donor compliance standards. Supervise coordinators, mentors, and trainers to ensure quality and consistency. Produce progress and impact reports, case studies, and communication materials showcasing results. 2. Donor Relations & Reporting Manage relationships with donors, development agencies, and institutional partners. Prepare professional narrative and financial reports in line with donor guidelines. Support proposal audits, monitoring, and evaluation processes. Represent NV in donor and partner meetings with professionalism and strategic insight. 3. Business Development & Strategic Partnerships Identify and pursue new funding opportunities, grants, and RFPs aligned with NV’s mission. Co-lead concept notes and proposal writing with the CEO. Build partnerships with corporates, investors, universities, and NGOs to co-create programs. Represent NV at ecosystem events and conferences to strengthen visibility and network reach. Maintain a forward-looking pipeline of collaborations that fuel NV’s growth. 4. Venture Building Leadership Contribute to developing NV’s Venture Building division and startup support methodology. Work with mentors and experts to design impactful startup journeys and mentorship frameworks. Implement monitoring tools and KPIs to track startup and program outcomes. Strengthen NV’s position as a credible regional actor in entrepreneurship and innovation. 5. Team Coordination & Internal Systems Coordinate with the CEO and team on priorities, program timelines, and resource planning. Implement efficient workflows, documentation processes, and impact tracking systems. Support the recruitment, onboarding, and development of team members as NV grows. Foster a collaborative, purpose-driven, and impact-oriented work culture. What This Role Offers The opportunity to build and grow NV’s Programs and Venture Building division. Exposure to regional innovation ecosystems and collaboration with international donors and partners. A chance to make a tangible impact by shaping entrepreneurship and innovation programs across the MENA region. Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Development Studies, or a related field. 3–5 years of experience in program management, entrepreneurship ecosystems, or donor-funded projects. Strong understanding of startup incubation, acceleration, and innovation ecosystems. Proven experience in proposal writing, donor reporting, and partnership development. Excellent organizational, communication, and presentation skills. Entrepreneurial mindset, self-motivated, and comfortable in a lean, fast-paced environment. At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King® , we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go. Job Summary： Trane in Lebanon is hiring for a Service Sales Engineer/Account Manager in Service to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing long-term customer relationships with building owners to maximize account penetration and customer retention with contractor and consulting engineer/architect accounts. You will provide knowledge and consultation in the form of developing HVAC system related solutions for customer problems, including financial and performance-based consideration. Your focus will be on providing customers a total solution for the most energy efficient buildings Responsibilities: Determine needs, develop and execute an account specific business plan to identify the long term, mutual support requirements required to facilitate a strong, profitable and successful partnership Convert leads into opportunities by assigning the appropriate sales process, identifying the required project team members, making assignments, and communicating the next steps in the process. Gather and validate preliminary information and perform facility walkthrough, construction plan review or other requirements. Responsible for project take-off, selection, proposal pricing and selling strategy, and integration of equipment, controls, and services. Assist customers in providing quotations and answering technical questions on HVAC systems, Trane products, and system application alternative, controls, installation, operation, maintenance, and problem resolution. Visit customer job sites is required, which may include outdoor work and/or work in mechanical/equipment rooms. During the site visits, the employee may be exposed to variable weather conditions; moving mechanical parts; heights, and other variable environmental conditions based on location. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, engineering technology, or equivalent from a four-year college or university preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum 5 years of solution sales experience in HVAC or control systems as well as related service agreements. Must possess a valid driver’s license for a minimum of 12 months We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs that help our employees thrive in both their professional and personal lives. We are proud of our winning culture which is inclusive and respectful at its core. We share passion for serving customers, caring for others, and boldly challenging what’s possible for a sustainable world. We are committed to achieving workforce diversity reflective of our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status. The incumbent in this position is responsible for cleaning guest rooms, corridors, floor public areas and pantries according to standards established by the hotel. Clean assigned guest rooms according to standards established by the hotel. It involves, but not limited to, making the bed, dusting the room and furniture, replenishing guest room and bath supplies, cleaning the bathroom, vacuuming the carpet. Whilst cleaning the room, verify that all is in proper condition and order of functioning and reports to Supervisor any items that need repair. Clean corridors and floor public areas around guest rooms assigned. Also maintain cleanliness of equipment and pantries. Keep informed of hotel product and service knowledge in order to answer guest questions. Answer all guest questions / requests in a friendly and caring manner, take appropriate actions or if needed, refer the matters to the relevant persons to handle. It may be providing information, giving an extra item such as a towel, etc. Write down on their assignment sheets relevant information for record purposes and possible future inquiries. At the end of shift, report special attention guest, unusual situations, incidents that need follow up, to ensure consistency and guest satisfaction. Verify the physical status of room and updates Order Taker of any discrepancies found. Report at once to Supervisor and Order Taker lost and found items and coordinates with Order Taker when to bring items down. Provide the turn down service to assigned guest rooms according to standards established by the hotel. It involves, but not limited to, turning down the bed, replenishing guest room and bath supplies and cleaning the bathroom if necessary. Help control guest and cleaning supplies to save costs. Clean assigned guest rooms, the late check out and late service required by guests, according to standards established by the hotel. It involves, but not limited to, making the bed, dusting the room and furniture, replenishing guest room and bath supplies, cleaning the bathroom, vacuuming the carpet. Whilst cleaning the room, verify that all is in proper condition and order of functioning and report to Supervisor any items that need repair. Clean corridors and floor public areas around guest rooms assigned. Also maintain cleanliness of equipment and pantries. Keep informed of hotel products and services knowledge in order to answer guest questions. Whilst cleaning the room, verify that all is in proper condition and order of functioning and reports to Supervisor any items that need repair. Clean corridors and floor public areas around guest rooms assigned. Also maintain cleanliness of equipment and pantries. Keep informed of hotel product and service knowledge in order to answer guest questions. Answer all guest questions / requests in a friendly and caring manner, take appropriate actions or if needed, refer the matters to the relevant persons to handle. It may be providing information, giving an extra item such as a towel, etc. Write down on their assignment sheets relevant information for record purposes and possible future inquiries. At the end of shift, report special attention guest, unusual situations, incidents that need follow up, to ensure consistency and guest satisfaction. Verify the physical status of room and updates Order Taker of any discrepancies found. Report at once to Supervisor and Order Taker lost and found items and coordinates with Order Taker when to bring items down. Provide the turn down service to assigned guest rooms according to standards established by the hotel. It involves, but not limited to, turning down the bed, replenishing guest room and bath supplies and cleaning the bathroom if necessary. Help control guest and cleaning supplies to save costs. Clean assigned guest rooms, the late check out and late service required by guests, according to standards established by the hotel. It involves, but not limited to, making the bed, dusting the room and furniture, replenishing guest room and bath supplies, cleaning the bathroom, vacuuming the carpet. Whilst cleaning the room, verify that all is in proper condition and order of functioning and report to Supervisor any items that need repair. Clean corridors and floor public areas around guest rooms assigned. Also maintain cleanliness of equipment and pantries. Keep informed of hotel products and services knowledge in order to answer guest questions.

Company Description Join a hotel that is a member of the Accor network, whose group brings together more than 45 brands, 5,500 hotels, 10,000 restaurants and lifestyle destinations. Here, we believe in you and what you bring to the table. There are many opportunities for development and advancement. Every gesture, every smile, every action, contributes to creating a positive and memorable impact for our customers, our colleagues and also for our planet. Together, we embody the vision of responsible hospitality. Take the opportunity to become a Heartist®, and let your heart guide you in this world where life beats faster. Company Description Remote Call Center Job Description Are you ready to embark on an exciting remote journey as a Call Center Representative? We are seeking passionate individuals who thrive on delivering top-notch sales and want to make a difference. Join our dynamic team and embrace the opportunity to work remotely, providing exceptional support while enjoying the flexibility you deserve. This position requires a 9-month minimum commitment, where you’ll excel from the comfort of your own home. This is an entry-level position which offers on-the-job training. While previous Call Center experience isn't required, we've seen talented professionals do exceptionally well with at least 1+ yrs experience in customer service, sales, or front/back-office experience. Candidates should be very reliable, have good attention to details, have excellent communication and computer skills, coachable, reliable, fully commit to the training schedule which is up to 2 weeks (our attendance policy is strictly enforced) and be willing to consistently learn on the job. If hired for this opportunity you will be required to work from a calm and quiet environment with the required equipment listed throughout the application process. If this sounds like you, submit your application today!! We offer amazing perks and benefits: Awesome colleagues who are dedicated to Voice Dream and our customers! Remote Work Training (Must complete training) Base salary Performance incentives (Bonuses are not guaranteed and solely based on client and company discretion) Weekly Schedule (5 days a week) 8-9 hours daily schedule (break included) Career & Training Development Organizational Growth Professional Work Environment Two yearly company Dinners/Party Full-Time 40hr per week position Competitive Salary (will be disclosed if we move forward with your application) Responsibilities Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Handle both inbound and outbound calls in a courteous manner while up-selling products and services to customers. Ensure first call resolution through problems solving and effective call handling. Research systems to find missing information as applicable; coordinate with other departments of Voice Dream to resolve issues when needed. Accurately document and process customer claims in appropriate systems. Lead fact-finding discussions to determine the best options for the customer. Utilize knowledge base and training to accurately answer customer questions while following all required scripts, policies, and procedure. Actively listening and communicating with customers, as opposed to just reading the script. Other duties may be assigned. In case the applicant wants to leave the company, under any circumstance, the applicant is required to present HR with a 2-week notice. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the minimum knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to qualify for performing the job. Education and/or Experience: Minimum high school diploma or equivalent. Six months customer service experience. Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to effectively present technical information clearly and concisely. Ability to fluently speak and comprehend the English language. Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to isolate root cause according to prescribed set of guidelines, matching solution to identified issues. Computer Skills: Ability to listen and respond while keying into automated system. Ability to thoroughly learn client-specific software and hardware (Windows or Mac environment). Able to accurately type 25 wpm. General technology knowledge, including the ability to describe in general terms: operating systems, basic internet navigation, hardware components, software, networking components (video, data, voice), and email applications. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. Employee must maintain regular and acceptable attendance at such levels as determined at Voice Dream's sole discretion. The employee must be available and willing to work 40+ hours per week as Voice Dream determines is necessary or desirable to meet its business needs. Requirements To apply to this position, the candidate's laptop must fit the required specs: For windows users - 8GB of RAM (minimum) - Core i5 (4 core minimum) - 2.00 GHz (minimum) For iOS users - 8GB of memory (minimum) - Catalina Model / Big Sur Model / M1 chip -2.00 GHz (minimum) For Headset - A USB wired headset with visible microphone is required (no wireless or aux) -Applicant will not be approved if AirPods or earphones are used instead of a headset For Internet - A wired LTE connection is required (router must be powered by a SIM card and wired to the laptop) - Wi-Fi connection won't be sufficient - Hot-spot won't be sufficient Qualifications -Fluent English (Spanish is a plus) -Good working laptop minimum specs are in the job description -headset -very good internet Remote Call Center Job Description Are you ready to embark on an exciting remote journey as a Call Center Representative? Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with The Cozy Penguin to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: The Cozy Penguin Job Description We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant to support our CEO in a fast-paced, remote work environment. This role is crucial in ensuring the smooth operation of daily administrative tasks and enhancing overall operational efficiency. Job Purpose The primary purpose of the Executive Assistant is to provide comprehensive administrative support to the CEO, enabling them to focus on strategic initiatives while ensuring that all operational tasks are handled efficiently and effectively. Job Duties and Responsibilities calendar management communication handling administrative tasks email correspondence scheduling document preparation follow-ups bookkeeping invoicing payments Qualifications Required Qualifications exceptional organization attention to detail proactive problem-solving strong communication abilities ability to work independently confidentiality precision in tasks Jobs for Humanity is partnering with The Cozy Penguin to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Company Description E -Wallet services Job Description Job Description Junior Customer Service Representative Position: Junior Customer Service Representative Department: Customer Service Location: Sin El Fil Job Summary: The Junior Customer Service Representative is responsible for providing first-level support to EVO wallet users, ensuring prompt resolution of inquiries, and delivering an excellent customer experience. This role requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to handle user concerns professionally and efficiently. Key Responsibilities: Respond to customer inquiries via email, chat, and phone in a timely and professional manner. Assist users with account setup, troubleshooting login issues, and navigating the wallet platform. Provide accurate information about product, services, and policies. Escalate complex issues to the senior customer service team or relevant departments. Follow up with customers to ensure their issues have been resolved. Collaborate with the product and technical teams to communicate common issues or improvement areas. Stay updated on company policies, new features, and compliance requirements related to wallet operations. Qualifications & Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Communications, or related field (preferred but not mandatory). 0–2 years of experience in customer service, preferably in fintech, banking, or technology. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English & Arabic – French is a plus. Strong problem-solving and active listening skills. Positive attitude, team player, and customer-first mindset. Company Description Join a hotel that is a member of the Accor network, whose group brings together more than 45 brands, 5,500 hotels, 10,000 restaurants and lifestyle destinations. Here, we believe in you and what you bring to the table. There are many opportunities for development and advancement. Every gesture, every smile, every action, contributes to creating a positive and memorable impact for our customers, our colleagues and also for our planet. Together, we embody the vision of responsible hospitality. Take the opportunity to become a Heartist®, and let your heart guide you in this world where life beats faster. Job Description Scope of Position: The Assistant Food & Beverage Manager will report directly to the Food & Beverage manager and will have the assistance of Supervisors. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable with busy, high-quality operations, managing multitasks as well as have strong interpersonal skills. He will be responsible for all the Food and Beverage Operations which includes all culinary areas. Oversees Guest and employee satisfaction, maintaining standards and meeting or exceeding financial goals. Develops and implements business plan for the Food and Beverage Division and always Responsibilities: Leading Food and Beverage Team Manages the operations of the Food and Beverage departments Supervises and manages employees. Manages all day-to-day operations. Understands employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence. Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example. Oversees all culinary, restaurant, beverage and room service operations. Provides excellent customer service to all employees. Responds quickly and proactively to employee's concerns. Provides a learning atmosphere with a focus on continuous improvement. Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members. Monitors and maintains the productivity level of employees. Provides the leadership, vision and direction to bring together and prioritize the departmental goals in a way that will be efficient and effective. Perform other duties as and when required. Additional Responsibilities Complies with all corporate accounting procedures. Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person. Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution and solve problems. Drives effective departmental communication and information systems through logs, department meetings and property meetings. Ongoing control and enhancement of quality standards and guest service. Daily supervision, coordination and direction of the outlet colleagues and leaders, anticipating and ensuring prompt, courteous service. Ensuring that Restaurant/Bar maintains a first class and positive visual impact including ambiance, cleanliness, orderliness, décor and service flows. Working with the teams to create new ideas and promotions resulting in increased opportunities for Food & Beverage Sales. Working with the kitchen, stewarding and all restaurant leaders to ensure and promote that teamwork is a strong component of the daily service culture. Assist with recruiting, staffing and scheduling ensuring an adequate balanced staff and leadership level while maintaining forecasted productivities. Ensuring a safe and healthy work environment for all guests and colleagues Monitoring and continued development of food & beverage controls. Ensures adherence to Accor Code of Ethics Qualifications 2 years’ experience in food and beverage management, culinary, or related professional area. Must possess outstanding guest services skills, professional presentation and sophisticated communication skills. Proficient in the English language (verbal & written), second language is an asset. Must be able to handle a multitude of tasks in an intense, ever-changing environment. Must be flexible in terms of working hours. Must be computer literate and analytical. Enthusiastic and guest driven. Able to perform under pressure. Together, we embody the vision of responsible hospitality. Take the opportunity to become a Heartist®, and let your heart guide you in this world where life beats faster. Job Description Scope of Position: The Assistant Food & Beverage Manager will report directly to the Food & Beverage manager and will have the assistance of Supervisors. The successful candidate will need to be comfortable with busy, high-quality operations, managing multitasks as well as have strong interpersonal skills. He will be responsible for all the Food and Beverage Operations which includes all culinary areas. Oversees Guest and employee satisfaction, maintaining standards and meeting or exceeding financial goals. Develops and implements business plan for the Food and Beverage Division and always Responsibilities: Leading Food and Beverage Team Manages the operations of the Food and Beverage departments Supervises and manages employees. Manages all day-to-day operations. Understands employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence. Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example. Oversees all culinary, restaurant, beverage and room service operations. Provides excellent customer service to all employees. Responds quickly and proactively to employee's concerns. Provides a learning atmosphere with a focus on continuous improvement. Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members. Monitors and maintains the productivity level of employees. Provides the leadership, vision and direction to bring together and prioritize the departmental goals in a way that will be efficient and effective. Perform other duties as and when required. Additional Responsibilities Complies with all corporate accounting procedures. Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person. Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution and solve problems. Drives effective departmental communication and information systems through logs, department meetings and property meetings. Ongoing control and enhancement of quality standards and guest service. Daily supervision, coordination and direction of the outlet colleagues and leaders, anticipating and ensuring prompt, courteous service. Ensuring that Restaurant/Bar maintains a first class and positive visual impact including ambiance, cleanliness, orderliness, décor and service flows. Working with the teams to create new ideas and promotions resulting in increased opportunities for Food & Beverage Sales. Working with the kitchen, stewarding and all restaurant leaders to ensure and promote that teamwork is a strong component of the daily service culture. Assist with recruiting, staffing and scheduling ensuring an adequate balanced staff and leadership level while maintaining forecasted productivities. Ensuring a safe and healthy work environment for all guests and colleagues Monitoring and continued development of food & beverage controls. Ensures adherence to Accor Code of Ethics Qualifications 2 years’ experience in food and beverage management, culinary, or related professional area. Must possess outstanding guest services skills, professional presentation and sophisticated communication skills. Proficient in the English language (verbal & written), second language is an asset. Must be able to handle a multitude of tasks in an intense, ever-changing environment. Must be flexible in terms of working hours. Must be computer literate and analytical. Enthusiastic and guest driven. Able to perform under pressure. Join a hotel that is a member of the Accor network, whose group brings together more than 45 brands, 5,500 hotels, 10,000 restaurants and lifestyle destinations. Murex is a global fintech leader in trading, risk management and processing solutions for capital markets. Operating from our 19 offices, 3 400 Murexians from over 65 different nationalities ensure the development, implementation and support of our platform which is used by banks, asset managers, corporations and utilities, across the world. Join Murex and work on the challenges of an industry at the forefront of innovation and thrive in a people-centric environment. You’ll be part of one global team where you can learn fast and stay true to yourself. Murex offers the Internship Program tailored for undergraduate students graduating in Fall 2026 or Spring 2027. The program gives you the chance to put in practice your theoretical knowledge by providing you with the right environment for a guaranteed hands-on experience. Joining this program will expose you to the state-of-the-art technologies, best practices, and latest methodologies. Your Role The internship program offers internships in 3 different activities: Development, Technical and Testing (Quality Assurance). As a Development Intern , you will be contributing to a development project in one of our Murex Development teams. Topics include application lifecycle management, web technologies, migrations, among others. As a Technical Intern, you will be responsible for solving technical problems raised to the team and identifying the underlying root causes. You’ll collaborate with diverse teams in DevOps, Technical Support, IT Infrastructure, Quality Assurance aiding in designing and deploying solutions with cutting-edge innovations. As a Testing Intern, you will work alongside fellow developers who are continuously evolving the Mx code line as part of an agile team of interns. Your role will be to accompany the developers by ensuring the non-regression of the code and by also automating tests using Murex’s test automation tool. Your Responsibilities Collaborate with cross functional teams that include profiles from various teams Conduct research related to your project Build software applications using a programming language of choice: C++, Java, and Python among others Follow agile development/ programming best practices Document and present your progress on assigned projects Your Profile Ongoing BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering (CCE, ECE, Computer Engineering) Graduating in Fall 2026 or Spring 2027 and the internship is required by your university. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Good collaboration skills. Solid communication skills. We will keep accepting applications until 31st of December 2025 after which the recruitment process will be launched at the beginning of 2026. Aspire Software is looking for a Senior Lead Engineer (JavaScript/TypeScript, AWS) to join our team in Lebanon. Here is a little window into our company: Aspire Software operates and manages wholly owned software companies, providing mission-critical solutions across multiple verticals. By implementing industry best practices, Aspire delivers a time sensitive integration process, and the operation of a decentralized model has allowed it to become a hub for creating rapid growth by reinvesting in its portfolio. The role This is a high-impact leadership role. You’ll lead the engineering team, own core architecture decisions, and be deeply involved in product development. As a senior contributor and mentor, you’ll shape the technical direction of our Voice AI platform while fostering a strong engineering culture. You’ll be working in a startup environment—fast-paced, iterative, and always evolving. You need to be comfortable making decisions, taking ownership, and leading with clarity and purpose. What You'll Do Lead a team of engineers in an Agile environment, guiding them through planning, standups, and code reviews. Design and implement scalable front-end and back-end systems using Next.js, Elysia.js, and other JavaScript/TypeScript tools. Make key decisions on architecture, infrastructure, and deployment pipelines. Manage and optimize SQL databases and ensure strong data layer performance. Own the DevOps strategy, with hands-on experience deploying and managing applications on AWS (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, CloudWatch). Ensure high code quality and system reliability through best practices in CI/CD and testing. Mentor team members, provide technical guidance, and help scale the engineering org. Company Description Join us at Accor, where life pulses with passion! ​ As a pioneer in the art of responsible hospitality, the Accor Group gathers more than 45 brands, 5,600 hotels, 10,000 restaurants, and lifestyle destinations in 110 countries. While each brand has its own personality, where you will be able to truly find yourself, they all share a common ambition: to keep innovating and challenging the status-quo.​ By joining us, you will become a Heartist®, because hospitality is, first and foremost, a work of heart.​ You will join a caring environment and a team where you can be all you are. You will be in a supportive place to grow, to fulfil yourself, to discover other professions and to pursue career opportunities, in your hotel or in other hospitality environments, in your country or anywhere in the world!​ You will enjoy exclusive benefits, specific to the sector and beyond, as well as strong recognition for your daily commitment.​ Everything you will do with us, regardless of your profession, will offer a deep sense of meaning, to create lasting, memorable and impactful experiences for your customers, for your colleagues and for the planet. Hospitality is a work of heart , ​ Join us and become a Heartist ®. Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with Forearms Security to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: Forearms Security Job Description We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented HR Assistant to join our dynamic HR team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in supporting various administrative functions within the HR department, ensuring efficient operations related to employee management and recruitment processes. Job Purpose The primary purpose of the HR Assistant is to provide administrative support to the HR department, facilitating smooth operations in employee management and recruitment. This role is essential in maintaining accurate employee records, coordinating interviews, and assisting in onboarding processes, all while contributing to a positive workplace environment. Job Duties and Responsibilities Support HR department in administrative tasks. Ensure smooth operations in employee management and recruitment. Maintain employee records and coordinate interviews. Facilitate onboarding processes. Contribute to a positive workplace environment. Qualifications Required Qualifications Strong organizational abilities. Attention to detail. Effective communication skills. Proficiency in HR software and tools. Knowledge of employee management and recruitment processes. We are currently seeking for passionate and dynamic guest focused Human Resources professionals who pride themselves on their ability to deliver extraordinary levels of customer service and provide creative solutions to our employees. As a Government Relations Officer you are responsible for processing and carrying out all transactions relating to visas, permits, licenses, registration, pertaining to employees, hotel vehicles and the hotel itself, liaising with various Government Departments and Agencies and your role will include key responsibilities such as: • Process all types of visas including employment visas, residence visas for employees as well as for entertainers • Process and renew of permits and licenses including hotel trade license, liquor trading license, chamber of commerce certificates of registration, civil defense certificate for the hotel, etc. • Process and renew of entertainers permits/N.O.C through Department of Tourism • Registration process and renew for all hotel vehicles • Obtain permits for special promotions such as raffles, publishing or advertisement displays as required • Be up to date with regard to any changes or amendments to the prevailing laws / rules / regulations, changes in forms / formats and other procedures and keep the Human Resources Department advised of such changes • Submit relevant documents periodically to the immigration / labour office with regard to cancelled / absconding employees and delete from the hotel’s sponsorship list • Complete departure and exit formalities for employees after cancellation of visas • Obtain quarterly sponsorship reports from the immigration / labour office and tally sponsorships and re-submit to immigration / labour office with relevant support documents We are currently seeking for passionate and dynamic guest focused Human Resources professionals who pride themselves on their ability to deliver extraordinary levels of customer service and provide creative solutions to our employees. Job Title Help Desk Support Job Scope The Help Desk Support is accountable for providing IT support services to end users in an efficient and timely manner. Main Duties and Responsibilities Act as the first level of contact to end users, attend to issues and provide technical assistance as needed Work with end users to identify and deliver required service levels through installing, configuring, testing, maintaining and troubleshooting Perform analysis and diagnosis of identified issues and implement corrective solutions while tracking documentations of respective failures and repairs Implement security policies and password settings and monitor anti-virus among other applications Perform hardware and software installations, configurations and updates as needed Properly escalate unresolved queries to the next level of support within set timeframes Update the employee database on all servers including but not limited to new hires, leavers and transfers Attend to complaints as high priority in coordination with the direct manager Assess existing workflows and suggest improvements where needed #LI-RS2 Position Requirements Education Bachelor’s / Technical degree in Computer Science or any related field Experience At least 1-3 years of relevant experience Job Title Help Desk Support Job Scope Help Desk Support Job Scope The Help Desk Support is accountable for providing IT support services to end users in an efficient and timely manner. Job Summary We’re hiring a Waitress at Little Krazy, a whimsical fine-dinning restaurant. As a Captain Waitress , you will take customer orders, provide detailed knowledge of the menu, make personalized recommendations, and ensure every guest feels the rhythm, warmth, and energy of Saudi hospitality. This role combines professional service, salesmanship, and storytelling flair to deliver a unique and memorable dining journey. You’re not just waiting tables — you’re setting the stage for an unforgettable experience. You’ll be welcoming guests with energy, unique flair, and a bold personality. Your presence, voice, and energy should echo that spirit. Whether it’s through a warm smile, storytelling, or helping guests discover new flavors, your job is to turn every visit into a cultural experience. Key Responsibilities: Warmly greet guests with enthusiasm. Present, explain, and promote the menu, including specials, ingredients, preparation methods, and cultural context. Proactively upsell premium dishes, chef’s specials, signature drinks, and desserts to enhance the guest experience and boost revenue. Make confident, thoughtful recommendations based on guest preferences and dietary needs. Accurately take food and beverage orders and input them into the POS system. Ensure guest satisfaction throughout the meal and anticipate their needs proactively. Handle complaints or concerns promptly and professionally, escalating when necessary. Embody and express the spirit of the theme through language, tone, energy, and style of service. Maintain full knowledge of all food and beverage offerings, including allergens and dietary options. Work closely with kitchen and bar staff to ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment. Assist in table setting and resetting according to restaurant standards. Maintain a clean and organized service area. Uphold hygiene and grooming standards and wear the designated themed uniform with pride. Job Title: Senior Software Engineer (JavaScript/TypeScript, AWS) SAD con
Description: Aspire Software is looking for a Senior Lead Engineer (JavaScript/TypeScript, AWS) to join our team in Lebanon. Here is a little window into our company: Aspire Software operates and manages wholly owned software companies, providing mission-critical solutions across multiple verticals. By implementing industry best practices, Aspire delivers a time sensitive integration process, and the operation of a decentralized model has allowed it to become a hub for creating rapid growth by reinvesting in its portfolio. The role This is a high-impact leadership role. You’ll lead the engineering team, own core architecture decisions, and be deeply involved in product development. As a senior contributor and mentor, you’ll shape the technical direction of our Voice AI platform while fostering a strong engineering culture. You’ll be working in a startup environment—fast-paced, iterative, and always evolving. You need to be comfortable making decisions, taking ownership, and leading with clarity and purpose. What You'll Do Lead a team of engineers in an Agile environment, guiding them through planning, standups, and code reviews. Design and implement scalable front-end and back-end systems using Next.js, Elysia.js, and other JavaScript/TypeScript tools. Make key decisions on architecture, infrastructure, and deployment pipelines. Manage and optimize SQL databases and ensure strong data layer performance. Own the DevOps strategy, with hands-on experience deploying and managing applications on AWS (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, CloudWatch). Ensure high code quality and system reliability through best practices in CI/CD and testing. Mentor team members, provide technical guidance, and help scale the engineering org. About the job Legal Counsel A construction firm based in Lebanon and KSA is currently seeking a Legal Counsel in Lebanon in the construction industry. This is an excellent opportunity for a legal professional with 1 to 2 years of experience to provide comprehensive legal support within the construction sector. Responsibilities : - Contract Management and Advisory : Draft, review, and negotiate various contracts, including subcontract agreements, NDAs, consultancy agreements, and service contracts. - Documentation Support : Assist in preparing and reviewing project-related documentation and correspondence with clients, consultants, and subcontractors. - Legal Issue Resolution : Support project teams in addressing contractual and legal issues during project execution. - Legal Research : Conduct preliminary legal research and prepare memoranda on contractual, regulatory, and compliance matters. - Corporate Governance : Maintain corporate records, including drafting board and shareholders resolutions and powers of attorney. - Framework Implementation : Assist in implementing corporate governance frameworks, policies, and procedures. - Coordination with External Counsel : Coordinate with external counsel on corporate and regulatory matters under the supervision of the General Counsel. - Legal Administration : Maintain and organize legal files, databases, and contract tracking systems. - Internal Liaison : Liaise with internal departments (Procurement, HR, Finance, etc.) to ensure alignment on legal aspects of their operations. ﻿Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in Law from a recognized university (Masters degree is a plus). 1 to 2 years of relevant experience in a corporate or law firm environment, preferably in the construction sector. Solid understanding of commercial and contract law principles. Strong drafting and analytical skills with attention to detail. Excellent command of English and Arabic (written and spoken); French is a plus. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). ﻿Personal Attributes : High sense of integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities. Strong organizational and time management abilities. Collaborative and team-oriented mindset. Summary: We are seeking a skilled and creative Pastry Chef to join our kitchen team. The Pastry Chef will be responsible for preparing a wide variety of desserts, pastries, and baked goods. Job Responsibility: - Create and prepare high-quality desserts such as cakes, cookies, pies, and pastries - Develop new recipes and innovative dessert offerings - Ensure all pastry products are made in accordance with established recipes and presentation standards - Oversee the pastry kitchen operations, including ordering ingredients, managing inventory, and maintaining equipment - Train and supervise pastry assistants and other kitchen staff members Candidate Requirements: - Proven experience as a Pastry Chef or in a similar role - In-depth knowledge of baking techniques and pastry ingredients - Creative and artistic skills to develop new recipes and designs - Strong organizational and time management skills - Excellent teamwork and leadership abilities Summary: We are seeking a skilled and creative Pastry Chef to join our kitchen team. About Us We are a global climate technologies company engineered for sustainability. We create sustainable and efficient residential, commercial and industrial spaces through HVACR technologies. We protect temperature-sensitive goods throughout the cold chain. And we bring comfort to people globally. Best-in-class engineering, design and manufacturing combined with category-leading brands in compression, controls, software and monitoring solutions result in next-generation climate technology that is built for the needs of the world ahead. Whether you are a professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring your first opportunity, or recent graduate with an advanced degree, we have opportunities that will allow you to innovate, be challenged and make an impact. Join our team and start your journey today! Position: Assembler Job Title: Assembler Grade : 1 Location : Warehouse SUMMARY Manual duties related to placing parts on an assembly line process, checking defined machine specifications on the assembly line, or performing other related functions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Maintains safe and clean working environment, complying with safety rules Execute job tasks as defined in work instructions posted in assigned work area (OMS document) Flexibility to perform Non-Standard Work as directed by floor leader Placement of component parts on assembly line as required by OMS (Operations Method Sheet) Ability to achieve training milestones and complete training protocols Acquire knowledge and perform work at multiple work stations or work areas assigned QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE High school diploma or GED required. Previous manufacturing experience is preferred. PHYSICAL DEMANDS Ability to stand on hard surfaces for extended periods while performing functions of the job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; reach overhead with hands and arms; grasp; stoop; kneel; and/or crouch. Must meet job standards for visual ability, speaking, and hearing in a manufacturing environment. Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 65 pounds. Environmental conditions include flashing lights on machines and Powered Industrial Vehicles, random noises such as horns and alarms. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Copeland is an equal opportunity employer . We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, sex, religion, age, national origin, color, disability, veteran status, or genetic information. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. Our Commitment to Our People Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: Sustainability is no small ambition. That’s why everything we do is geared toward a sustainable future—for our generation and all those to come. Through groundbreaking innovations, HVACR technology and cold chain solutions, we are reducing carbon emissions and improving energy efficiency in spaces of all sizes, from residential to commercial to industrial. Our employees are our greatest strength. We believe that our culture of passion, openness, and collaboration empowers us to work toward the same goal - to make the world a better place. We invest in the end-to-end development of our people, beginning at onboarding and through senior leadership, so they can thrive personally and professionally. Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer the right options to meet your individual/family needs: medical insurance plans, dental and vision coverage, 401(k) and more. We provide employees with flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave, vacation and holiday leave. Together, we have the opportunity – and the power – to continue to revolutionize the technology behind air conditioning, heating and refrigeration, and cultivate a better future. Learn more about us and how you can join our team! Our Commitment to Inclusion & Belonging At Copeland, we cultivate a strong sense of inclusion and belonging where individuals of all backgrounds, and with diverse perspectives, are embraced and treated fairly to enable a stronger workforce. Our employee resource groups play an important role in culture and community building at Copeland. Work Authorization Copeland will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1 with OPT or CPT, H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire. Equal Opportunity Employer Copeland is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. Job Title: Senior Mobile Developer Engineer (React Native)- OLX Lebanon
Description: About OLX OLX Lebanon is the #1 marketplace for selling and buying online in Lebanon. Our aim is to upgrade people’s lives by facilitating deals and identifying attractive opportunities for individuals and businesses. Our broader vision is to strengthen local economies, empower small businesses and help everyone in making smarter choices for themselves, the market and the planet. OLX Lebanon is proudly rooted in the local market while bringing global marketplace standards to our users. Our team is driven by innovation, agility, and a deep understanding of the Lebanese consumer landscape. We embrace a culture of ownership, creativity, and purpose—where every team member contributes to building smarter solutions that truly make a difference in people’s everyday lives. About the role As a Senior Mobile Developer Engineer (React Native), you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high-quality mobile applications that align with business goals and deliver consistent, user-focused experiences. Work closely with other teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues. Support a variety of products with a strong focus on automation, performance, availability, and overall reliability. Collaborate closely with engineers and business intelligence teams throughout the sprint cycle—before, during, and after—to ensure seamless delivery and continuous improvement. Build an industry-leading platform which is relentlessly focused on innovation. Write architecturally sound and maintainable code following OLX’s programming practices. Work in a mentoring capacity within a peer-programming environment and provide guidance on tasks, irrespective of complexity or scale. Handle the entire software development life cycle, end-to-end. Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability and reliability. Work with our testing team to ensure 100% test coverage. Discover and implement the newest technologies. About OLX OLX Lebanon is the #1 marketplace for selling and buying online in Lebanon. Our aim is to upgrade people’s lives by facilitating deals and identifying attractive opportunities for individuals and businesses. Our broader vision is to strengthen local economies, empower small businesses and help everyone in making smarter choices for themselves, the market and the planet. OLX Lebanon is proudly rooted in the local market while bringing global marketplace standards to our users. Our team is driven by innovation, agility, and a deep understanding of the Lebanese consumer landscape. We embrace a culture of ownership, creativity, and purpose—where every team member contributes to building smarter solutions that truly make a difference in people’s everyday lives. About The Role The DevOps Engineer Backend ensures the stability, scalability, and automation of OLX Lebanon’s digital infrastructure. This role bridges software development and operations, enabling continuous integration and continuous delivery of products with efficiency and reliability.You will collaborate closely with development teams from initial design through deployment, leveraging your experience in Terraform, AWS, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines. Additionally, you will either bring experience with Laravel or demonstrate the ability and willingness to learn it quickly to better support our PHP-based backend systems. Serve as a primary owner of production infrastructure health, ensuring system performance, scalability, and reliability. Design, build, and manage AWS infrastructure using Terraform and infrastructure-as-code best practices. Implement and optimize CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions, Jenkins, and Docker, enabling seamless automated deployments. Collaborate with Laravel development teams to ensure DevOps support aligns with application architecture and performance needs. Maintain secure, monitored, and highly available systems and services. Develop automation tools to support monitoring, scaling, and deployment processes. Manage and optimize Kubernetes (EKS) clusters, containers, and orchestration workflows. Troubleshoot and resolve issues across application, infrastructure, and networking layers. Support migrations from legacy environments to modern AWS-based infrastructures with minimal downtime. Participate in 24/7 on-call rotations to ensure system uptime and incident resolution. Document infrastructure designs, deployment procedures, and troubleshooting guides. About the job Administrative Assistant A construction firm based in Lebanon and KSA is currently seeking an Administrative Assistant in Lebanon within its Legal Department. This is an excellent opportunity for a professional with 2 to 4 years of experience to provide comprehensive administrative support within a legal environment. Responsibilities : Administrative and Office Support : Manage daily administrative tasks of the Legal Department, including correspondence, filing, scheduling, and documentation control. Prepare, format, and proofread legal documents, contracts, and official correspondence under the guidance of the Legal Team. Maintain physical and electronic filing systems for contracts, legal opinions, and governance documents. Coordination and Communication : Serve as a point of contact between the Legal Department and other departments (Procurement, HR, Finance, Projects, etc.) to facilitate document circulation and follow-ups. Coordinate with external law firms, notaries, and government authorities for document submissions, certifications, and legalization processes. Document and Data Management : Assist in maintaining the legal database and contract tracking registers. Support the management of digital records and ensure compliance with internal document control policies. Prepare summaries, status tables, and periodic reports for the General Counsel and Legal Counsel(s). Qualifications : Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Law, or a related field. 2 to 4 years of experience in administrative or executive support, preferably in a legal, corporate, or professional services environment. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); experience with document management systems is an asset. Excellent command of English and Arabic (written and spoken); French is an asset. Familiarity with legal or corporate documentation processes is desirable. Personal Attributes : High level of professionalism, integrity, and discretion. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities with attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to manage time effectively and work under pressure. Team-oriented with a proactive and positive attitude. Job Title: Lighting Operations Officer – Interior & Lighting Division
Description: Company Description A reputable interior design company is seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Lighting Operations Officer to join our Lebanon team on a full-time basis. The ideal candidate will play a key role in supporting the lighting department’s operations, ensuring efficient order fulfillment, smooth coordination across departments, and high customer satisfaction. Location: Lebanon Type: Full-time Job Description Key Responsibilities • Support the lighting department in achieving sales and operational targets. • Monitor stock levels, prepare order requests, and coordinate approvals to maintain optimal inventory. • Verify invoices and update relevant ERP systems to ensure accuracy in codes, pricing, and timing. • Follow up on production and assembly schedules, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery. • Coordinate with logistics, procurement, accounting, and sales teams to ensure seamless order execution. • Track client orders and provide proactive updates to the Lighting Sales Manager. • Oversee the CRM system to monitor and resolve customer service tickets efficiently. • Issue weekly reports on order status, fulfillment, and department performance. • Support the sales team in managing client needs and ensuring smooth project delivery. Qualifications Requirements • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, or a related technical field. • 2–3 years of experience in sales operations or a similar role (lighting or interior background preferred). • Strong organizational and coordination skills. • Proficiency in ERP systems (especially sales modules) and MS Office. • Fluent in English and Arabic. • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines under pressure. Our Opportunity We are looking for a Microsoft Data & Analytics Developer to design, develop, and maintain a complete Microsoft data analytics ecosystem, leveraging Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Azure Data Lake, and Copilot/AI-based tools for analysis and conversational querying. ​ You Will Architecture & Development Design and implement Microsoft Fabric-based data lake architecture. Set up and manage data pipelines for ingestion from multiple sources (APIs, databases, Excel, SharePoint, etc.). Ensure data governance, lineage, and compliance with security and privacy requirements. Automate ETL/ELT processes using Data Factory, Synapse, or Power Query. Dashboards & Reporting Develop interactive dashboards and visual reports using Power BI. Establish data models, KPIs, and drill-through capabilities aligned with business needs. Enable self-service BI for departments and non-technical users. AI and Conversational Analytics Implement “Talk to Your Data” capabilities via Power BI Copilot, Fabric AI experiences, or Azure OpenAI integration. Train semantic models to allow natural-language queries and explainable responses. Support predictive analytics and scenario modeling (forecasting, trends, anomalies). Optimization & Support Ensure data accuracy, performance optimization, and scalability. Maintain documentation for architecture, pipelines, and dashboards. Provide user training and capacity building for teams to leverage BI tools. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Engineering, or related field (Master’s preferred). 4+ years of experience with Microsoft data stack (Azure, Power BI, SQL, Fabric, Synapse, Data Factory). Proven experience designing and maintaining data lakes and data warehouses.Proficiency in DAX, Power Query (M), T-SQL, and data modeling.Experience with Copilot, Microsoft Fabric, or AI integrations is a plus. Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics is desirable.Strong understanding of data governance, metadata, and role-based access. Excellent communication skills and ability to translate business questions into analytical solutions. Benefits Siren is an equal opportunity employer. At Siren we value ethics, dedication, sustainability, safeguarding, respect and inclusion. Are you interested in working with our dedicated team on impactful projects? We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of background. Do apply! Company Description Elite Medical Services is a growing medical supply company specializing in advanced wound care solutions and surgical products. We collaborate with hospitals, clinics, and healthcare professionals across Lebanon to deliver high-quality medical devices and consumables that improve patient outcomes. Job Description Position Overview We are looking for a motivated and results-driven Medical Representative to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for promoting our wound care and surgical product lines, building relationships with doctors and hospitals, and driving sales growth in their assigned territory. Key Responsibilities Promote and sell company products to hospitals, clinics, and healthcare professionals. Develop and maintain strong relationships with doctors, nurses, and hospital procurement teams. Conduct product demonstrations and provide training to medical staff when required. Identify new business opportunities and expand the client base. Follow up on orders, payments, and customer feedback. Report daily activities, visits, and sales performance to the management team. Qualifications Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Biomedical Sciences, Nursing, Pharmacy, or a related field . Previous experience as a Medical Representative or in a medical sales role is preferred. Excellent communication and negotiation skills. Self-motivated, organized, and target-driven.
