About Anghami: Based in Abu Dhabi with offices in UAE, Lebanon, Egypt & Saudi, We’re a homemade startup with international swagger and over 120 million registered users. We're the first Arab tech company listed on New York NASDAQ stock exchange. We're the largest music and audio streaming platform in MENA. We pride ourselves with our Users and our Product. We work hard every day to understand the needs and aspiration of our users. We believe that music is ambivalent: It is as social as it is personal. And so we aim at providing users with all the tools and features that grant them the full freedom to explore, share and connect through music. Position Overview: We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Lifecycle Marketing Associate to support the design and execution of user lifecycle campaigns across the Anghami and OSN+ platforms. This role is a great opportunity for someone starting their career in growth and marketing, with a chance to learn hands-on how to drive engagement, subscriptions, and retention through lifecycle and CRM channels. You’ll work closely with the Lifecycle Marketing Manager and cross-functional teams (product, creative, data, and brand) to execute campaigns, monitor performance, and develop the skills needed to grow into a lifecycle marketing specialist. What You’ll Be Doing Support the setup and execution of lifecycle campaigns across key channels: email, push notifications, in-app messaging, and WhatsApp. Help manage campaign calendars and coordinate with teams to ensure timely launches. Assist in creating campaign briefs, assets, and audience targeting lists. Track and report on campaign performance using tools like spreadsheets, dashboards, and analytics platforms. Contribute to A/B tests and experiments designed to improve open rates, clicks, conversions, and retention. Partner with design, editorial, and product teams to improve user onboarding and engagement flows. Support data and CRM operations (such as campaign QA, segmentation checks, and troubleshooting). What We’re Looking For Recent graduate or up to 3 years of experience in marketing, CRM, growth, or a related field (internships count). Familiarity with email or marketing automation tools (experience with platforms like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or MoEngage is a plus). Basic understanding of marketing analytics and comfort working with spreadsheets; interest in tools like Looker, Amplitude, or Google Analytics is a plus. Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. Eagerness to learn, experiment, and develop skills in lifecycle marketing and growth. Detail-oriented, resourceful, and collaborative, with strong communication skills. Nice to Have Experience (internship or project) in subscription businesses, OTT, or streaming platforms. Knowledge of SQL or basic data querying. Fluency in Arabic is a plus but not required. About the job Product Manager - Cardio We are seeking a highly dedicated Cardio Product Manager in Beirut, Lebanon. A knowledgeable and strategic product manager will formulate and implement effective sales strategies aimed at maximizing the use and market penetration of cardio products. The manager will drive growth in sales and market share while anticipating and effectively managing business opportunities and challenges. Responsibilities: Scheduling meetings with potential and existing clients. Presenting and promoting company products to healthcare professionals, and leveraging effective selling techniques. Collaborating with internal teams to provide valuable insights and market feedback. Preparing detailed sales reports, analyzing market trends, and submitting timely purchase orders to relevant departments. Assessing customer needs, recommending and presenting products that align with those needs, and driving product usage within healthcare settings. Identifying and pursuing new business opportunities to expand product sales, resolving customer complaints, and negotiating terms of sale effectively to secure deals. Developing and maintaining strong relationships with new and existing clients by providing exceptional after-sales service and ongoing support. Organizing conferences and group events for medical professionals to increase product visibility. Regularly attending industry events, training sessions, company meetings, and workshops to remain current with developments. Conducting market research on competitors products, pricing strategies, and success rates. About Us We are a global climate technologies company engineered for sustainability. We create sustainable and efficient residential, commercial and industrial spaces through HVACR technologies. We protect temperature-sensitive goods throughout the cold chain. And we bring comfort to people globally. Best-in-class engineering, design and manufacturing combined with category-leading brands in compression, controls, software and monitoring solutions result in next-generation climate technology that is built for the needs of the world ahead. Whether you are a professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring your first opportunity, or recent graduate with an advanced degree, we have opportunities that will allow you to innovate, be challenged and make an impact. Join our team and start your journey today! If you are a Team Lead professional and looking for an opportunity to grow, Copeland has an exciting opportunity for you! Based out of our Lebanon, MO location, you will supervise and coordinate activities of production, while driving to achieve a positive safety culture. Work with all departments to achieve goals. As A Team Leader You Will: Drive safety initiatives to improve safety culture and performance, steer safety performance accountability across all areas of responsibility Consults with Center Of Excellence (COE) organizations; attendance and performance tracking, investigations, terminations, employee inquiries, and driving team member support Leads Lean Daily Management in responsible areas to include key metric tracking, action item generation and completion, presenting daily to direct reports and various staff stakeholders Oversees daily production scheduling and operation of assembly team: Directs machine setup and compliance checks of assembly process Plans and assigns manning requirements for daily production schedule Make staffing or procedure adjustments according to supplied manufacturing schedule Lead problem solving initiatives to address production and quality concerns Consults with stakeholders on build priority and other activities requiring coordination Conduct applicant interviews and hiring recommendations Responsible for employee survey scoring and generating action items to improve overall employee engagement Estimates, requisitions, and inspects materials used in product production Deliver production within quality standards and customer expectations Operates within a Continuous Improvement mindset, suggesting improvement and efficiencies to the operation and to the work environment Supports team members with workplace policy and practices questions; makes recommendations on workplace behavior accountability Completes recordkeeping requirements in a timely manner Drives employee engagement in all activities including promoting our safety culture Partners with others to ensure training of new associates is successful Works and carries themselves in a manner consistent with Copeland values: Excellence, Innovation, Partnership, Respect, Responsibility REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS: GED or high school diploma Two (2) years of experience in manufacturing Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Proficient in Decision Quality Competency within a multi-tasking environment Legal authorization to work in the United States - Sponsorship will not be provided for this position. PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS: Associate degree or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school 5 plus years of manufacturing leadership experience Experience with timekeeping and attendance tracking systems (Kronos) Experience with HRIS systems (Workday) Experience with COE (Center of Excellence) PHYSICAL DEMANDS While performing the duties of this job, the employee would be required to: ability to stand on manufacturing floor for 10 hours per day; sit at desk and working on computer; navigate manufacturing areas to access components; have visual acuity to properly inspect and discern prints and components; have manual dexterity to handle components; lift up to 35 pounds at a time. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Support Personnel: Our teams work together to ensure their chosen work schedules are supporting our customers. These jobs typically work a 5-day work week. Why Work in the Lebanon, MO Area Our facility in Lebanon, MO is located on Interstate 44 and Historic Route 66 in the scenic Ozarks of South-Central Missouri. We enjoy a small-town community with a Lebanon population of 14,628 and Laclede County population of 36,069. Our area is known for Bennett Spring State Park, lakes, rivers, hunting, and fishing. Lebanon is home to several boat manufacturers and two stock-car racing tracks. Lebanon is also centrally located, just 1 hour from the city of Springfield and 2.5 hours from St. Louis. Why not work and play where you can make your vacation home your “home”? We are only 35 minutes from the world-famous Lake of the Ozarks. For the outdoor enthusiasts, we have Bennett Spring, MO, which is an unincorporated community and home of the Bennett Spring State Park, which has the third or fourth largest natural spring in the state with an average daily flow of about 100-million gallons. Bennett Spring is home of Missouri’s largest trout park, featuring fishing, camping, hiking, dining, and lodging. We also have the Niangua River, which is host to numerous campgrounds, canoes, rafts, and kayaks, and is a premier water attraction for outdoor enthusiasts. About Our Location Our plant in Lebanon, MO is Copeland’s flagship operation for scroll compressor assembly and a machining powerhouse for main bearing housings and scroll elements, with over 60 million scroll compressors produced in the past 27 years. Our Commitment to Our People Across the globe, we are united by a singular Purpose: Sustainability is no small ambition. That’s why everything we do is geared toward a sustainable future—for our generation and all those to come. Through groundbreaking innovations, HVACR technology and cold chain solutions, we are reducing carbon emissions and improving energy efficiency in spaces of all sizes, from residential to commercial to industrial. Our employees are our greatest strength. We believe that our culture of passion, openness, and collaboration empowers us to work toward the same goal - to make the world a better place. We invest in the end-to-end development of our people, beginning at onboarding and through senior leadership, so they can thrive personally and professionally. Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer the right options to meet your individual/family needs: medical insurance plans, dental and vision coverage, 401(k) and more. We provide employees with flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave, vacation and holiday leave. Together, we have the opportunity – and the power – to continue to revolutionize the technology behind air conditioning, heating and refrigeration, and cultivate a better future. Learn more about us and how you can join our team! Our Commitment to Inclusion & Belonging At Copeland, we cultivate a strong sense of inclusion and belonging where individuals of all backgrounds, and with diverse perspectives, are embraced and treated fairly to enable a stronger workforce. Our employee resource groups play an important role in culture and community building at Copeland. Work Authorization Copeland will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1 with OPT or CPT, H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire. Equal Opportunity Employer Copeland is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. We are currently seeking for passionate and dynamic guest focused Sales professionals who pride themselves on their ability to deliver extraordinary levels of customer service and provide creative solutions to our guests. As a Sales Executive you are responsible to implement all sales activities and maximize business opportunities in your specific area of responsibility under the general guidance and supervision. The role involves generating and maintaining customers of defined accounts and areas through sales activities like face to face sales calls, telephone calls or entertainment and will include key responsibilities such as: • Maintain a high level of exposure for the hotel through direct sales • Ensure comprehensive and complete coverage of own portfolio, covering all levels of accounts’ managerial and departmental executives for a comprehensive client servicing, achieving targets and maximum productivity • Implement and execute all sales objectives and action plans to reach and exceed targets set • Solicit and serve transient and group business and meetings • Ensure that selling strategies are adhered to during negotiations and maximize up selling opportunities whenever possible • Ensure comprehensive and up to date knowledge of properties’ unique selling points, features, amenities, services and policies • Formulate corporate offer letters and yearly contracts and any other required business correspondence • Provide feedback on changing marketing conditions, including trends in the competition, as a result of direct sales solicitation, telephone and / or direct mail We are currently seeking for passionate and dynamic guest focused Sales professionals who pride themselves on their ability to deliver extraordinary levels of customer service and provide creative solutions to our guests. Job Description Role Summary: The incumbent is responsible for managing the collection of client dues and client follow-up. Main Duties • Collect client payments • Reconcile daily cash receipt after end of day • Deliver needed documents (statement of accounts, credit notes, invoices, delivery notes) to clients and submit signed copies to Collection Coordinator • Report counter readings to Account Manager or Collection Coordinator • Assist customers with any issues regarding their accounts and coordinate with corresponding Account Manager • Report client issues to Collection Coordinator or Account Manager when needed • Report customer claims to Collection Coordinator or Account Manager, or place a direct complaint task when appropriate • Respond to ad-hoc requests in a timely manner Qualifications • Lebanese or Technical Baccalaureate (BT) • Fluent in spoken and written Arabic, with basic foreign language knowledge Technical knowledge, skills & abilities required • Familiar with functionality of PDAs Soft skills required • Honest and trust-worthy • Attentive • Good customer service skills • Flexible and able to work to tight deadlines Role Summary: The incumbent is responsible for managing the collection of client dues and client follow-up. Company Description Join a hotel that is a member of the Accor network, whose group brings together more than 45 brands, 5,500 hotels, 10,000 restaurants and lifestyle destinations. Here, we believe in you and what you bring to the table. There are many opportunities for development and advancement. Every gesture, every smile, every action, contributes to creating a positive and memorable impact for our customers, our colleagues and also for our planet. Together, we embody the vision of responsible hospitality. Take the opportunity to become a Heartist®, and let your heart guide you in this world where life beats faster. Job Description Greet guests warmly and professionally upon arrival and departure. Assist guests with luggage handling, including loading and unloading luggage from vehicles. Transport guest luggage to and from guest rooms. Provide information about the hotel and local area, including dining options, attractions, and transportation. Answer guest inquiries and address their concerns promptly and courteously. Assist with guest requests such as arranging transportation, making reservations, and delivering messages. Maintain a clean and organized bell desk and luggage storage area. Assist with valet parking services (if applicable). Assist with setting up and breaking down meeting rooms or event spaces as needed. Ensure the safety and security of guest belongings. Proactively identify and address guest needs. Resolve guest complaints and issues effectively and efficiently. Strive to exceed guest expectations at all times Qualifications Excellent customer service skills Strong communication skills Ability to work well under pressure Physical fitness, as the job involves lifting and carrying luggage Positive and friendly attitude Professional appearance and demeanor Previous experience in the hospitality industry preferred, but not always required. Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to lift and carry heavy luggage. Ability to stand for extended periods. Professional appearance and demeanor. Overview: Our client, a leading company in the agro-engineering and agricultural infrastructure sector, is seeking an experienced and results-oriented Head of Sales to lead revenue growth and margin performance for large-scale and turnkey greenhouse projects across the GCC and Levant, while developing new markets in Australia, Africa, and other high-potential regions. The mission is to build and lead a high-performing sales organization, drive market expansion, and maintain a competitive edge through data-driven decision-making and strategic partnerships. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute a 3-year go-to-market plan for GCC/Levant and expansion into Australia, Africa, and emerging regions. Conduct market studies covering demand, crop suitability, regulations, competitors, and partnerships. Define entry strategies per country and secure initial flagship projects. Lead the full enterprise sales cycle for turnkey greenhouse projects, from lead generation to contract negotiation and handover. Oversee tendering, pricing, risk assessment, and bid strategies while ensuring margin protection. Build and maintain relationships with strategic clients, growers, government programs, and agro-industrial developers. Identify and manage agents, distributors, EPC partners, and financial collaborators. Coordinate with suppliers to design competitive bundled offers. Recruit, train, and manage regional sales teams across multiple countries. Standardize sales processes, proposal templates, and contractual terms. Champion CRM adoption, reporting accuracy, and performance tracking. Collaborate with Engineering, Supply Chain, Finance, and Marketing teams to align project delivery, pricing, and promotion strategies. Ensure compliance with trade regulations, anti-corruption policies, and HSE standards. Travel up to 60% across assigned regions. Requirements 8–12+ years in B2B capital equipment, construction, or agri-engineering project sales, including at least 4 years managing multi-country teams. Proven track record in turnkey or EPC-style deals, ideally in greenhouses, controlled-environment agriculture (CEA), irrigation, or related industrial projects. Strong commercial and negotiation expertise (Incoterms, LCs, performance bonds, payment milestones). Proficiency in CRM tools, forecasting, and financial modeling (ROI/TCO). Excellent communication and leadership abilities. Established connections with growers, government programs, and agro-industrial developers in GCC/Levant; Australia/Africa experience is a plus. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Agronomy, or Business; MBA preferred. Fluent in English; Arabic strongly preferred; French is a plus. Competitive base salary with performance-based commission and bonuses, car allowance, travel coverage, and relocation support. Job Title: Executive Chef – Four Seasons Hotel Beirut, Lebanon
Description: About Four Seasons: Four Seasons is powered by our people. We are a collective of individuals who crave to become better, to push ourselves to new heights and to treat each other as we wish to be treated in return. Our team members around the world create amazing experiences for our guests, residents, and partners through a commitment to luxury with genuine heart. We know that the best way to enable our people to deliver these exceptional guest experiences is through a world-class employee experience and company culture. At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating everyone we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us or discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us. About the location: Centuries-old Lebanese hospitality with a modern twist. At Four Seasons Hotel Beirut, our passionate team of local insiders can’t wait to introduce you to the people and places that make our stylish and friendly city tick. From the Hotel’s downtown location, you can set out to explore the capital’s bustling markets, admire ancient ruins, bask in the sun along our Mediterranean coastline and discover the natural wonders that lie within the snow-capped Lebanese Mountains just a short drive away. Or, simply take it all in at once from our 26th-floor rooftop, offering one of the best views in the entire city. The Role of Executive Chef: Following an extensive renovation and restoration, The Four Seasons Hotel Beirut is anticipated to reopen in 2026, marking an exciting new chapter for our property. We are now seeking a talented and visionary Executive Chef to join our leadership team and help shape the culinary identity of this iconic reopening. Reporting to the Director of Food and Beverage, you will oversee a team of approximately 80 culinary professionals and lead the daily operations across 4 Restaurants and the Sky Bar Lounge, 24 Hour In-Room Dining, Banqueting, Outside Catering, and the Employee Restaurant. In this role, you will be responsible for inspiring and developing your team, creating innovative menus that celebrate local and international flavours, and ensuring the highest levels of quality, consistency, and creativity across every dining experience. Your role will also oversee food costs, planning and budgeting, maintaining impeccable hygiene and safety standards, and ensuring that every guest interaction reflects the warmth, excellence, and attention to detail that define Four Seasons. Our Ideal Executive Chef candidate will have: A genuine passion for culinary artistry and a leadership style that inspires teamwork, creativity, and care. You will have extensive international experience as an Executive Chef in the luxury space, leading large-scale operations of over 2,000 covers daily, managing high-profile events of 600+ guests, and overseeing outside catering. You are known for your creativity, your ability to bring people together through food, and your talent for developing others. Pre-opening experience would be a valuable asset. Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts can offer what many hospitality professionals dream of; the opportunity to build a life-long career with global potential and a real sense of pride in work well done. We look for talent who share the Golden Rule – people who, by nature, believe in treating others as we would have them treat us. As Four Seasons works towards phenomenal growth in the next decade, our most valuable partners continue to be our talent, with whom we have a strong relationship based on the Golden Rule. This relationship is made tangible by the awards received year after year by Four Seasons on a corporate level, as well as by our hotels, resorts and residences around the world, making us an undisputed “employer of choice.” About Four Seasons: About Four Seasons: Four Seasons is powered by our people. Job Purpose Responsible for leading the maintenance strategy, reliability, and technical performance of all process equipment across manufacturing operations, ensuring production uptime, GMP compliance, and efficient resource utilization through structured maintenance planning and execution. Works in coordination with the Utilities and facility systems Engineer and Engineering Projects & Optimization engineer to ensure cohesive planning, execution, and optimization across the site’s technical operations. Perform duties in accordance with Malia Group Policies and Procedures. Duties And Responsibilities On Production Equipment Coverage - Manage and oversee maintenance activities for plastic production lines including injection molding and blow molding machines - Supervise maintenance of mixing vessels, agitators, homogenizers, and associated dosing and control systems in personal care and pharmaceutical production - Maintain high availability of filling and packaging lines (bottling, capping, labeling, cartooning, blistering) across both FMCG and GMP-regulated areas - Ensure reliable operation of pharmaceutical manufacturing equipment including granulators, tablet presses, coating machines, and cleanroom-embedded process systems On Maintenance Execution & Planning - Plan and schedule preventive, predictive, and corrective maintenance tasks using SAP PM, ensuring timely execution and minimal disruption to operations - Lead troubleshooting and root cause analysis of mechanical, electrical, and automation issues on production equipment - Manage spare parts inventory and critical components to avoid downtime, ensuring proper stock levels and usage tracking through SAP integration On Performance and Reliability - Monitor and improve OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness) through equipment performance analysis and reliability engineering - Standardize maintenance procedures and develop equipment-specific SOPs for daily, weekly, and overhaul-level tasks On Compliance and Documentation - Ensure maintenance activities are documented per GMP and ISO standards where applicable - Maintain calibration and validation schedules for equipment interfacing with product quality or cleanroom conditions On Safety and Continuous Improvement - Lead risk assessments and implement safety improvements related to moving machinery, line changeovers, and high-energy systems - Drive continuous improvement initiatives focused on downtime reduction, faster changeovers, and enhanced equipment reliability On Support for Capital Projects & Site Transition - Provide technical oversight during installation, commissioning, and qualification of new equipment and machinery - Support site consolidation efforts by standardizing practices and alignment between both plants - Collaborate with the Project & Capex Engineer to scope utility needs for future expansions or modifications On HR - Contribute proactively with the Talent Acquisition Team in filling vacancies timely. Design/update related JD and on-boarding programs and ensure their proper understanding & implementation. Ensure an optimized structure in line with business priorities and performance - Provide direct reports with needed resources/tools and guidance to fulfil their role properly and set their training needs and development plan in coordination with L&DM. Issue misconducts and enroll under-performers in related program - Promote the Group's culture, encourage loyalty, trust, a healthy working environment and teamwork. About the job Head of Marketing Head of Marketing Location: Beirut, Lebanon (Hybrid/Remote flexibility) Seniority: Senior Management Industry: Technology / Artificial Intelligence / SaaS / Data Analytics About the Company A fast-growing technology firm specializing in AI-driven data solutions and business intelligence , empowering organizations across multiple industries to make smarter, faster, and data-backed decisions. The company operates at the intersection of AI, cloud software, and analytics , offering enterprise-level solutions to clients in both the private and public sectors. Their mission is to simplify complex data ecosystems and unlock value through innovation, automation, and scalable technology. Role Overview The Head of Marketing will lead the company's global marketing function building, scaling, and executing a high-performance marketing engine that drives demand, enhances brand positioning, and supports enterprise sales growth. This is a hands-on leadership role for someone who has previously built or significantly scaled a marketing operation within a B2B tech, SaaS, or AI environment. Key Responsibilities Strategy & Leadership Define and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy aligned with business and revenue goals. Lead, mentor, and grow a small but high-performing marketing team (content, digital, and design). Manage marketing budgets and optimize ROI across campaigns and channels. Demand Generation Drive qualified leads through multi-channel campaigns, including LinkedIn, email, events, partnerships, and ABM. Build strong synergy with sales to generate and nurture opportunities in enterprise and government sectors. Brand & Positioning Strengthen market positioning and storytelling across the MENA and global markets. Develop value propositions, messaging, and brand identity that resonate with enterprise and government clients. Content & Thought Leadership Oversee the creation of impactful content whitepapers, case studies, blog posts, and PR campaigns. Position the company as a thought leader in the AI, SaaS, and data analytics space. Sales Enablement Collaborate with sales leadership to produce case studies, one-pagers, pitch decks, and targeted collateral. Ensure marketing materials directly support the enterprise sales cycle and accelerate deal closures. Analytics & Reporting Track and report on marketing performance metrics and ROI. Leverage data to optimize campaign performance and justify marketing spend. Requirements Bachelors degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field (MBA preferred). 8+ years of marketing experience, including 4-5 years in a leadership role . Proven success in B2B technology , AI , SaaS , or data analytics environments. Experience overseeing both demand generation and brand strategy . Demonstrated ability to build or scale a marketing function from the ground up. Background in enterprise marketing and sales enablement . Agency experience or cross-functional collaboration with agencies is a strong plus. Exceptional communication, leadership, and analytical skills. Core Competencies Demand Generation & Pipeline Growth Brand & Positioning Strategy Sales Enablement & Content Development Data-Driven Marketing Optimization Cross-Functional Leadership Expected KPIs Candidates must demonstrate measurable outcomes such as: Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs) generated per quarter % of sales pipeline influenced by marketing (target 3040%) Cost per Qualified Lead (CPL) and Cost per Opportunity (CPO) Lead-to-Opportunity conversion rates Campaign ROI (pipeline vs. spend) Sales enablement deliverables (case studies, one-pagers, etc.) Head of Marketing Head of Marketing Location: Beirut, Lebanon (Hybrid/Remote flexibility) Seniority: Senior Management Industry: Technology / Artificial Intelligence / SaaS / Data Analytics About the Company A fast-growing technology firm specializing in AI-driven data solutions and business intelligence , empowering organizations across multiple industries to make smarter, faster, and data-backed decisions. Company Description Henkel operates worldwide with leading innovations, brands and technologies in two business areas: Adhesive Technologies and Consumer Brands. Founded in 1876, Henkel looks back on more than 145 years of success. The company holds leading positions with its two business units in both industrial and consumer businesses thanks to strong brands, innovations and technologies such as Persil, Schwarzkopf and Loctite. Henkel, headquartered in Düsseldorf / Germany, counts among the most internationally aligned German-based companies in the global marketplace. Our company purpose expresses what unites us all at Henkel: Pioneers at heart for the good of generations. We are a diverse team of about 47,000 colleagues worldwide, striving to enrich and improve life every day through our products, services, and solutions. Our Purpose is built from our roots and carries a long-standing legacy of innovation, responsibility, and sustainability into the future. Our shared values and Leadership Commitments guide our decisions and actions every day. Job Description Henkel Lebanon is currently looking for a Financial Controller who is responsible for updating sales forecast, reviewing cost structure, providing financial dashboards to marketing & sales and extracting and submitting rolling forecast. Key Responsibilities: Manage RFC files: update sales forecasts, review cost structures, prepare dashboards for Sales and Marketing, and submit rolling forecasts Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports in line with deadlines set by Henkel Germany Develop SKU reports by brand and by country Compile monthly financial reviews by brand as requested by the Marketing department Conduct promotion simulations and assessments to evaluate feasibility and recommend improvements Monitor and track sales rebates and discounts to support the Sales team in optimizing investments Generate variance reports to assess the impact of cost fluctuations on profitability Support the Business Controller with financial presentations and special projects Qualifications Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role Proficiency in Arabic and English; French is a plus Strong skills in Microsoft Excel Additional Information If you are interested, please send your resume to [email protected] Henkel operates worldwide with leading innovations, brands and technologies in two business areas: Adhesive Technologies and Consumer Brands. Job Purpose Responsible for developing, optimizing and enhancing product formulations in line with international standards, cost targets, and consumer needs. Responsible for staying up to date on latest trends and competitors’ new launches and technological innovations. Responsible for providing technical leadership, mentorship, and data-driven insights to support the department’s strategic objectives. Perform duties in accordance with Malia Group Policies and Procedures. Duties And Responsibilities On Formulation & Cost Saving - Develop new formulas and enhance existing ones according to International norms & cost reduction plans while performing needed tests to ensure compatibility of ingredients - Improve existing formulas by evaluating data sheets, requesting samples, assigning tasks & approving final stability results for raw materials, while ensuring both quality enhancement and cost reduction - Lead the development of new product formulations aligned with emerging industry trends, market briefs, and consumer needs - Utilize and leverage data-driven and AI-powered approaches to maximize stability, sensory quality, and economic efficiency in formulations - Compare formulation designs against leading international references to benchmark and ensure competitive performance and quality - Translate research insights and innovation concepts into lab-tested, validated prototypes ready for scale-up - Identify, recommend, and technically validate cost-optimization initiatives while safeguarding product quality - Support the R&D Manager in implementing cost-saving strategies across Cosmaline's portfolio On Regulatory - Update all regulatory-related files upon changes in requirements, and inform concerned parties - Ensure the conformity of all formulas (Existing & newly developed) with the updated EU Regulations and country requirements On R&D activities - Evaluate product briefs and provide recommendations supported by market research and technical insights - Assist R&D Scientists in all development activities - Prepare and deliver product samples to the Product Development team upon request - Provide the Marketing and Product Development teams with all required information, ingredient details, and codes to support the design process - Review and approve project artworks prior to production to ensure accuracy and compliance - Communicate formulas and processing instructions to the Production team for proper system entry and execution - Ensure timely availability of raw and packaging material documents to avoid project delays - Stay up to date on the latest trends and innovations in the cosmetic and personal care field by conducting continuous research - Research and share relevant technical articles with the Product Development team for future projects On Production - Validate the first production batch in both manufacturing and packing departments - Assist the production team in solving formulation-related issues during production. Update the batch processing instructions accordingly and provide needed training to concerned - Assist the Quality Control team in solving non-conformities of raw and packaging material deviated from the approved specifications On Testing - Perform stability testing for all existing formulas and raw materials - Perform needed monthly testing and analysis on near expiry raw materials to avoid any non-conformity risks On Reporting - Provide constructive feedback to R&D Supervisor and Manager on process improvements and development opportunities - Maintain logbooks and keep accurate conclusions and records - Prepare and submit reports (sample tracking, cost optimization, audits, etc.) to the concerned managers On Mentorship & R&D 2.0 Enablement - Mentor R&D Scientists on formulation techniques, documentation standards, and innovation methods - Support the adoption and implementation of the department's strategy: design thinking, agile project work, AI integration and other needed strategic practices - Contribute to idea-generation sessions and guide feasibility testing of new concepts - Act as a technical sounding board for the R&D Supervisor and Manager on complex formulations On Communication - Communicate on the effectiveness of open innovation initiatives, including key partnerships, ideas generated, and the acceleration of projects through external collaboration Responsible for developing, optimizing and enhancing product formulations in line with international standards, cost targets, and consumer needs. Responsible for staying up to date on latest trends and competitors’ new launches and technological innovations. Responsible for providing technical leadership, mentorship, and data-driven insights to support the department’s strategic objectives. Company Description Join a hotel that is a member of the Accor network, whose group brings together more than 45 brands, 5,500 hotels, 10,000 restaurants and lifestyle destinations. Here, we believe in you and what you bring to the table. There are many opportunities for development and advancement. Every gesture, every smile, every action, contributes to creating a positive and memorable impact for our customers, our colleagues and also for our planet. Together, we embody the vision of responsible hospitality. Take the opportunity to become a Heartist®, and let your heart guide you in this world where life beats faster. Company: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
Description: Deadline for Applications October 23, 2025 Hardship Level (not applicable for home-based) C Family Type (not applicable for home-based) Family Staff Member / Affiliate Type UNOPS LICA7 Target Start Date 2025-12-01 Terms of Reference Operational Context: Lebanon hosts the highest number of refugees per capita globally, with over 1.3 million displaced Syrians and thousands of other refugees and asylum seekers. Refugees live across nearly all municipalities, relying heavily on humanitarian assistance amid deepening economic, financial, and political crises, compounded by recent hostilities and large-scale internal displacement. Cash assistance is a core part of UNHCR’s response, preferred by affected populations for its dignity, flexibility, and impact. It supports access to essential services and stimulates local economies, delivered through secure financial systems with strong data protection. UNHCR’s Multipurpose cash assistance (MCAP) programme in Lebanon is among the largest cash programmes for UNHCR globally and has for years been recognized as a flagship model, particularly for its advanced targeting systems. In 2025, UNHCR continues to lead the targeting for cash assistance in close collaboration with UN partners and other stakeholders. The selected candidate, a key member of the Cash Based Interventions Team, plays a key role in ensuring the credibility and technical integrity of this system, supporting data-driven decision-making and maintaining trust with partners, donors, and stakeholders. Desired Candidate Profile: The ideal candidate brings: - Proficiency in statistical and data processing software (e.g., STATA, R, Python, SPSS, SQL) and econometric modelling techniques. - Competence in visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau. - Strong quantitative and analytical skills, including experience with regression analysis, time-series, and panel data models. - Experience with advanced modelling techniques (deep learning and natural language processing). - Strong communication skills particularly ability to interpret and communicate complex analytical results to non-technical audiences. - Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills. - Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, while contributing effectively. - Experience with socio-economic indicators, survey design, and data visualization tools. - Exposure to displacement dynamics, vulnerability drivers, and socio-economic conditions in crisis settings is considered an asset. TERMS OF REFERENCE: 1. General Background According to government estimates, Lebanon hosts just over 1 million displaced refugees from Syrian and other nationalities. The 2025 Vulnerability Assessment of Syrian Refugees (VASyR) highlights 72% of families living in poverty and 60% in extreme poverty. In 2025, UNHCR, WFP, and partners provided monthly multipurpose cash and food assistance to around 176,500 vulnerable refugee families. Given the scale of needs and growing funding constraints, a reliable targeting system is essential. UNHCR, WFP, and sectoral partners use an econometric model—based on VASyR expenditure data and applied to UNHCR’s database—to predict household vulnerability. This proxy means test is recalibrated annually to maintain accuracy. To enhance protection sensitivity, the proxy means test approach is complemented by a categorical/profiling layer to address prevalence of specific needs enduring higher expenses. The incumbent will be part of UNHCR’s Cash-Based Interventions Unit in Beirut, reporting to the Assistant Econometrician Officer and under the overall supervision of the Senior Programme CBI Officer. The unit comprises two international and four national staff, and collaborates closely with Programme, Protection, Registration, Communication with Communities, ICT, and other teams. 2. Purpose and Scope of Assignment The Senior Econometrician Associate will assist with continuous analysis on the statistical acceptability of the econometric formula and its appropriateness for targeting the most vulnerable families for assistance. The tasks will also contain some work to support data analysis related to the financial transactions that UNHCR undertakes while delivering humanitarian assistance through Cash-Based interventions. The Senior Econometrician Associate will: • Assist in the planning, implementation, and post-implementation phases of UNHCR’s targeting exercises including design, development, re-estimation, validation and operationalization. • Assist the ongoing refinement of the hybrid targeting approach. • Contribute to the design of an effective grievance and redress mechanism. • Support the assessment of UNHCR’s operationalization of the targeting formula, ensuring technical soundness, appropriate risk mitigation, and compliance with standard operating procedures and internal systems. • Assist in ensuring data quality by developing validation procedures that guarantee targeting results and eligibility changes are accurately represented in operational systems. • Contribute to technical checks and recalibration of the econometric model, ensuring that results are statistically valid and errors fall within acceptable ranges. • Conduct targeted analysis to support understanding and refinement of the targeting formula, based on requests from UNHCR units. • Assist in preparing and verifying files related to eligibility and SMS loading. Support automation of file preparation to enhance efficiency and reduce errors. • Contribute to the sampling design and implementation of monitoring exercises related to targeting and assistance delivery. • Contribute to joint targeting strategies and harmonization efforts, in collaboration with the Cash Working Group. • Prepare regular reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders, translating complex analytical concepts into clear, actionable insights. • Provide assistance with additional tasks as needed, in alignment with programme priorities and under the guidance of the supervisor. 3. Monitoring and Progress Controls • Provide regular updates—either written or verbal—on the status and progress of tasks related to the Assistant Econometrician Officer. The format and delivery method will be agreed upon with the supervisor. • Prepare and present regular reports (in PowerPoint and/or written format) summarizing progress and key findings from targeting activities or other assigned tasks. These reports will be submitted to the Senior Programme CBI Officer for dissemination to Senior Management, the Cash Working Group, and other relevant internal and external stakeholders. The reporting format will be determined in consultation with the supervisor. 4. Qualifications and Experience a. Education (Level and area of required and/or preferred education) • For G7 - 4 years relevant experience with High School Diploma; or 2 years relevant work experience with Bachelor or equivalent or higher • Relevant university degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science is preferred. • Knowledge of English and/or UN working language of the duty station if not English. b. Work Experience • Competent in tools like R, Python and SQL for modeling and data manipulation is required. Competent in tools like STATA or SPSS is desirable. • Competent in visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau. • Strong understanding of econometrics, and proved experience with data wrangling, predictive modeling, and data science methodologies. • Experienced with model selection, evaluation and optimization techniques. • Ability to design, calibrate, and validate proxy means tests or other predictive models using individual and household-level data. • Skilled in analyzing large datasets to identify patterns of vulnerability. • Ability to assess model performance and contribute to post-distribution monitoring and impact analysis. • Familiarity with displacement dynamics, vulnerability drivers, and socio-economic conditions in crisis settings is considered an asset. • Experience with time series analysis is desirable. • Experience with data privacy and ethics is desirable. • Experience with advanced modelling techniques (deep learning and natural language processing) is desirable. • Experience working with UN agencies, NGOs, academia, research bodies, consultancies and government. c. Key Competencies • Communication: Ability to communicate complex findings into actionable insights for non-technical audiences. • Problem Solving: Capacity to adapt models and approaches to changing contexts and data limitations. • Attention to detail: Precision in data handling, model calibration, and documentation. • Teamwork: Ability to effectively work in a multi-cultural environment with colleagues in different disciplines (e.g., Programme, Protection) contributing to joint efforts. • Adaptability: Comfortable working in dynamic resource-constrained environments. Job Title Specialist - Legal & KYC Compliance Job Scope The Specialist – Legal & KYC Compliance is responsible for handling banking and KYC documentation, maintaining accurate corporate records, supporting entity incorporation and compliance requirements, and providing administrative support to ensure smooth legal and governance operations. Main Duties and Responsibilities Act as the primary legal liaison for banking matters, including opening accounts across jurisdictions, reviewing bank documentation, providing information updates and certifications, and preparing legal sections of KYC forms; Maintain organized and updated records of all banking and related documentation; Manage and update the company’s internal platform for entity records, ensuring all documents, certificates, and filings are accurately stored and accessible; Support the incorporation and registration process of new entities by preparing required administrative documents and liaising with relevant parties; Assist in the preparation of corporate documentation required for banks, vendors, authorities and third parties; Monitor timelines for document renewals, regulatory submissions; Provide general administrative support to the legal and corporate governance functions. Position Requirements Education Bachelor’s degree in business administration or any relevant major Experience 1-3 years of relevant experience Job Title Specialist - Legal & KYC Compliance The Specialist – Legal & KYC Compliance is responsible for handling banking and KYC documentation, maintaining accurate corporate records, supporting entity incorporation and compliance requirements, and providing administrative support to ensure smooth legal and governance operations. The Specialist – Legal & KYC Compliance is responsible for handling banking and KYC documentation, maintaining accurate corporate records, supporting entity incorporation and compliance requirements, and providing administrative support to ensure smooth legal and governance operations. Act as the primary legal liaison for banking matters, including opening accounts across jurisdictions, reviewing bank documentation, providing information updates and certifications, and preparing legal sections of KYC forms; Maintain organized and updated records of all banking and related documentation; Manage and update the company’s internal platform for entity records, ensuring all documents, certificates, and filings are accurately stored and accessible; Support the incorporation and registration process of new entities by preparing required administrative documents and liaising with relevant parties; Assist in the preparation of corporate documentation required for banks, vendors, authorities and third parties; Monitor timelines for document renewals, regulatory submissions; Provide general administrative support to the legal and corporate governance functions. Bachelor’s degree in business administration or any relevant major Bachelor’s degree in business administration or any relevant major Bachelor’s degree in business administration or any relevant major 1-3 years of relevant experience 1-3 years of relevant experience 1-3 years of relevant experience

Company Description Join us at Accor, where life pulses with passion! ​ As a pioneer in the art of responsible hospitality, the Accor Group gathers more than 45 brands, 5,600 hotels, 10,000 restaurants, and lifestyle destinations in 110 countries. While each brand has its own personality, where you will be able to truly find yourself, they all share a common ambition: to keep innovating and challenging the status-quo.​ By joining us, you will become a Heartist®, because hospitality is, first and foremost, a work of heart.​ You will join a caring environment and a team where you can be all you are. You will be in a supportive place to grow, to fulfil yourself, to discover other professions and to pursue career opportunities, in your hotel or in other hospitality environments, in your country or anywhere in the world!​ You will enjoy exclusive benefits, specific to the sector and beyond, as well as strong recognition for your daily commitment.​ Everything you will do with us, regardless of your profession, will offer a deep sense of meaning, to create lasting, memorable and impactful experiences for your customers, for your colleagues and for the planet. Hospitality is a work of heart , ​ Join us and become a Heartist ®. Job Description -Supports the smooth running of the kitchen department, where all aspects of the guest dining experience throughout the whole Hotel are delivered to the highest level -Works as part of a team that maximizes guest satisfaction and comfort, delivering a positive and timely response to enquiries and problem resolution -Takes responsibility for the duties and tasks assigned to the role, ensuring that all work is carried out in a timely and professional manner -Delivers on departmental plans and objectives, where hotel initiatives & targets are achieved -Collaborates with their immediate report, ensuring that costs and inventory are controlled, that productivity and performance levels are attained -Builds and maintains effective working relationships whilst promoting the company culture and values. Company Description For the past 28 years, Sofi de France has been creating high-quality bakery solutions for food service providers, retailers, and professional bakers around the world. Rooted in traditional French baking heritage, our products reflect centuries-old techniques, artisan craftsmanship, and a passion for taste and quality. We bring a touch of France to customers globally—while thoughtfully adapting to the unique cultures, preferences, and culinary traditions of each market we serve. Our integrated network of bakeries and sales channels enables us to tailor recipes and services to local tastes and needs. By managing our entire value chain from carefully selecting wheat and flour to delivering directly through our Horeca partners and franchised outlets we ensure excellence at every step. Job Description We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Customer Service Representative . In this role, you will serve as the first point of contact for our customers, delivering exceptional support, resolving inquiries, and ensuring a positive experience across all communication channels. Additionally, you will be responsible for accurately and promptly entering customer invoices, ensuring all billing information is correct and in compliance with company policies and client agreements. Qualifications Proven customer support experience or experience as a Client Service Representative. Strong phone contact handling skills and active listening abilities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment. Ability to remain calm under pressure and handle challenging situations professionally. Empathetic and patient with customers, ensuring a positive customer experience. Proficient in using customer service software, CRM systems, and help desk tools. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively. Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality. Capable of adapting to new systems, tools, and processes quickly. Demonstrated ability to meet and exceed customer satisfaction goals and service metrics. Comfortable working both independently and as part of a team. Knowledge of company products and services, with the ability to explain features and benefits clearly. Additional Information Key Responsibilities: Respond promptly and professionally to customer inquiries via phone, email, chat, and social media platforms. Resolve customer complaints efficiently by providing appropriate solutions and alternatives within established timeframes. Maintain accurate and detailed records of customer interactions, transactions, comments, and complaints. Process orders, forms, applications, and customer requests accurately and in a timely manner. Follow established communication procedures, guidelines, and company policies to ensure consistent service delivery. Collaborate effectively with internal departments to ensure overall customer satisfaction. Identify and assess customer needs to provide personalized and effective solutions that enhance satisfaction. Handle product returns, exchanges, and refunds in accordance with company policies and procedures. Accurately enter customer invoices into the system, ensuring data integrity and compliance with internal processes. Verify and input invoice details promptly, cross-checking with order and delivery records to ensure accurate billing and to minimize errors or delays. Company Description Cloud Ascent is a Microsoft Partner and Cloud Service Provider operating in the Middle East and recently in Europe, with established entities in Lebanon and Cyprus. We help organizations grow in the digital age through the transformative power of Microsoft cloud technology. By leveraging the full capabilities of the Microsoft ecosystem, we deliver tailored solutions that empower organizations of all sizes and industries. We also offer Microsoft training courses to promote global cloud awareness and equip individuals with the essential skills needed for success in the digital and intelligent business era. Job Description As an entry-level Service Desk Associate , you will be the first point of contact for clients needing IT support, providing first-line assistance by managing incoming requests and support tickets, troubleshooting basic issues, remotely setting up laptops, and escalating more complex problems to the senior technical team. You will assist with onboarding new internal and external users, document incidents, and collaborate with the technical team to ensure users can effectively utilize Microsoft cloud-based services. This role also provides hands-on experience with Microsoft technologies and an opportunity to stay informed on the latest cloud advancements. Your Role Technical support: Serve as the first point of contact for users seeking technical assistance by answering their calls, emails, and chat messages. Troubleshoot and resolve basic IT issues related to Microsoft cloud solutions, Windows OS, user accounts, and hardware/software. Investigate and troubleshoot system-related incidents, ensuring timely resolution and accurate documentation of technical issues and user interactions. Escalate more complex IT technical issues to senior technical roles for resolution. Handle user onboarding activities, including remote laptop setup, account creation, and configuration of Microsoft 365 applications. Create, update, and maintain accurate documentation of incidents, requests, and resolutions in company’s ticketing system. Assign tickets to the appropriate team members or departments, ensuring timely handling and resolution of incidents and requests. Follow up with customers to ensure their satisfaction and confirm closure of tickets. Provide excellent customer service, ensuring timely communication and follow-ups. Support continuous improvement of service desk processes and technical documentation. Customer Communication: Engage with customers to thoroughly understand their technical concerns, offering clear communication and timely updates on IT incidents from identification through to resolution. Professional Development/ Training: Stay current with the latest cloud technology trends by actively researching and exploring advancements in Microsoft cloud services. Prepare for and pursue Microsoft certifications to further develop expertise and gain recognized credentials in cloud technologies. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science/ Engineering, or any related field. 0-2 years of relevant experience. Basic knowledge of Windows 11 operating systems. General understanding of cloud computing concepts. Knowledge or experience with Microsoft Cloud technologies is a plus. Proven ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team. Excellent communication and collaboration skills (both verbal and written), with a strong customer-centric approach. Ability to effectively convey technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences. Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to perform well under pressure. Eagerness to continuously learn and apply new Microsoft technologies. Proficient in English and Arabic (French is a plus). Description de l'entreprise Equadis, qui sommes-nous ? Expert international et multi-marchés de solutions de Data Management au service des Industriels et des Distributeurs physiques et e-commerce. PME dynamique et résolument orientée client, Equadis compte aujourd’hui plus de 70 collaborateurs dont la moitié est consacrée à la R&D. Déjà implantée dans plus de 6 pays (Suisse, Liban, Slovaquie, France, Italie, Portugal), Equadis poursuit sa croissance exponentielle et a la volonté de s’étendre dans différents pays européens et en Amérique du Nord. Notre mission : Permettre à nos clients, plus de 14 000 marques et distributeurs, de collecter, centraliser, exploiter, enrichir et diffuser de façon simple, rapide et sécurisée toutes leurs données produits à leurs destinataires externes et internes, partout dans le monde. Propriétaire de notre technologie, nos solutions SaaS sont reconnues et certifiées dans le monde entier. Grâce à la solution PIM (Product Information Management) d’Equadis, nos clients gagnent en productivité et en sérénité. Nos clients : Entreprises locales et internationales référentes sur les marchés de l’alimentaire, cosmétique, médical, jeux-jouets, high-tech, automobile, luxe, etc. Des exemples de marques et distributeurs qui nous font confiance : Unilever, Danone, P&G, Sephora, Ferrero, Chanel, LVMH, Nestlé, Pepsico etc… Lancez-vous, à nos côtés, dans l’aventure Equadis ! Description du poste Au sein de l’ équipe Support Technique et du département R&D, vous êtes en charge du support technique de nos clients. Vos missions consisterons à : Résoudre les tickets via la plateforme Jira, émis par nos Customer Success Managers, suite à des problèmes rencontrés par nos clients sur notre plateforme Gaia. Analyser le problème afin de définir le niveau d’urgence et les techniques à employer pour les résoudre. Effectuer les développements 1er niveau si nécessaire, en utilisant JavaScript et SQL . Si la problématique est plus complexe, vous passez le relais à notre équipe d’analyse et nos développeurs. Utiliser les moteurs existants pour adapter de nouvelles interfaces d'intégration et de publication pour nos clients. Veiller au respect de l’application du standard GDSN (Réseau mondial de synchronisation de données) ainsi qu’au respect des formats des fiches produits utilisés (Excel, XML) . Assurer la qualité des livrables , à la suite des tests réalisés. Dans le cadre de notre amélioration continue, vous jouerez un rôle d’analyse afin de répertorier les tickets récurrents et de trouver des solutions adéquates pour qu’ils ne réapparaissent pas. Lors des phases projets , vous collaborerez avec les chefs de projet et vous mettez en œuvre les nouvelles fonctionnalités demandées par le client tout en veillant au respect des planifications et des délais des projets. De plus, vous réaliserez pour nos clients, des fiches produits en format PDF et vous les implémenterez sur notre plateforme. Qualifications Votre profil : Vous êtes diplômé de Computer Science ou Computer and Communication. Vous connaissez les technologies : Java, JavaScript, Microsoft SQL server, XML, XSLT et XSD. Vous parlez Français et Anglais. Vous êtes à même de conseiller nos Customer Success Managers et d' expliquer les résolutions que vous avez effectuées. Si oui, n'attendez plus pour postuler! 🚀 Rejoignez une équipe dynamique et construisez votre avenir avec nous ! Informations complémentaires Ce que nous offrons ? Un bonus annuel + allocation de transport Une assurance santé Classe A après 6 mois en fonction Temps plein incluant une journée de télétravail par semaine à l'issue de la période d'essai Des règles d'acquisition de congés payés plus favorables que celles prévues par la législation Une ouverture internationale et multiculturelle. Un cadre de travail agréable alliant convivialité et collaboration au quotidien La chance d'intégrer une entreprise innovante à la pointe de la technologie Equadis, qui sommes-nous ? Expert international et multi-marchés de solutions de Data Management au service des Industriels et des Distributeurs physiques et e-commerce. PME dynamique et résolument orientée client, Equadis compte aujourd’hui plus de 70 collaborateurs dont la moitié est consacrée à la R&D. Déjà implantée dans plus de 6 pays (Suisse, Liban, Slovaquie, France, Italie, Portugal), Equadis poursuit sa croissance exponentielle et a la volonté de s’étendre dans différents pays européens et en Amérique du Nord. Notre mission : Permettre à nos clients, plus de 14 000 marques et distributeurs, de collecter, centraliser, exploiter, enrichir et diffuser de façon simple, rapide et sécurisée toutes leurs données produits à leurs destinataires externes et internes, partout dans le monde. Propriétaire de notre technologie, nos solutions SaaS sont reconnues et certifiées dans le monde entier. Grâce à la solution PIM (Product Information Management) d’Equadis, nos clients gagnent en productivité et en sérénité. Nos clients : Entreprises locales et internationales référentes sur les marchés de l’alimentaire, cosmétique, médical, jeux-jouets, high-tech, automobile, luxe, etc. Des exemples de marques et distributeurs qui nous font confiance : Unilever, Danone, P&G, Sephora, Ferrero, Chanel, LVMH, Nestlé, Pepsico etc… Lancez-vous, à nos côtés, dans l’aventure Equadis ! Description du poste Au sein de l’ équipe Support Technique et du département R&D, vous êtes en charge du support technique de nos clients. Vos missions consisterons à : Résoudre les tickets via la plateforme Jira, émis par nos Customer Success Managers, suite à des problèmes rencontrés par nos clients sur notre plateforme Gaia. Analyser le problème afin de définir le niveau d’urgence et les techniques à employer pour les résoudre. Effectuer les développements 1er niveau si nécessaire, en utilisant JavaScript et SQL . Si la problématique est plus complexe, vous passez le relais à notre équipe d’analyse et nos développeurs. Utiliser les moteurs existants pour adapter de nouvelles interfaces d'intégration et de publication pour nos clients. Veiller au respect de l’application du standard GDSN (Réseau mondial de synchronisation de données) ainsi qu’au respect des formats des fiches produits utilisés (Excel, XML) . Assurer la qualité des livrables , à la suite des tests réalisés. Dans le cadre de notre amélioration continue, vous jouerez un rôle d’analyse afin de répertorier les tickets récurrents et de trouver des solutions adéquates pour qu’ils ne réapparaissent pas. Lors des phases projets , vous collaborerez avec les chefs de projet et vous mettez en œuvre les nouvelles fonctionnalités demandées par le client tout en veillant au respect des planifications et des délais des projets. De plus, vous réaliserez pour nos clients, des fiches produits en format PDF et vous les implémenterez sur notre plateforme. Qualifications Votre profil : Vous êtes diplômé de Computer Science ou Computer and Communication. Vous connaissez les technologies : Java, JavaScript, Microsoft SQL server, XML, XSLT et XSD. Vous parlez Français et Anglais. Vous êtes à même de conseiller nos Customer Success Managers et d' expliquer les résolutions que vous avez effectuées. Our team members are at the heart of everything we do. At Cencora, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures, and every person here is essential to us being able to deliver on that purpose. If you want to make a difference at the center of health, come join our innovative company and help us improve the lives of people and animals everywhere. Apply today! Job Details Cencora Pharmalex is one of the leading service providers for the Pharmaceutical Industry globally and is specialized in all aspects of drugs and medical devices approval, of the market development and any action of effective product maintenance. The success of our company resides in the expert knowledge and high motivation of our employees. Working for Pharmalex means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. We have an exciting opportunity to hire a talented Manager, Local Pharmacovigilance in Lebanon. Responsibilities Set up and manage the local pharmacovigilance system Local Literature Search Pharmacovigilance Intelligence Screening Setting up local Organized Data Collection Local adaptation and submissions Local signal detection Implementation of additional Risk Minimization Measures Reviewing materials relating to local post-authorization safety Participate in Pharmacovigilance-relevant audits and inspections Attend regular meetings according to project meeting schedule Provide monthly Pharmacovigilance report on status of local Pharmacovigilance system in the country/ies Ensure Pharmacovigilance training of affiliate employees, service providers and Third Parties Close cooperation with the global Pharmacovigilance system of the client as well as related global and local departments and functions Issue, review and maintain pharmacovigilance procedures (i.e. Standard Operating Procedures, Working Practices) related to the local tasks in connection with client procedures Close cooperation with the respective Deputy and providing the Deputy with information on relevant current Pharmacovigilance activities Deputy is assuming responsibility in case of planned or unplanned absence . Education: University degree in Life Science (desirable but not essential) Experience: Several years’ experience and profound knowledge in the field of pharmacovigilance Expertise, experience and knowledge regarding relevant legislative and non legislative guidelines on pharmacovigilance Skills: Leadership: Demonstrable ability in leading, mentoring, managing and motivation of staff (team leads). Task and project management skills: Ability to train and support junior/new colleagues in daily activities; ability to lead small project with clearly defined scope. (Customer) Relationship skills: Ability to manage internal and external (client) relationships on operational / day-to-day working level as well as client's team lead level. Communication & presentation skills: Good communication skills (written and verbally); capability to communicate issues and propose appropriate solutions to decision makers. Good presentation skills. Language skills: English business fluent #LI-AT2 What Cencora offers ​Benefit offerings outside the US may vary by country and will be aligned to local market practice. The eligibility and effective date may differ for some benefits and for team members covered under collective bargaining agreements. Full time Affiliated Companies Affiliated Companies: PharmaLex GmbH Equal Employment Opportunity Cencora is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or membership in any other class protected by federal, state or local law. The company’s continued success depends on the full and effective utilization of qualified individuals. Therefore, harassment is prohibited and all matters related to recruiting, training, compensation, benefits, promotions and transfers comply with equal opportunity principles and are non-discriminatory. Cencora is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities during the employment process which are consistent with legal requirements. If you wish to request an accommodation while seeking employment, please call 888.692.2272 or email [email protected] . We will make accommodation determinations on a request-by-request basis. Messages and emails regarding anything other than accommodations requests will not be returned Our team members are at the heart of everything we do. Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with Tastelab to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: Tastelab Job Description Our company is looking for an energetic, enthusiastic, and experienced professional to fill our Event Coordinator position. With your expertise in event planning, organization, and execution, as well as brand promotion and audience engagement, we believe you could be our next valuable team member. Job Purpose The main objective of this role is to meticulously plan and execute various events in line with the company's objectives. You will be responsible for the cohesive running of each event from conception to completion, focusing on driving brand awareness, stakeholder satisfaction, and creating unforgettable experiences for our audience. Job Duties and Responsibilities Charting out detailed plans for every event in alignment with the key objective Executing all aspects of the event, including setup, operation, and breakdown Promoting the brand through innovative and audience-engaging activities at the event Monitoring event budgets, negotiating contracts, and dealing with vendors Working closely with the team to ensure smooth operations and successful events Resolving potential problems effectively and efficiently with a solutions-driven mindset Coordinating with various parties for fundraising initiatives Qualifications Required Qualifications Proven experience in event planning and organization Strong project management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills The ability to think quickly, problem-solve and make decisions under pressure Financial literacy and budgeting experience A deep understanding of audience engagement strategies and brand promotion techniques A proven track record in running successful fundraising initiatives Jobs for Humanity is partnering with Tastelab to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life.
