Note: This is a full-time onsite opportunity based on Kuwait. Job Summary You will be responsible for evaluating business processes and anticipating requirements, identifying improvement areas, assisting in developing and executing apt solutions, leading business process reviews, and performing requirement analysis. Performing user acceptance tests, monitoring deliverables, enhancing customer experience, and ensuring timely completion of projects, facilitating process workshops, gathering & documenting critical information, managing process change. Job Objectives Working from the start of the project, building appropriate communication with business and designers to ensure the delivery of the best possible design, to ensure the customer experiences are designed to add value to product building, and meets the client expectations. Job Responsibilities Requirement gathering and understanding Understanding customer requirement, performing requirements analysis Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, assist dev teams in developing and implementing solutions. Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Propose solutions based on conducted research and latest market trends. Identifying issues, risks and benefits of existing and proposed solutions and outlining business impacts Creating functional specifications for solutions Drawing wireframes for the different product pages Research, Documentation & Communication Research and staying up to date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems. Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Facilitate process workshops, document any information elicited using process maps and business requirements documents. Prototypes & testing Participate in user acceptance testing to ensure that the developed solution matches the gathered requirements. Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users Supporting business transition and helping to establish change. Job Requirements Educational Qualification A bachelor’s degree in business or related field. Previous Work Experience A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field A history of leading and supporting successful projects Experience in web channels, digital portals and mobile applications. Experience in creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Experience in Business Requirements documentation (BRD) & Functional Specification documentation (FSD). Skills and Abilities Must have knowledge of process mapping and business process reengineering. Understand how ERP, BPM, CRM and BI tools operate. Understanding of protocols like SOAP, WSDL, XML and other key protocols is also desirable. Good to have experience in Wireframe designs & Prototypes. Ability to see the big picture, understand project objectives and apply their understanding of how processes should work to operational improvement initiatives. Excellent Modeling skills using business process modelling notations (BPMN, EPC, BPEL) to documenting processes. Excellent knowledge of Agile methodologies like SCRUM, KANBAN Related industry certifications (CBAP, PMI-PBA, CSPO) The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Excellent documentation skills Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills About iHorizons iHorizons is a leading provider of business solutions and technology services in the Arab World. Headquartered in Doha, Qatar, we work with prominent clients to support their digital service migration journeys. The ultimate outcomes are radically improved customer experiences and increased operational efficiencies. We are a forward-looking organization, always enhancing our methodologies and adopting new technologies so that we would serve our customers better and improve our position in the market. We have an outstanding culture, and we provide unique opportunities for career growth to all our staff. Note: This is a full-time onsite opportunity based on Kuwait. A Reputable Company located in Beirut is seeking to recruit a Technical & Commercial Support Engineer. Main Duties: Provide technical and commercial application support to the sales team, customers, and end users to ensure the proper selection and application of pump products. Review technical inquiries, specifications, and tender requirements; prepare accurate quotations, proposals, and product recommendations. Manage projects including purchasing, bill of material preparation, and coordination with factories and local suppliers. Act as the primary contact for key customers, ensuring effective communication, order management, and on-time delivery of projects. Maintain strong customer relationships by providing after-sales support, problem-solving, and technical advice. Collaborate with internal departments to support the order process, achieve project targets, and meet profit margin objectives. Respond promptly to incoming customer inquiries (via phone or email) and provide professional solutions. Promote organizational growth by contributing to process improvements and supporting continuous development initiatives. Company Description Halbawi Industry & Trading Co. is a leading Lebanese manufacturer and retailer of mattresses, foam products, and home furnishings. With decades of experience, the company combines quality craftsmanship and modern design to deliver comfort solutions for every home, through its showrooms and distribution network across Lebanon. Job Description Record, monitor, and reconcile customer receivables transactions. Follow up on outstanding payments and maintain updated customer statements. Assist in preparing receivables aging reports and monthly reconciliations. Support the senior accountant in audits and financial closing. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field. 2–4 years of proven experience in receivables accounting (retail sector is a plus). Solid knowledge of accounting principles and MS Excel. Strong attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks. Good communication skills for customer follow-up. Company Overview We are a dynamic group of fintech, digital, and telemarketing companies expanding across the GCC region. As part of our growth plan, we are building a high-performing call center team to deliver exceptional customer engagement, drive lead qualification, and support client onboarding into our financial platforms. We are now seeking a Call Center Supervisor to lead, coach, and motivate a team of agents, ensuring operational excellence, KPI achievement, and outstanding client experiences. Position Summary The Call Center Supervisor oversees the daily operations of the customer service and telesales team. This role is responsible for guiding agents, monitoring performance, and handling escalations while ensuring that lead qualification, client registrations, and first-deposit targets are consistently met. The Supervisor plays a critical role in coaching team members, improving processes, and aligning operations with company policies and industry standards. Key Responsibilities Team Leadership & Performance Management Supervise and support the daily activities of call center agents. Motivate the team to achieve KPIs in lead qualification, client registration, and deposit conversion. Monitor calls to ensure adherence to scripts, compliance standards, and quality guidelines. Conduct regular performance reviews, coaching sessions, and development plans. Create and manage shift schedules to maintain adequate coverage. Operational Oversight Handle escalated client calls, complaints, or complex issues with professionalism. Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly performance reports for management. Collaborate with management on campaign strategies to maximize results. Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory standards. Training & Development Organize onboarding and continuous training sessions to improve sales and service effectiveness. Keep the team updated on new products, processes, and market developments. Provide constructive feedback to improve communication, sales techniques, and client handling skills. Qualifications & Skills Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or a related field (preferred). 3+ years’ experience in a call center environment, with at least 2 years in a supervisory or team leader role . Proven track record of leading KPI-driven telesales or customer service teams. Proficiency in call center software, CRM systems, reporting tools, and MS Office. Strong leadership skills with the ability to coach, motivate, and inspire. Excellent problem-solving and conflict-resolution abilities. Ability to manage multiple priorities under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Fluency in Arabic and English (spoken and written); French or other languages are an advantage. Background in sales, fintech, or payments industries is a strong plus. Core Competencies Leadership: Inspires and motivates team members to perform at their best. Sales Focus: Ensures KPIs are achieved through strong oversight and coaching. Customer-Centric Mindset: Prioritizes exceptional client service and satisfaction. Communication: Delivers feedback clearly and constructively. Analytical Thinking: Uses data and reporting to drive decisions. Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-changing fintech and telesales environment. Collaboration: Works closely with management and cross-functional teams to deliver results. About the job Finance Manager Job Title: Finance Manager Work Environment: Hybrid Job Type: Full-time Location: Beirut, Lebanon Start Date: Immediate (preferable) About the Client Our client is a fast-growing technology and consulting group headquartered in Lebanon, operating across multiple business lines and entities. They are seeking a capable and hands-on Finance Manager to lead the company's finance operations while supporting its continued growth. Position Overview The Finance Manager will oversee all aspects of the company's financial operations combining strategic finance and accounting execution. The role involves managing budgeting, forecasting, job costing, and implementing robust financial policies and systems to support a scaling tech environment. Key Responsibilities Accounting & Compliance Oversee daily accounting operations including AP, AR, payroll, and reconciliations. Ensure full compliance with Lebanese VAT, income tax, NSSF, and Ministry of Finance reporting. Manage statutory audits and coordinate with external auditors. Handle intercompany reconciliations and group-level financial reporting. Financial Planning & Analysis Develop and manage annual budgets and forecasts. Conduct variance and cash flow analyses to support leadership decisions. Prepare monthly management reports and dashboards in Power BI . Support leadership in job costing, cost optimization, and investment planning. Systems & Controls Maintain accurate financial data within Odoo ERP (Finance & Sales modules). Implement and refine internal controls, accounting policies, and financial workflows. Collaborate cross-functionally with HR, Sales, Operations, and Tech teams. Qualifications & Skills Seniority & Background Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (CPA/CMA is a plus). 5+ years of relevant experience in Lebanon. Proven track record in Lebanese tax compliance and audit preparation. Experience managing holding companies or multi-entity group structures. Strong skills in budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow planning. Advanced Excel and Power BI reporting skills are required. ERP experience (Odoo preferred). Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work independently and manage the full finance function end-to-end. Nice to Have Finance + Accounting Mix: Hands-on accounting (entries, closing, reconciliation) plus financial management (budgeting, forecasting, policies). Professional Certification: CMA, CPA, ACCA, or equivalent preferred. Tech / Fast-Growth Environment: Prior experience in tech, SaaS, or fast-scaling companies (e.g., Toters or similar) is a strong advantage. Career Progression: Clear advancement from accountant senior accountant finance manager. System Exposure: Experience with modern ERP systems (Odoo) and visualization tools. Gender Preference: Female candidates are preferred, though not mandatory. Company Description At Rahi Travels, we excel in providing top-tier flight reservation services tailored for both corporate and leisure travelers. While our focus remains on serving the unique needs of businesses, we extend our expertise to individuals seeking memorable travel experiences. For corporate travelers, our streamlined booking process ensures efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness. Whether arranging flights for business meetings or executive conferences, our team delivers seamless journeys from booking to boarding. With access to a global network of airlines and negotiated rates, we offer flexible options that align with corporate policies and budget constraints. Beyond corporate travel, we also cater to leisure travelers, offering personalized flight reservations for vacations, family trips, and adventurous getaways. Our commitment to excellence remains unwavering, ensuring every traveler enjoys a hassle-free booking experience and unforgettable journey. No matter the purpose of your travel, our 24/7 support team stands ready to assist with inquiries, changes, or emergencies, providing peace of mind throughout your journey. Partner with us for your flight reservations and discover the perfect blend of efficiency and reliability, whether for corporate endeavors or leisure escapades. Reach out to us today and embark on your next adventure with confidence. Job Description We are seeking a highly motivated and results-driven Sales Executive to join our dynamic team in the Travel industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in corporate sales and a passion for travel. As a Sales Executive, you will be responsible for acquiring new corporate clients, maintaining relationships with existing corporate accounts, and driving sales of business travel solutions tailored to the corporate sector. Company Description Halbawi Industry & Trading Co. is a leading Lebanese manufacturer and retailer of mattresses, foam products, and home furnishings. With decades of experience, the company combines quality craftsmanship and modern design to deliver comfort solutions for every home, through its showrooms and distribution network across Lebanon. Job Description Key Responsibilities: Record supplier invoices and verify accuracy against purchase orders. Process payments and maintain up-to-date supplier accounts. Reconcile payables and prepare monthly reports. Assist in VAT and compliance documentation. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Accounting,, or related field. 2–4 years of proven experience in payables accounting (retail or trading sector preferred). Proficiency in accounting software and MS Excel. Strong analytical and organizational skills. Ability to work under deadlines and manage multiple priorities. Company Description About Nucleus Ventures Nucleus Ventures is a leading entity in corporate innovation, venture building, and advisory services, with a track record of successful ventures, operational advisory missions, and startup incubators. Based in Beirut, Nucleus Ventures also operates in France, the UK, and Cyprus, serving the EMEA region. The company collaborates closely with clients, leveraging subject matter experts, startups, and entrepreneurs to drive growth and innovation through tailored strategies. Job Description Job Title: Technology Officer Reports to: Program Director Engagement Type : Consultancy Duration: October 2025 – May 2026 Location: Hybrid (Remote and In-person where needed) Position Summary The Technology Officer will provide specialized, hands-on technical guidance to startups during the incubation phase of the Energy Innovation Lab program. They will support early-stage energy entrepreneurs in building, testing, and iterating their solutions through one-on-one mentorship, sprint participation, and lab facilitation. Working closely with university partners and technical advisors, the Officer ensures that startups' MVPs meet engineering and market standards and are technically validated ahead of the acceleration phase. Key Responsibilities 1. Technical Mentorship and Product Guidance Provide one-on-one support to all participating startups to guide product architecture, prototyping, and technical decision-making. Coach founders on system integration, data collection, debugging, and iterations of MVPs. Help teams identify appropriate technologies based on their energy solutions. 2. Sprint Participation and Feedback Attend all relevant sprints focused on product and technical development. Review and provide structured feedback on deliverables submitted by startups. Support the program team in evaluating startup progress during and after each sprint. 3. Lab Access & Testing Coordination Assist startups in planning and executing testing procedures during the “Product Development” and “Testing & Feedback” sprints. Support with the documentation of the test results and provide technical interpretation to improve MVP iterations. 4. Training and Workshops Advise where needed on any adjustments to the program content and as observed to the startups needs and challenges. 5. Evaluation and Demo Readiness Participate in startup evaluation during the internal selection process for the incubation and acceleration phase. Provide technical input on each team’s readiness to scale and pitch. Support startups in preparing technical components for Demo Day presentations. Deliverables Technical evaluation notes and feasibility input for each startup during MVP development. Sprint-based feedback notes and mentorship logs. Final technical readiness report per startup ahead of selection for the acceleration phase. Contribution to Demo Day support and technical validation presentation coaching. Qualifications Required Qualifications Advanced degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related discipline. Minimum of 7 years of experience working in technical product development or clean energy systems. At least 5 years of experience mentoring or advising startups in prototyping, MVP development, or testing. Prior work experience in Lebanon’s entrepreneurship or clean energy ecosystem preferred. Additional Information Interested candidates should submit their CV and/or a short cover letter here or send an email to [[email protected]] with the subject line: : NV- Technology Officer – [Your Name] About Nucleus Ventures Nucleus Ventures is a leading entity in corporate innovation, venture building, and advisory services, with a track record of successful ventures, operational advisory missions, and startup incubators. Based in Beirut, Nucleus Ventures also operates in France, the UK, and Cyprus, serving the EMEA region. The company collaborates closely with clients, leveraging subject matter experts, startups, and entrepreneurs to drive growth and innovation through tailored strategies. Company Description Driven by a pioneering spirit, Malia Group is a multifaceted group of 25 companies that are leaders in 6 sectors including: Industries, Consumer Goods Distribution, Technology Solutions, Fashion, Engineering & Contracting, and Hospitality & Real Estate. With a direct presence in Lebanon, Iraq and the UAE, our purpose is to ensure excellence in the creation, production, and the timely delivery of goods and services. Throughout the last 8 decades, we have accrued 60 brands and forged alliances with 35 best-loved multinationals – all testimonies to the fact that we are the Group of choice in the region. Job Description Job Purpose: Responsible for achieving sales and distribution targets within an assigned territory by effectively promoting, selling and ensuring proper visibility of the company brands Perform duties in accordance with Malia Group Policies and Procedures Duties & Responsibilities: On Sales and Marketing Possess comprehensive knowledge of the marketed products as well as competitors’ products Meet quantitative and qualitative targets focusing on vertical and horizontal distribution Monitor and stay up to date with competition activities and report to Customer Development Manager and Business Unit Manager (competition promotions, price modifications, new launches...) Ensure excellence in the execution of launching plans for new products initiatives Coordinate with the Educator to win or grow accounts, participate in customer's training sessions and follow up accordingly Identify potential Key Accounts, put a plan to grow them in coordination with the Customer Development Manager and ensure proper implementation Suggest creative ideas for Marketing Department to increase traffic on social media Follow up on client balances, be aware ahead of time of dues, learn client history and prepare a collection plan to collect dues as per deadline Follow the call cycle to maintain proper area coverage and request amendment of cycle as per customer and Business Unit Manager requirement Optimize daily calls by knowing how to allocate time and plan ahead Ask marketing department for Point of Sale Materials (POSM) and Gift With Purchase (GWP) in order to increase sales On Customer Service Perform regular visits in a courteous and efficient manner in order to ensure customer satisfaction and retention Handle returns, exchanges, customer complaints and report any problem to the Customer Development Manager in order to take corrective measures Ensure excellence in the execution of launching plans for new products initiative Build and maintain a distinguished relationship with the customer's key employees On Merchandising Secure premium brand visibility at the customer premises as primary or/and secondary display Secure adequate storage and shelving at the customer premises to optimize sell out On Reporting Keep records of client situation by submitting monthly report to Customer Development Manager and Business Unit Manager of sales evolution, promotional and marketing activities versus plan. Suggest corrective measures whenever needed to ensure objectives are met Submit reports to Customer Development Manager and Business Unit Manager regarding new launched products in the market, competition price, activities.. Qualifications Education: Bachelor Degree in Business Administration Experience: 1 to 2 years of experience in sales of FMCG or Cosmetics Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Company Description GA is a part of Beauty House S.A.R.L which is a leading company in Linens , Kid's and Women's Clothing. Job Description Key Responsibilities: Maintain constant cleanliness of the assigned department. Arrange stands and tables with merchandise as per company standards and ensure floors are always clean. Welcome and greet customers by offering assistance, identifying, and understanding their needs and preferences. Guide customers by accompanying them to shelves and stands, and recommending suitable products. Provide advice to customers by delivering comprehensive information about displayed merchandise. Assist customers in making purchasing decisions by building trust and offering suggestions and opinions. Possess full knowledge of product specifications, promotions, discounts, payment, exchange, and refund policies (if applicable), as well as safety and security procedures. Monitor and identify potential security risks or theft incidents, and know how to handle such situations appropriately. Contribute to team efforts by working collaboratively and achieving required results. Promote products to customers and maximize sales. Receive merchandise from the warehouse and verify quantities when requested by the direct supervisor. Direct customers to the cashier and assist them when needed. Commit to annual and semi-annual inventory counts of the branch and be accountable for inventory discrepancies within the agreed percentage. Ensure merchandise display is organized, color-coordinated, and that sizes are correctly arranged. The ideal candidates must be a national applicant, resident of the region applying for, and have 2-5 years of medical representative experience in the region applied for. Must be able to quickly grasp knowledge about products and portfolio of clients to-be handled. Has a proven track record of achievements in a similar role with the ability to grow the business and retain a satisfied customer base of professionals, subject matter experts, and key opinion leaders in the related field. Key Responsibilities: - Manage client portfolios and foster strong networks with key influencers. - Promote company products to doctors, private clinics, and hospitals. - Communicate daily with clients to address issues and provide solutions. - Analyze market information and prepare reports to meet departmental goals. - Uphold company values and meet deadlines while being a proactive team player. Education and Experience: - Bachelor degree in a healthcare / science practice (pharmacy, biochemistry, biology or equivalent). - MBA/Masters degree is a plus. - 2 to 5 years in a similar position and area applied for. - Sales, Marketing, Communication, PR or equivalent is a major plus. - Arabic and English are a must, French is a plus. Job Requirements: - Car is a must (applicants must be ready to use their own car in the field. For that, car allowances are provided by the company). - Joining date Immediate/ASAP. - Ability to fully and productively perform in the field. - Lebanese national resident of the region applied for. Package Offer: Basic + NSSF + Medical Insurance + Bonus (variable) + Commission (variable) + Car Allowance (variable) + Holidays & Annual leave as per the Lebanese labor law. Hence, by submitting their CVs, applicants automatically agree to take part of and comply to this process, and also provide needed references whenever requested. We are seeking a Voice AI/NLP expert to lead the design and deployment of a real-time, on-premises conversational AI pipeline for call automation. You will be responsible for architecting and implementing streaming Speech-to-Text (ASR), local LLM/NLU, and Text-to-Speech (TTS) solutions using open-source models such as Whisper, Vosk, Coqui, and Llama. The ideal candidate has deep hands-on experience with real-time audio processing, low-latency inference, and building scalable microservice-based AI systems. Strong Python skills and proven expertise in integrating AI pipelines with telephony/media servers (such as LiveKit, SIP, or WebRTC) are essential, as is a strong commitment to privacy and data security—our entire stack runs offline and on-premises. You will work closely with backend and DevOps engineers to deliver a robust, horizontally scalable, multi-tenant voice platform that handles high call volumes and sensitive data. Experience in AI observability, performance tuning, and continuous evaluation of speech/NLP models is key. Familiarity with tool-calling, call routing, and integrating AI agents into contact center workflows is highly valued. If you have a track record of deploying and optimizing conversational AI in production environments, especially for privacy-first or enterprise solutions, we want to hear from you. RequirementsRequirements Proven experience (7+ years) in AI/ML engineering, research, or applied data science , with at least 2+ years in a leadership role. Strong hands-on expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face). Deep knowledge of ML model lifecycle management (training, evaluation, deployment, monitoring). Proficiency in Python and experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and MLOps tools. Track record of deploying AI solutions into production at scale. Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills. Commitment to ethical AI practices and data privacy. JOB SUMMARY Position responsible for assigned food and beverage/culinary operations. Oversees guest and employee satisfaction, maintaining standards and meeting or exceeding financial goals. CANDIDATE PROFILE Education and Experience • High school diploma or GED; 3 years experience in the food and beverage, culinary, or related professional area. OR • 2-year degree from an accredited university in Food Service Management, Hotel and Restaurant Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related major; 1 year experience in the food and beverage, culinary, or related professional area. CORE WORK ACTIVITIES Assisting in Food and Beverage Operations • Creates and nurtures a property environment that emphasizes motivation, empowerment, teamwork, continuous improvement and a passion for providing service. • Provides excellent customer service to all employees. • Responds quickly and proactively to employee's concerns. • Uses coaching skills throughout the property. • Demonstrates self confidence, energy and enthusiasm. • Motivates and encourages staff to solve guest and employee related concerns. Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service • Provides excellent customer service. • Responds quickly and proactively to guest's concerns. • Understands the brand's service culture. • Sets service expectations for all guests internally and externally. • Takes ownership of a guest complaint/problem until it is resolved or it has been addressed by the appropriate manager or employee. • Follows up to ensure complaints have been addressed to the guest's satisfaction. • Develops a relationship with all guests to build repeated clientele internally and externally. Additional Responsibilities as Assigned • Complies with all corporate accounting procedures. • Assists GM as needed with annual Quality audit. At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law. Where timeless classics are woven with modern details. Where business meets pleasure. Where even when travelers are global, they can experience the local. As a member of the team, you will become part of our united Four Points by Sheraton community where everyone is welcome, we support each other, and every hotel matters. We provide exactly what guests need in an uncomplicated way. If you are seeking opportunities to put guests at ease in a friendly, genuine and approachable environment, join our team. In joining Four Points, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work,​ begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global​ team, and become the best version of you. Company Description We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Architectural Project Manager to oversee and coordinate architectural projects from planning through execution. The ideal candidate will have strong consultancy firm experience, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple stakeholders effectively. Job Description Key Responsibilities: Lead project planning and initiation, ensuring alignment with client requirements and organizational objectives. Oversee quality assurance and control throughout all project phases. Facilitate meetings, prepare reports, and manage project documentation. Develop and monitor project schedules to ensure timely delivery. Manage authority approvals and regulatory compliance. Coordinate with consultants, stakeholders, and internal teams to ensure smooth project execution. Qualifications Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Architecture. 3–7 years of relevant experience. Previous experience with consultancy firms is mandatory . Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Proficiency in MS Office and AutoCAD. Additional Information Skills and Competencies: Strong project management and organizational skills. Ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams. Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and timelines. About the job Business Development Manager About the Company A fast-growing technology and data solutions provider, specializing in AI, analytics, and enterprise software, is looking to expand its presence across the MENA and GCC regions. The company works with both government and enterprise clients, delivering innovative solutions that drive digital transformation, improve operational efficiency, and unlock growth opportunities. With headquarters in Beirut and offices across the region, the company fosters a collaborative, entrepreneurial culture and is now building out its marketing and sales teams. Role Overview We are seeking a Business Development Manager to drive new business across Beirut, KSA, and Dubai, with future expansion into Abu Dhabi. Reporting directly to the CEO, the BDM will play a critical role in establishing a high-performing sales function from the ground up. This is a hands-on role for a results-driven professional with a proven track record in enterprise B2B sales of AI, data, analytics, SaaS, or other enterprise technology solutions. Key Responsibilities Own the full sales cycle: prospecting, meetings, proposal development, and closing. Identify and approach top-performing candidates from competitors and industry peers. Generate qualified leads and develop a robust sales pipeline across target markets. Build and maintain strong relationships with government and enterprise clients. Collaborate closely with marketing and other internal teams to support business growth. Track performance metrics and report on pipeline, revenue, and market development. Target Markets & Competitors Focus on government and enterprise sectors. Required Experience & Skills 5-8 years of enterprise B2B sales experience, ideally in tech/data/AI/SaaS. Full-cycle sales ownership with a proven track record in winning mid- to large-enterprise deals. Startup or scale-up experience; entrepreneurial, self-driven, able to operate with light structure. Strong network and ties across GCC/MENA markets, including government and enterprise sectors. Excellent consultative selling, negotiation, and closing skills. Familiarity with CRM/ERP systems (Odoo or equivalent). KPIs & Success Metrics Number of qualified meetings per month. Quarterly pipeline value ($) and revenue closed. Quota attainment percentage. Opportunity progression rate. New accounts opened per year. Benefits Competitive package Fully paid medical insurance (Class A for management). Continuing professional development and training opportunities. Schooling support for children Flexible/hybrid working arrangements. The company works with both government and enterprise clients, delivering innovative solutions that drive digital transformation, improve operational efficiency, and unlock growth opportunities. About the job Sales Consultant-Citizenship & Real Estate Position Overview: Our client is looking for a highly motivated Sales Consultant with strong experience in client acquisition and deal closing to join our team in Lebanon. The successful candidate will specialize in Citizenship by Investment (CBI) and Real Estate Sales, targeting high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) who value international mobility, lifestyle investments, and premium services. This role requires a proactive, resourceful, and professional individual who thrives on performance-based rewards and can build lasting client relationships. Key Responsibilities: 1-Lead Generation & Prospecting: Independently identify, research, and qualify potential clients. Actively perform cold calls, online prospecting, and networking to generate new business opportunities. Develop and maintain a strong sales pipeline. 2-Sales & Client Advisory: Present citizenship and real estate investment solutions in a persuasive, structured, and professional manner. Educate clients on the benefits, requirements, and timelines of programs. Conduct eligibility screenings and ensure suitability before engaging operations team. Prepare tailored proposals and close sales with efficiency and accuracy. 3-Client Relationship Management: Build trust-based, long-term relationships with HNWIs. Provide exceptional follow-up and after-sales support to encourage referrals and repeat business. Represent the company at events, client meetings, and professional networking opportunities. 4-Reporting & Team Collaboration: Maintain accurate CRM records and weekly pipeline reports. Coordinate closely with operations, legal, and management teams to ensure smooth client experience. Share market insights and client feedback to help improve services and strategies. Skills & Qualifications: Proven track record in sales (3-5 years minimum), preferably in: o Citizenship/residency programs o Investment advisory o Luxury real estate, wealth management, or high-value services Demonstrated ability to generate leads independently and successfully perform cold calls. Strong closing skills with a consistent history of meeting or exceeding sales targets. Exceptional communication, presentation, and negotiation skills. Ability to work with high-net-worth individuals with discretion, confidentiality, and professionalism. High resilience and persistence comfortable working in a results-driven environment. CRM proficiency (Zoho, Salesforce, or equivalent). Languages: Fluency in English and Arabic required. French is a strong advantage. Bachelors Degree preferred (business, sales, marketing, or related field). Personal Attributes: Ambitious, target-driven, and motivated by results. Highly professional and trustworthy. Persuasive communicator with natural confidence. Resilient under pressure, with the ability to handle rejection and persist. Team player, yet independent enough to generate leads and close sales without micromanagement. Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple clients simultaneously. Why Join Our Client? This is an opportunity to join a growing international company with a strong reputation in citizenship and real estate advisory. The right candidate will benefit from a secure base income, generous commissions, and long-term career growth in a high-value industry working with global clients. Company Description Remote Call Center Job Description Are you ready to embark on an exciting remote journey as a Call Center Representative? We are seeking passionate individuals who thrive on delivering top-notch sales and want to make a difference. Join our dynamic team and embrace the opportunity to work remotely, providing exceptional support while enjoying the flexibility you deserve. This position requires a 9-month minimum commitment, where you’ll excel from the comfort of your own home. This is an entry-level position which offers on-the-job training. While previous Call Center experience isn't required, we've seen talented professionals do exceptionally well with at least 1+ yrs experience in customer service, sales, or front/back-office experience. Candidates should be very reliable, have good attention to details, have excellent communication and computer skills, coachable, reliable, fully commit to the training schedule which is up to 2 weeks (our attendance policy is strictly enforced) and be willing to consistently learn on the job. If hired for this opportunity you will be required to work from a calm and quiet environment with the required equipment listed throughout the application process. If this sounds like you, submit your application today!! We offer amazing perks and benefits: Awesome colleagues who are dedicated to Voice Dream and our customers! Remote Work Training (Must complete training) Base salary Performance incentives (Bonuses are not guaranteed and solely based on client and company discretion) Weekly Schedule (5 days a week) 8-9 hours daily schedule (break included) Career & Training Development Organizational Growth Professional Work Environment Two yearly company Dinners/Party Full-Time 40hr per week position Competitive Salary (will be disclosed if we move forward with your application) Responsibilities Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following: Handle both inbound and outbound calls in a courteous manner while up-selling products and services to customers. Ensure first call resolution through problems solving and effective call handling. Research systems to find missing information as applicable; coordinate with other departments of Voice Dream to resolve issues when needed. Accurately document and process customer claims in appropriate systems. Lead fact-finding discussions to determine the best options for the customer. Utilize knowledge base and training to accurately answer customer questions while following all required scripts, policies, and procedure. Actively listening and communicating with customers, as opposed to just reading the script. Other duties may be assigned. In case the applicant wants to leave the company, under any circumstance, the applicant is required to present HR with a 2-week notice. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the minimum knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to qualify for performing the job. Education and/or Experience: Minimum high school diploma or equivalent. Six months customer service experience. Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to effectively present technical information clearly and concisely. Ability to fluently speak and comprehend the English language. Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to isolate root cause according to prescribed set of guidelines, matching solution to identified issues. Computer Skills: Ability to listen and respond while keying into automated system. Ability to thoroughly learn client-specific software and hardware (Windows or Mac environment). Able to accurately type 25 wpm. General technology knowledge, including the ability to describe in general terms: operating systems, basic internet navigation, hardware components, software, networking components (video, data, voice), and email applications. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. Employee must maintain regular and acceptable attendance at such levels as determined at Voice Dream's sole discretion. The employee must be available and willing to work 40+ hours per week as Voice Dream determines is necessary or desirable to meet its business needs. Requirements To apply to this position, the candidate's laptop must fit the required specs: For windows users - 8GB of RAM (minimum) - Core i5 (4 core minimum) - 2.00 GHz (minimum) For iOS users - 8GB of memory (minimum) - Catalina Model / Big Sur Model / M1 chip -2.00 GHz (minimum) For Headset - A USB wired headset with visible microphone is required (no wireless or aux) -Applicant will not be approved if AirPods or earphones are used instead of a headset For Internet - A wired LTE connection is required (router must be powered by a SIM card and wired to the laptop) - Wi-Fi connection won't be sufficient - Hot-spot won't be sufficient Qualifications -Fluent English (Spanish is a plus) -Good working laptop minimum specs are in the job description -headset -very good internet Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Ability to thoroughly learn client-specific software and hardware (Windows or Mac environment). Able to accurately type 25 wpm. General technology knowledge, including the ability to describe in general terms: operating systems, basic internet navigation, hardware components, software, networking components (video, data, voice), and email applications. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. Employee must maintain regular and acceptable attendance at such levels as determined at Voice Dream's sole discretion. The employee must be available and willing to work 40+ hours per week as Voice Dream determines is necessary or desirable to meet its business needs. Requirements To apply to this position, the candidate's laptop must fit the required specs: For windows users - 8GB of RAM (minimum) - Core i5 (4 core minimum) - 2.00 GHz (minimum) For iOS users - 8GB of memory (minimum) - Catalina Model / Big Sur Model / M1 chip -2.00 GHz (minimum) For Headset - A USB wired headset with visible microphone is required (no wireless or aux) -Applicant will not be approved if AirPods or earphones are used instead of a headset For Internet - A wired LTE connection is required (router must be powered by a SIM card and wired to the laptop) - Wi-Fi connection won't be sufficient - Hot-spot won't be sufficient -Fluent English (Spanish is a plus) -Good working laptop minimum specs are in the job description -headset -very good internet All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company Description Phoenix Offshore is an organization that connects U.S. businesses with Lebanese talent across various services, and in this case, we are recruiting Lebanese talent for a privately held & Lebanese-owned insurance agency headquartered in Washington, DC. As an all-lines insurance broker, they have been serving domestic and international communities with success since 1970. They offer a wide range of insurance products and risk management services, including Embassies & Diplomatic Missions, Commercial, Life and Disability, Employee Benefits, and Private Clients. Given that the agency is client-focused, customer experience is at the top of its priorities. The client's most valued asset is its people. Finding the right people is vital to providing a great customer service experience. Their human capital is their competitive advantage; it is what truly separates them from what the competition views as the industry standard for customer service. As recipients of the GOLD Stevie Award for Best in Customer Service, their standards for providing the best customer experience are extremely high. This position offers ample training and the opportunity to join an exceptional American firm that is expanding its international presence. Job Description The Customer Service Representative provides customer service to clients, in addition to assisting and supporting the account management team with a wide range of responsibilities and tasks including: • Provide administrative support to Account Executive and Account Manager. • Assist Account Executives/Managers in coordinating all aspects of client activities. • Provide exceptional customer service by communicating and responding to clients and carriers in a timely manner via phone or email. • Handle multiple types of customer experience inquiries, resolve service concerns, document customer requests, and complete changes to policies which do not require a license. • Effectively manage claim inquiries and follow up. • Contact insurance carriers for acknowledgement, status, and potential escalation for pending claims. • Assist with billing retrieval and follow up with clients for payments and documentation. • Assist with Mortgagee change requests. • Assist with documentation for quotes received, policies issued and endorsements. • Assist account management team with eligibility requests. • Assist with billing audits and correcting errors by providing the necessary documentation. • Enter and update client policy information in agency management system Epic. • Update and organize client files and records. • Data entry and research. • Assist with projects as needed to support team and agency. PLEASE READ: This is a full-time position with an expectation to be online and available from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM EST (15:30 to 00:30 Beirut Time) Monday through Friday. This role has a salary of $1300/month. Qualifications Highly fluent in both English and Arabic 2+ years of professional work experience 1-2 years of experience in customer service Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Self-motivated with the ability to work effectively as part of a team or on individually assigned tasks The ability to work in a fast-paced environment where time-management and prioritization skills are essential Detail-oriented and systematic in their working style Able to quickly learn new critical internal work management software Access to a high-functioning computer and exceptional internet connection Phoenix Offshore is an organization that connects U.S. businesses with Lebanese talent across various services, and in this case, we are recruiting Lebanese talent for a privately held & Lebanese-owned insurance agency headquartered in Washington, DC. Job Description: We are seeking an experienced Virtual Recruiter to join our new business model, where recruiters are fully dedicated to supporting client organizations on a project basis. In this role, you will act as an extension of our clients HR team, delivering end-to-end recruitment services as their dedicated recruiter throughout the assignment. This project will run for 3 months (extendable) , requiring hands-on expertise and immediate impact. The recruiter must bring proven experience in event services, architectural, and design-related recruitment , ensuring a deep understanding of industry talent pools and market dynamics. Key Responsibilities Partner directly with the client to understand role requirements, organizational culture, and timelines. Manage the full recruitment cycle, from job briefing, sourcing, and screening, through to candidate shortlisting and offer management. Utilize virtual tools, platforms, and databases to identify, engage, and secure high-quality candidates. Build and maintain strong candidate pipelines specifically in the events, architectural, and design services sectors . Provide regular updates and progress reports to the client, ensuring transparency and alignment throughout the project. Represent the client brand professionally in all candidate interactions, ensuring an exceptional candidate experience. Deliver within tight timelines and project expectations, maintaining a high level of professionalism and responsiveness. Qualifications & Experience Proven experience in recruitment is a must , with a strong preference for candidates who have recruited within marketing, events, architecture, and design services . Minimum 2 years of hands-on recruitment experience, preferably in project-based or client-embedded environments. Strong sourcing skills across multiple platforms (LinkedIn, ATS, talent databases, networks). Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills. Ability to work independently and remotely, while maintaining accountability and delivering measurable results. Tech-savvy and adaptable to new recruitment tools and reporting systems. What We Offer The opportunity to work on a dedicated project with one of our clients, gaining exposure to high-level recruitment mandates. A fully remote role with a fixed salary The chance to be part of a new business model redefining how recruitment services are delivered. Required Skills: Management Skills Dynamics Recruitment Pipelines Transparency Salary Accountability Stakeholder Management Sourcing Screening Timelines Architecture LinkedIn Databases Negotiation Design Business Communication Management We are seeking an experienced Virtual Recruiter to join our new business model, where recruiters are fully dedicated to supporting client organizations on a project basis. Job Title Renewals Executive Job Scope The Renewals Executive is accountable for establishing sound relationships with existing partners ensuring timely follow ups and handling the renewal process prior to expiration. S/He maintains an updated database at all times and works towards effective relationships with internal departments. Main Duties and Responsibilities Build and maintain strong customer relationships, address concerns and successfully retain existing client contracts Support the direct manager in the management of contract renewals with existing customers and coordinate with the Sales and Account management teams accordingly Initiate renewal conversations with customers, respond to queries and proactively follow up prior to contract expiration dates Identify customers’ needs and opportunities for improvement prior to and during the renewal process and engage the direct manager accordingly Identify customer requirements, uncover roadblocks and drive renewals to timely closures in coordination with the direct manager Review terms and conditions, make any necessary changes/modifications requested by the customer and streamline contract issues and the overall customer renewal experience Prepare and submit periodic reports, analysis and key metrics Maintain an accurate rolling of 120 days renewal forecast Update and maintain the customer database at all times Establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal departments. Position Requirements Education Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or any other related field. Experience At least 4-5 years of relevant experience. Company Description Join us at Accor, where life pulses with passion! ​ As a pioneer in the art of responsible hospitality, the Accor Group gathers more than 45 brands, 5,600 hotels, 10,000 restaurants, and lifestyle destinations in 110 countries. While each brand has its own personality, where you will be able to truly find yourself, they all share a common ambition: to keep innovating and challenging the status-quo.​ By joining us, you will become a Heartist®, because hospitality is, first and foremost, a work of heart.​ You will join a caring environment and a team where you can be all you are. You will be in a supportive place to grow, to fulfil yourself, to discover other professions and to pursue career opportunities, in your hotel or in other hospitality environments, in your country or anywhere in the world!​ You will enjoy exclusive benefits, specific to the sector and beyond, as well as strong recognition for your daily commitment.​ Everything you will do with us, regardless of your profession, will offer a deep sense of meaning, to create lasting, memorable and impactful experiences for your customers, for your colleagues and for the planet. Hospitality is a work of heart , ​ Join us and become a Heartist ®. Job Description We are seeking a highly skilled and Guest-focused Duty Manager to join our team . As a Duty Manager, you will play a crucial role in ensuring smooth daily operations, maintaining high service standards, and creating exceptional guest experiences in our hotel. Oversee and coordinate all aspects of hotel operations during assigned shifts Ensure exceptional guest service by addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and anticipating needs Manage and motivate team members to maintain high performance standards Handle guest complaints and concerns professionally and efficiently Coordinate with various departments to ensure seamless communication and service delivery Implement and enforce hotel policies, procedures, and safety regulations Manage check-in and check-out processes, ensuring a smooth and welcoming experience for guests Conduct regular inspections of public areas and guest rooms to maintain quality standards Handle emergency situations and make critical decisions when necessary Prepare and submit daily reports on hotel operations and guest feedback Collaborate with other managers to improve overall hotel performance and guest satisfaction Qualifications Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management or related field Minimum of 5 years of experience in the hospitality industry, with at least 2 years in a management role Proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service and managing guest relations Strong leadership and team management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities Proficiency in hotel property management systems Ability to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays Strong problem-solving skills and ability to make quick, effective decisions Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and multitasking abilities Fluency in English; Adaptability to changing situations and ability to work in a fast-paced environment Company Description Join us at Accor, where life pulses with passion! ​ As a pioneer in the art of responsible hospitality, the Accor Group gathers more than 45 brands, 5,600 hotels, 10,000 restaurants, and lifestyle destinations in 110 countries. Hospitality is a work of heart , ​ Join us and become a Heartist ®. Job Description We are seeking a highly skilled and Guest-focused Duty Manager to join our team . As a Duty Manager, you will play a crucial role in ensuring smooth daily operations, maintaining high service standards, and creating exceptional guest experiences in our hotel. Oversee and coordinate all aspects of hotel operations during assigned shifts Ensure exceptional guest service by addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and anticipating needs Manage and motivate team members to maintain high performance standards Handle guest complaints and concerns professionally and efficiently Coordinate with various departments to ensure seamless communication and service delivery Implement and enforce hotel policies, procedures, and safety regulations Manage check-in and check-out processes, ensuring a smooth and welcoming experience for guests Conduct regular inspections of public areas and guest rooms to maintain quality standards Handle emergency situations and make critical decisions when necessary Prepare and submit daily reports on hotel operations and guest feedback Collaborate with other managers to improve overall hotel performance and guest satisfaction Qualifications Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management or related field Minimum of 5 years of experience in the hospitality industry, with at least 2 years in a management role Proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service and managing guest relations Strong leadership and team management skills Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities Proficiency in hotel property management systems Ability to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays Strong problem-solving skills and ability to make quick, effective decisions Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and multitasking abilities Fluency in English; Adaptability to changing situations and ability to work in a fast-paced environment Join us at Accor, where life pulses with passion! ​ Join us at Accor, where life pulses with passion! As a pioneer in the art of responsible hospitality, the Accor Group gathers more than 45 brands, 5,600 hotels, 10,000 restaurants, and lifestyle destinations in 110 countries. While each brand has its own personality, where you will be able to truly find yourself, they all share a common ambition: to keep innovating and challenging the status-quo.​ By joining us, you will become a Heartist®, because hospitality is, first and foremost, a work of heart.​ You will join a caring environment and a team where you can be all you are. You will be in a supportive place to grow, to fulfil yourself, to discover other professions and to pursue career opportunities, in your hotel or in other hospitality environments, in your country or anywhere in the world!​ You will enjoy exclusive benefits, specific to the sector and beyond, as well as strong recognition for your daily commitment.​ Everything you will do with us, regardless of your profession, will offer a deep sense of meaning, to create lasting, memorable and impactful experiences for your customers, for your colleagues and for the planet. Company Description Halbawi Industry & Trading Co. is a leading Lebanese manufacturer and retailer of mattresses, foam products, and home furnishings. With decades of experience, the company combines quality craftsmanship and modern design to deliver comfort solutions for every home, through its showrooms and distribution network across Lebanon. Job Description Key Responsibilities: Oversee all accounting operations including receivables, payables, and general ledger. Lead reconciliation, closing, and audit processes. Ensure compliance with tax, VAT, and regulatory requirements. Support management with budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis. Supervise and mentor junior accountants. Qualifications Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field. 5–7 years of strong accounting experience, preferably in retail or multi-branch operations. Excellent knowledge of accounting standards and Lebanese regulations. Strong leadership and problem-solving skills. High proficiency in accounting systems and advanced MS Excel. Ability to manage teams and deliver under pressure. Halbawi Industry & Trading Co. is a leading Lebanese manufacturer and retailer of mattresses, foam products, and home furnishings. Position Summary The Medical Information Officer is responsible for promoting Julphar’s products and services to healthcare providers, KOLs & other key stakeholders in an assigned territory or market. The MIO is working as a trusted advisor for Julphar’s customers and facilitates their buying decisions by providing therapeutic solutions that meet their needs and expectations. The Medical Information Officer is the on-ground Ambassador of the Organisation and should always showcase Julphar’s core values and business ethics in every action, while maintaining the company’s image & reputation The position also requires identifying and evaluating the new customer, maintain the loyal customer and ensure proper implementation of Julphar CRM strategy. Key Responsibilities: Key Result Areas Meets or exceeds sales targets within agreed budgets and timeline Develops and manages the assigned sales territory , in terms of customers , retailer and other key stakeholders Implementation of Company’s sale and marketing plan in the assigned territory. Implements territory coverage plan (No. of sales call & Visit frequency) Delivers customer-centric activities in coordination with Line Manager Maintains records system; daily reports, customer profile & marketing feedback reports. Plans work schedules and weekly and monthly timetables. Submits daily & monthly report and CRM reports as per country reporting system. Participate and contribute in all company meetings & present the Territory snapshot Drives increased revenue and profit to achieve the Company’s ambitious growth. Ensure self-learning, knowledge updation, building desired skill & competency , proper interpreting of knowledge and presenting / discussing this information with health professionals. Territory Development & Strategy Implementation Organizes audio-visual activities for healthcare providers as per business need in coordination Line Manager & Marketing Manager Responsible for keeping up-to-date knowledge level with the latest clinical data supplied by the Medical & Marketing Department Monitors competitor’s sales and marketing activities and report these Market Intelligence appropriately Stays informed about the important activities of health services in a particular area. Effective use of company promotional tools, FMS (Free medical sample) and service to achieve assigned target. Responsible for ongoing prospecting for new business opportunities. Core Competency In terms of Competency you are highly result oriented, dedicated with strong sense of accountability & ownership Having strong learning agility to accept , implement new learnings and new changes in the market Excellent interpersonal, communications, public speaking, and presentation skills with multitask and strong negotiation. Strong planning and monitoring skills, and experience in understanding the market trends and forecasting of certain products basis trends Should be calm and composed to work in complex and ambiguous situations You are a team player with a proactive and collaborative approach and enthusiastically manage stakeholders in good spirit. Qualifications, Key Experiences / Functional Knowledge Requirements: 4 years Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy / Science is mandatory Master’s Degree in Business Administration is highly an advantage. Minimum 2-4 years of experience in the Pharmaceutical industry Must possess strong working knowledge of Distributor / Agents operations, Government accounts, tendering processes, contracting and pricing methods (wherever applicable in the country) Functional knowledge of the clinical aspects of the pharmaceutical industry, moderate understanding of Pharma supply chain, dispensing requirements and drug distribution channels etc Proven ability to build strong partnerships with the own country teams , Marketing & Medical teams in HO Position Summary Position Summary Position Summary The Medical Information Officer is responsible for promoting Julphar’s products and services to healthcare providers, KOLs & other key stakeholders in an assigned territory or market. Corporate Group Executive Chef | Beirut, Lebanon International Experience | Upscale Hospitality Group A prestigious hospitality group based in Beirut, operating a portfolio of very cool & upscale restaurant outlets across Lebanon and MENA region, are looking for a Corporate Group Executive Chef to join their team.This brand is known for its chic, trendsetting concepts and is frequented by a sophisticated and distinguished clientele. As the Corporate Group Executive Chef, you will lead and manage the entire culinary strategy of the group, ensuring that all outlets deliver exceptional, high-quality dining experiences that reflect international standards and local tastes. Responsibilities: -Oversee culinary operations across all outlets in Lebanon and abroad. -Develop innovative, high-end menus tailored to each concept and market. -Ensure consistency in food quality, presentation, and hygiene standards. -Lead and train executive chefs and kitchen teams across regions. -Coordinate sourcing, inventory control, and cost management. -Maintain alignment with brand identity and evolving market trends. -Collaborate with operations, marketing, and design teams on new and seasonal updates. Requirements: -Minimum 10 years of progressive culinary experience, with at least 5 years in a leadership role overseeing multiple outlets. -Background in upscale or fine dining restaurants is essential. - Pan-asian cuisine experience is beneficial -Degree or formal training in Culinary Arts or Hospitality Management. -Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills. -Ability to manage multicultural teams across different countries. -Fluent in English; Arabic and/or French is a plus. -Willingness to travel between regional outlets as needed. Job Title: Senior Learning Experience Designer- Learning Production and Enablement
Description: Murex is a global fintech leader in trading, risk management and processing solutions for capital markets. Operating from our 19 offices, 3 000 Murexians from over 60 different nationalities ensure the development, implementation and support of our platform which is used by banks, asset managers, corporations and utilities, across the world. Join Murex and work on the challenges of an industry at the forefront of innovation and thrive in a people-centric environment. You’ll be part of one global team where you can learn fast and stay true to yourself. Your Mission: As a senior leader in the Global Learning Domain , you will play an integral role in the digit a l strategy of design, development, and maintenance of high-impact learning experiences across Murex’s global ecosystem. You will work closely with business stakeholders and SMEs , and guide a team of learning professionals to ensure learning solutions are grounded in instructional theory, aligned with business goals, and powered by innovative production tools and learning technologies . You will be accountable for the success of learning programs that support employee development and client upskilling . Your work will contribute to the evolution of our learning frameworks, tools, and practices, and play a key role in scaling our digital learning strategy globally. You will champion innovation, data-informed decision-making, and global collaboration to ensure learning at Murex is impactful, accessible , and future-ready. Your Role: Learning Experience Design: Lead the design, development, production , and maintenance of effective learning journeys that leverage multiple modalities and are aligned with business priorities. Serve as a thought partner to senior stakeholders, including Head of Learning Domain, Head of Murex University, and senior management to frame learning needs , outline solutions, and define success metrics. Oversee the end-to-end design of blended and digital learning journeys using various design and production tools. Ensure learning experiences are inclusive, engaging, and grounded in adult learning theory and UX principles. Prototype and test innovative learning formats, including AI-enhanced content, microlearning, on-the-job , and peer learning. L ead the integration of learning assessment and recognition modalities such as credentialing the skills-based learning into the learning ecosystem. Define and enforce quality standards for learning content design , development, and maintenance, as well as learner engagement. Leverage data and learner feedback to continuously improve learning products and processes Team & Project Leadership: Manage and coach a team of Learning Designers . Lead learning production projects, ensuring timely delivery, quality, and stakeholder alignment. Establish and maintain global collaboration practices across regions and time zones. Learning Technology & Innovation: Assess and optimize the learning technology ecosystem by evaluating tools across key dimension s, i ncluding pedagogical alignment, scalability, user experience, data capabilities, and integration potential. Develop a forward-looking digital learning roadmap that incorporates innovation, change management, and workforce upskilling to support strategic learning goals. Your Profile: Education and Experience Master's degree in Instructional Design, Educational Technology, Organizational Psychology, or related field Minimum of 12 years of experience in learning design, including at least 3 s uccessful years in a senior or strategic role Proven experience leading global learning initiatives and managing a team . Previous experience in curriculum design for skills-based learning, incorporating various learning formats and modalities Core Competencies Expertise in adult learning theory, instructional design, learning production, and digital learning technologies. Strong consulting skills: ability to frame needs, challenge assumptions, and co-create impactful solutions Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects and multiple stakeholders simultaneously Autonomous and results-oriented change agent , with the ability to foster an environment of continuous growth and improvement within an organization Proficiency in learning analytics, data storytelling, and continuous improvement Experience mentoring or managing learning professionals Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels Comfortable working across cultures and time zones in a global matrixed environment Strong proficiency and experience with LMS platforms, authoring and learning production tools , and AI-enhanced learning tools Proficiency with graphic design tools is a plus F luent in English (written and spoken) Murex is a global fintech leader in trading, risk management and processing solutions for capital markets. Job Description GlobeMed Group, the largest Healthcare Benefits Management company in the MENA region is looking for a QA Analyst who be responsible for creating an end-to-end test plan, executing the plan and managing all activities in the plan to ensure that all the objectives are met, and that the solution works as expected. The solution should be tested in terms of functionality, performance, reliability, stability and compatibility with other legacy- and /or external systems. Duties & Responsibilities: Develop and design test plans to validate proper behavior of the system and its output as per the requested business requirements. Develop and design test scenarios to validate proper functionality of the system and its output as per the business requirements. Execute test plans based on the required system behavior, document and communicate comprehensive results. Ensure that validated deliverables meet the functional design Execute and evaluate manual or automated test cases and report test results. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Business Computer. 2+ experience in Oracle/Web development is a plus (SQL, PL/SQL) Customer oriented and service minded. Capable of understanding and overcoming different cultural and language obstacles to provide solutions that satisfy corporate, regional, and local objectives. Ability to think abstract and out of the box with troubleshooting skills. Ability to identify problems, and initiate corrective actions and preventative actions.
