Job Title: Infrastructure Senior Technical Analyst - Assistant Vice President
Description: Citi is a world-leading global bank. We have approximately 200 million customer accounts and a presence in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions worldwide. We provide consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. We enable clients to achieve their strategic financial objectives by providing them with cutting-edge ideas, best-in-class products and solutions, and unparalleled access to capital and liquidity. The Infrastructure Manager is an intermediate level role responsible for driving LAN/ WAN and help desk administration strategies, including network maintenance, technical guidance, and security in coordination with the Technology Infrastructure team. In addition to the technical hands-on, the overall objective is to coordinate, manage and advise a team of professionals on technical and strategic concepts and activities. Responsibilities: Provide technical oversight across systems and applications, including escalations and resolutions Evaluate subordinates’ performance and make recommendations for pay increases, hiring, terminations and other personnel actions Communicate interdependencies in and outside of the department as well as across products and projects Verify adherence to control/risk standards and processes Lead, evaluate, provide resources and drive a team towards realistic goals Demonstrate a comprehensive knowledge of how areas of Technology Infrastructure contributes to achieving business goals . Shared responsibility for delivery of end results and contributes to planning, budget management and formulation of procedures which directly impacts the Technology Infrastructure area, influence for resource planning Influences others through communication and diplomacy skills; may negotiate with external parties Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members. Ability to manage teams on site and virtually. Qualifications: Relevant experience in a Technology Infrastructure role . Experience in selected infrastructure technologies (application hosting and/or end user services) Effective written and verbal communication skills Effective analytic/diagnostic skills Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audience Proven ability to lead remote subject matter expert teams, ensuring delivery of high-quality technical outputs tailored to country specific needs. Desirable: Experience in a Financial Services or large complex and/or global environment preferred Ability to develop projects required for design of metrics, analytical tools, benchmarking and best practices Ability to partner with virtual and in-person teams, define goals to a team, and work under pressure or to a deadline Fluent in English. Education: Bachelor’s/University degree in computer science or equivalent experience This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required. What we’ll provide you: By joining Citi, you will not only be part of a business casual workplace with a hybrid working model (up to 2 days working at home per week), but also receive a competitive base salary (which is annually reviewed), and enjoy a whole host of additional benefits such as: 20 working days annual leave (plus bank holidays) A discretional annual performance related bonus Private Medical Care & Life Insurance Employee Assistance Program Paid Parental Leave Access to an array of learning and development resources Alongside these benefits Citi is committed to ensuring our workplace is where everyone feels comfortable coming to work as their whole self, every day. We want the best talent around the world to be energized to join us, motivated to stay and empowered to thrive. #LI-BH1 ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Technology ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Infrastructure ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Most Relevant Skills Please see the requirements listed above. ------------------------------------------------------ Other Relevant Skills For complementary skills, please see above and/or contact the recruiter. ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity employer, and qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law. Company Description E - wallet Services Job Description We are looking for dynamic and results-driven Field Sales Agents to promote and sell our E- wallet services to local merchants. As a key part of our merchant acquisition strategy, you will be responsible for onboarding new merchants, training them on using the platform, and supporting their activation and initial usage. Key Responsibilities: • Merchant Acquisition: Identify, approach, and close deals with small to medium-sized businesses (grocery shops, pharmacies, mini markets, service providers, etc.) to onboard them onto the e wallet platform. • Product Pitching & Demonstration: Clearly communicate the benefits of the e-wallet solution, including payment acceptance, float management, cash-out services, and loyalty programs. • Training & Activation: Guide merchants through registration, wallet activation, and first transaction. Ensure they are comfortable using the app/platform. • Relationship Building: Act as the main point of contact for new merchants for the first 30 days. Gather feedback and ensure merchant satisfaction. • Reporting & Documentation: Submit daily visit reports, leads pipeline, and merchant onboarding data using mobile tools or tracking sheets provided. • Market Intelligence: Provide insights on competitor activities, merchant needs, and general feedback from the field. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): • Number of new merchants onboarded per week • Activation rate (% of merchants doing transactions) • Lead conversion rate • Territory coverage and number of visits • Merchant retention rate in first 30 days Qualifications: • High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor's degree is a plus • 1 - 2 years of experience in field sales, especially in fintech, telecom, FMCG, or payment services • Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills • Knowledge of the local market and geography • Self-motivated and target-driven • Basic smartphone proficiency (apps, GPS, data entry) Additional Requirements: • Must own or have access to a smartphone • Ability to travel daily within assigned territory • Flexibility to work on weekends or extended hours if needed E - wallet Services Job Description We are looking for dynamic and results-driven Field Sales Agents to promote and sell our E- wallet services to local merchants. As a key part of our merchant acquisition strategy, you will be responsible for onboarding new merchants, training them on using the platform, and supporting their activation and initial usage. Key Responsibilities: • Merchant Acquisition: Identify, approach, and close deals with small to medium-sized businesses (grocery shops, pharmacies, mini markets, service providers, etc.) to onboard them onto the e wallet platform. • Product Pitching & Demonstration: Clearly communicate the benefits of the e-wallet solution, including payment acceptance, float management, cash-out services, and loyalty programs. • Training & Activation: Guide merchants through registration, wallet activation, and first transaction. Ensure they are comfortable using the app/platform. • Relationship Building: Act as the main point of contact for new merchants for the first 30 days. Gather feedback and ensure merchant satisfaction. • Reporting & Documentation: Submit daily visit reports, leads pipeline, and merchant onboarding data using mobile tools or tracking sheets provided. • Market Intelligence: Provide insights on competitor activities, merchant needs, and general feedback from the field. Job Description Marketing Supervisor We are seeking a dynamic and experienced marketing Supervisor to lead the day-to-day operations of our marketing team, with a focus on content development and social media strategy. This role involves overseeing the creation of compelling content, managing product presence across digital platforms, and driving engagement through strategic planning and execution. Key Responsibilities Lead and manage the daily activities of the marketing team, with an emphasis on content production and social media initiatives. Develop and implement comprehensive content strategies aligned with overall marketing goals and brand voice. Oversee the creation of high-quality, engaging content such as blog articles, videos, and social media posts. Manage and grow the company’s presence across key social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok). Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging digital platforms to refine and optimize marketing strategies. Support the planning and execution of marketing initiatives including campaigns, events, product launches, and promotions. Mentor and support junior team members, offering training, feedback, and professional development guidance. Ensure brand consistency across all marketing and communication materials. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field. Minimum 3 years of experience in marketing, with at least 1-2 years in a supervisory or leadership role. Demonstrated experience in content creation and managing social media for a business or brand. Strong understanding of digital marketing strategies and content marketing best practices. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency with content management systems (e.g., WordPress), social media management tools, and analytics platforms. Creative mindset with strong visual storytelling skills and attention to detail. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Preferred Qualifications Familiarity with graphic design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, or similar. Experience in video editing or production is a strong plus. Knowledge of influencer marketing and online community management. It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! Job Description: Join Us at the Forefront of Technical Presales! Who We Are: Join the business behind the world’s brands. We’re redefining distribution. We’re Ingram Micro—a people-first technology partner, reaching nearly 90% of the world's population. With operations in 57 countries and approximately 24,000 associates, we help businesses run better, grow faster, and achieve their sustainability goals. It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! How Our Team Works: Collaboration is at the heart of innovation. Our team drives Ingram Micro’s innovative campaigns, highlighting our cutting-edge solutions and enabling us to maintain leadership in the technology distribution industry. We work together to shape the future of technology distribution, ensuring products reach customers efficiently and helping businesses thrive globally. Our Values in Action: At Ingram Micro, we are shaping the future with cutting-edge technology! We foster a culture of collaboration, transparency, and continuous improvement. Our team members are encouraged to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and work together to shape the future of technology distribution. What You’ll Do: As a Technical Presales Specialist-Cloud, you’ll play a critical role in enhancing the sales of assigned products by offering presales support to customers. Your key responsibilities will include: Converting customer/reseller inquiries into the right technical solutions. Meeting with end-users to better understand their requirements. Generating Bills of Materials and designing solution blocks in collaboration with hardware/software vendors. Conducting demos and proof of concept presentations to customers. Arranging and conducting technical training for partners and customers. What You Bring to the Role: We’re looking for someone with: 3-5 years of presales experience. Knowledge of of the following cloud products: AWS, Oracle,Or Azure. Enthusiasm and a results-driven mindset with a strong will to succeed. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work proactively. Your Growth with Us: Joining Ingram Micro means becoming part of a global leader in technology solutions. We offer a dynamic work environment, opportunities for professional growth, and the chance to make a significant impact on the future of technology distribution. Together, we build careers. Investing in your future. Partners in putting you first. Committed to your success. #LI-SMR1 It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! Company Description Construction Job Description The Operations Executive will be responsible for tracking and ensuring the smooth execution of all ongoing projects in Lebanon and Lybia. This role involves close coordination with project teams, monitoring timelines and deliverables, and following up on weekly reports to ensure timely submissions, accuracy, and completeness. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, proactive, and highly organized, with strong communication skills and regional knowledge. Key Responsibilities: Project Monitoring & Follow-up: o Maintain regular communication with local project teams, partners, and stakeholders. o Ensure that project activities are progressing according to timelines, budgets, and quality standards. o Identify any delays or issues and escalate them to management with suggested actions. • Reporting & Documentation: o Collect, review, and compile weekly reports from project teams. o Ensure all reports are submitted on time and are accurate, complete, and consistent. o Highlight key updates, risks, and action points in a summarized format for senior management. o Maintain a centralized repository of project documentation and updates. • Coordination & Communication: o Facilitate regular check-ins and follow-up meetings with project leads. o Support the coordination of resources, logistics, and administrative tasks as needed. • Performance Tracking: o Use tools such as Excel, project management software, or dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and milestones. o Provide insights and recommendations for process improvements. Requirements: • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or a related field. • 2+ years of experience in operations, project coordination, or a similar role. • Strong organizational and follow-up skills. • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel and Word). • Familiarity with project management tools is a plus. • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English; Arabic is a strong advantage. • Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities. • Experience working with teams or projects in Lebanon and/or Libya is preferred. Key Competencies: • Attention to detail • Time management • Accountability and ownership • Problem-solving skills • Cross-cultural communication • Team collaboration Construction Job Description The Operations Executive will be responsible for tracking and ensuring the smooth execution of all ongoing projects in Lebanon and Lybia. Company Description One of Lebanon’s most trusted names for quality beddings and elegant home accents, Rezlan Home was founded in 1990 in the vibrant city of Beirut with the goal of blending timeless elegance with everyday comfort. Since then, we’ve been dedicated to creating collections that reflect personal style and bring lasting warmth and charm to your living spaces. Job Description Key Responsibilities: Maintain constant cleanliness of the assigned department. Arrange stands and tables with merchandise as per company standards and ensure floors are always clean. Welcome and greet customers by offering assistance, identifying, and understanding their needs and preferences. Guide customers by accompanying them to shelves and stands, and recommending suitable products. Provide advice to customers by delivering comprehensive information about displayed merchandise. Assist customers in making purchasing decisions by building trust and offering suggestions and opinions. Possess full knowledge of product specifications, promotions, discounts, payment, exchange, and refund policies (if applicable), as well as safety and security procedures. Monitor and identify potential security risks or theft incidents, and know how to handle such situations appropriately. Contribute to team efforts by working collaboratively and achieving required results. Promote products to customers and maximize sales. Receive merchandise from the warehouse and verify quantities when requested by the direct supervisor. Direct customers to the cashier and assist them when needed. Commit to annual and semi-annual inventory counts of the branch and be accountable for inventory discrepancies within the agreed percentage. Ensure merchandise display is organized, color-coordinated, and that sizes are correctly arranged. About us As the world’s largest family of luxury hotels, we all take great pride in being genuine ambassadors of the InterContinental®️ brand. Shaped by decades of international know-how and local insights, our passion for luxury travel spans cultures and customs. Inspiring us to create warm and sophisticated experiences for those seeking a richer perspective on the world. InterContinental Mzaar Lebanon Mountain Resort and Spa is looking to hire an IT Manager. The InterContinental Mzaar is located in the heart of the Lebanese Mountains, with 140 rooms and suites along with a variety of F&B outlets and banquet facilities in Lebanon. Reliable hardware and seamless software are at the heart of every day-to-day IHG experience. To deliver a truly first-class service, we need an IT Manager capable of installing new systems, boosting security, and setting exceptional standards. While making sure our teams have all the tools and resources, they need to make a difference, right at their fingertips. A little taste of your day-to-day: As IT Manager, you will assume full responsibility for the efficient operation of the IT department to provide exceptional products and services within brand operating standards. Every day is different, but you’ll mostly be: • Diagnose Hardware and software problems and replace defective components and perform data backups and disaster recovery operations; maintain, administer computer networks and related computing environments including computer hardware, systems software, applications software, and all configurations. • Plan, coordinate, and implement network security measures to protect data, software, and hardware; operate master consoles to monitor the performance of computer systems and networks, and to coordinate computer network access and use. • Ensure to perform routine network startup and shutdown procedures and maintain control records. • Design, configure, and test computer hardware, networking software and operating system software. • Recommend changes to improve systems and network configurations and determine hardware or software requirements related to such changes. • Confer with network users about how to solve existing system problems. • Monitor network performance to determine whether adjustments need to be made, and to determine where changes will need to be made in the future. • Focus on the rejuvenation of the room experience ensuring IT services and products will be constantly assessed to remain relevant and in keeping with Six Senses wellness and sustainability practices. • Work in partnership with every department to ensure guest’s needs are determined /met and oversee the overall smooth operation. • Continually focus on the rejuvenation of the room experience. • Instill a cost-focused philosophy through training and education. • Operate the property consistent with all legal, statutory and financial requirements and documentation, reporting systems, contractual obligations, security and safety protocols, communications, product and service standards, host management practices and budgetary controls are implemented, reviewed and maintained to ensure the successful operation of the hotel. What We need from you: • Diploma in Computer Science or IT or related field • 5 years’ related experience with computer set-up and troubleshooting • Working knowledge of networks, operating systems, and databases • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills • Knowledge in PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards) • Great communication skills • You’ll be a team player, proactive, responsible, hardworking, and able to work under pressure What you can expect from us: Our mission is to welcome everyone and create inclusive teams where we celebrate difference and encourage colleagues to bring their whole selves to work. IHG Hotels & Resorts provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability. We promote a culture of trust, support, and acceptance. Always welcoming different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. IHG gives every member of the team the room they need to belong, grow and make a difference in a collaborative environment. We know that to work well, we need to feel well – both inside and outside of work – and through our myWellbeing framework, we are committed to supporting wellbeing in your health, lifestyle, and workplace. So, join us and you’ll become part of our ever-growing global family. Don't quite meet every single requirement, but still believe you'd be a great fit for the job? We'll never know unless you hit the 'Apply' button. Start your journey with us today and let's #GoFurtherTogether. Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with Masterpiece Property LLC to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: Masterpiece Property LLC Job Description We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Real Estate Agent to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for helping clients navigate the complexities of the real estate market, whether they are buying, selling, or renting properties. This role requires a proactive individual who can provide expert guidance and support throughout the entire real estate process. Job Purpose The primary purpose of the Real Estate Agent is to assist clients in making informed decisions regarding their real estate transactions. By leveraging their expertise in the local market and strong interpersonal skills, the agent will ensure a smooth and successful experience for clients, ultimately leading to successful property transactions. The Executive Secretary ensures the professional and smooth operation of the hotel executive office. The duties include answering phone calls, scheduling meetings for the General Manager. Company Description E-Wallet Services Job Description We’re seeking a driven and ambitious Commercial Executive to join our rapidly growing e-wallet and digital payments company. In this role, you’ll be responsible for acquiring and managing merchant partnerships, driving revenue growth, and supporting strategic initiatives that expand our presence in the digital payment’s ecosystem. Key Responsibilities: identify, engage, and onboard new merchants and strategic partners to boost e-wallet adoption and transaction volume. Support the negotiation and execution of commercial deals, pricing structures, and partner incentives. Track and analyze partner performance, merchant activity, and incentive effectiveness to optimize results. Conduct market and competitive research to uncover trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of deals. Analyze merchant and customer data to inform business decisions and refine commercial strategies. Key Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, or a related field. 2- 4 years of experience in a commercial, business development, or partnership role within fintech, digital payments, e-commerce, or telecom. Strong understanding of e-wallet services, digital payments. Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and presentation skills. Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze and interpret KPIs and commercial metrics. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM platforms (Salesforce). Self-starter with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience working with QR code payments, card payments, or mobile money services. Knowledge of payment gateways, mobile wallets, digital payment ecosystems, and financial regulations is highly advantageous. The overall scope of the job includes serving food and beverages to guests in the assigned place of work, providing a courteous, professional, efficient and flexible service consistent with the standards of the hotel and Kempinski in order to encourage sales and maximize guest satisfaction. Responsible to Ass. Chief Stewarding / Chief Steward Provide a professional and courteous service at all times and ensure that all employees of the assigned outlet follow the example. Ensure that the place of work and surrounding area is kept clean and organised at all times. Be knowledgeable of all services and products offered by the hotel. Produce reports and analysis of the outlet and present report in the monthly performance meeting. Lead the outlet efficiently in cost and expenses, constantly delivering the highest quality as well as driving high top line revenue and profit. Assist in preparation of the outlet’s budget. Conduct monthly inventory of operating supplies and equipment together with the stewarding department. Monitor operating supplies, equipment and reduce spoilage and wastage successfully. Prepare and review all departmental operations manual updates annually in accordance with the Assistant Head of Department. Support activities and cooperation with the suppliers. Undertake reasonable tasks and secondary duties as appointed by the Head of Department. Ensure that the opening and closing procedures established for the outlet are followed. Be able to clean and wash utensils according to the established standards of performance. Ensure that all garbage regulations i.e separation of items as well as the assigned garbage runs. Have the knowledge of all cleaning procedures, use of dishwashing machines and the type of chemicals being used. Ensuring that breakage is administrated as well as to provide constant feedback to the operation as a tool to reduce breakage and losses. Assist in the preparation of the Annual operating budget for operating expenses, operating equipment and FF&E requirements in line with the compilation of the annual business plan. Ensure control and supervision on the requisitions of operating equipment, the storage and careful handling of operating equipment. Supervise contractors in kitchen and back of house areas of the Food & Beverage division. Maintain daily checks and log reports of all areas responsible. Plan the weekly and monthly duty roster. Ensure that all equipment specification lists are updated and controlled after every inventory. Ensure all FF&E items for banquets, outside caterings and seasonal usage are adequately stored, protected and reviewed before using. i.e. cleaned, varnished and painted or polished. Who We Are – AstroLabs, the Gulf’s Leading Business Expansion Platform AstroLabs is the region’s leading business expansion platform, helping companies scale across the Gulf with confidence. From company formation and licensing to market entry strategy and talent solutions, we power the growth of some of the most ambitious companies in the region. As we grow, we’re looking for an Invoicing & Collections Lead to take full ownership of our billing process and support the collections function, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency. If you thrive in environments where you can build structure, streamline processes, and drive outcomes—this role is for you. Our culture is ambitious, supportive, outcome-oriented, and driven by curiosity. This role requires Arabic and English fluency and the ability to work remotely and collaboratively within a dynamic finance team and external stakeholders. What you’ll do - Key Responsibilities Own the Invoicing Process: Manage end-to-end billing, including invoice generation, validation, and issuance to clients, ensuring accuracy and alignment with contracts and services delivered. Support Collections: Partner with the collections team to follow up on outstanding accounts, resolve billing discrepancies, and support recovery efforts while maintaining professionalism and brand integrity. Build & Refine Process: Identify gaps in the billing and collections cycle, and implement improvements to increase speed, consistency, and accuracy. Client Communication: Engage directly with clients regarding invoices, payment terms, and disputes, ensuring clear and timely communication. Negotiate & Secure Payment Plans: Assist in structuring and securing payment arrangements with clients when required, escalating complex cases as needed. Track & Report: Maintain accurate logs of invoicing and collections activity, and provide weekly reporting to Finance. Spot Root Causes: Identify recurring issues leading to late payments (e.g., invoicing errors, unclear terms) and collaborate cross-functionally to resolve them. Compliance & Record Keeping: Ensure all invoicing and collections actions comply with internal policies and relevant laws, maintaining auditable records. Why Join AstroLabs? You’ll be joining a company with a bold mission and a sharp focus on execution. We move fast, value ownership, and back our people. As Invoicing & Collections Lead, you’ll have a clear mandate, measurable outcomes, and the autonomy to make it happen. Ready to drive impact? Apply now and help us shape the future of business expansion in KSA, UAE, and beyond. What Success Looks Like After 90 Days A fully mapped and categorized invoicing and collections backlog, with status tracking in place All backlog addressed via accurate invoicing, successful recovery, or structured follow-up A documented process for billing cadence, escalation, and reporting, shared with Finance Weekly reports consistently submitted, highlighting progress and critical risks 5+ years of experience in invoicing, accounts receivable, or collections, with a strong track record of managing billing accuracy and supporting collections in fast-paced or complex environments Experience in backlog cleanup, dispute resolution, and billing process redesign Exposure to cross-functional coordination (finance, legal, customer success) Strong written and verbal communication in both English and Arabic Proven ability to manage a high volume of invoices/accounts independently Comfortable with CRM systems, spreadsheets, and accounting software Organized, persistent, and pragmatic; able to move quickly while maintaining quality Experience with clients based in KSA or UAE is preferable Background in process improvement or operational cleanup Who We Are – AstroLabs, the Gulf’s Leading Business Expansion Platform Who We Are – AstroLabs, the Gulf’s Leading Business Expansion Platform AstroLabs is the region’s leading business expansion platform, helping companies scale across the Gulf with confidence. From company formation and licensing to market entry strategy and talent solutions, we power the growth of some of the most ambitious companies in the region. As we grow, we’re looking for an Invoicing & Collections Lead to take full ownership of our billing process and support the collections function, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency. If you thrive in environments where you can build structure, streamline processes, and drive outcomes—this role is for you. Our culture is ambitious, supportive, outcome-oriented, and driven by curiosity. This role requires Arabic and English fluency and the ability to work remotely and collaboratively within a dynamic finance team and external stakeholders. What you’ll do - Key Responsibilities Own the Invoicing Process: Manage end-to-end billing, including invoice generation, validation, and issuance to clients, ensuring accuracy and alignment with contracts and services delivered. Support Collections: Partner with the collections team to follow up on outstanding accounts, resolve billing discrepancies, and support recovery efforts while maintaining professionalism and brand integrity. Build & Refine Process: Identify gaps in the billing and collections cycle, and implement improvements to increase speed, consistency, and accuracy. Client Communication: Engage directly with clients regarding invoices, payment terms, and disputes, ensuring clear and timely communication. Negotiate & Secure Payment Plans: Assist in structuring and securing payment arrangements with clients when required, escalating complex cases as needed. Track & Report: Maintain accurate logs of invoicing and collections activity, and provide weekly reporting to Finance. Spot Root Causes: Identify recurring issues leading to late payments (e.g., invoicing errors, unclear terms) and collaborate cross-functionally to resolve them. Compliance & Record Keeping: Ensure all invoicing and collections actions comply with internal policies and relevant laws, maintaining auditable records. Why Join AstroLabs? You’ll be joining a company with a bold mission and a sharp focus on execution. We move fast, value ownership, and back our people. As Invoicing & Collections Lead, you’ll have a clear mandate, measurable outcomes, and the autonomy to make it happen. Ready to drive impact? Apply now and help us shape the future of business expansion in KSA, UAE, and beyond. Company Description Construction Job Description Job Description IT Engineer: We are seeking a skilled and proactive IT Engineer to manage and support the organization's IT infrastructure, systems, and networks. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring seamless operation of hardware, software, and networking systems while providing technical support to internal teams. This role involves diagnosing and resolving technical issues, deploying new technologies, and ensuring security and efficiency of IT systems. Key Responsibilities: Install, configure, and maintain servers, workstations, and networking equipment. Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues related to hardware, software, and networks. Provide technical support to end-users, resolving issues via ticketing systems, phone, or in-person. Manage user accounts, permissions, and access control using Active Directory or similar tools. Maintain system documentation, including configuration records and IT policies. Implement and enforce cybersecurity measures, including antivirus, firewalls, and data backups. Evaluate and recommend new hardware and software solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support project initiatives and IT integrations. Maintain regular updates and patches for all systems and software. Ensure compliance with organizational policies and industry standards. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Minimum 3 years of experience in IT support, system administration, or network engineering. Knowledge of Microsoft 365 Familiarity with backup and disaster recovery solutions. Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills. Preferred Skills: Understanding of ITIL or other IT service management frameworks. Understanding of Company Portal Working Conditions: May require occasional evening or weekend work for maintenance or emergencies. On-call availability may be required depending on business needs. Ability to lift and move computer equipment as needed. Company Description Driven by a pioneering spirit, Malia Group is a multifaceted group of 25 companies that are leaders in 6 sectors including: Industries, Consumer Goods Distribution, Technology Solutions, Fashion, Engineering & Contracting, and Hospitality & Real Estate. With a direct presence in Lebanon, Iraq and the UAE, our purpose is to ensure excellence in the creation, production, and the timely delivery of goods and services. Throughout the last 8 decades, we have accrued 60 brands and forged alliances with 35 best-loved multinationals – all testimonies to the fact that we are the Group of choice in the region. Job Description Job Purpose: Responsible for effectively implementing the merchandising strategy by making the product visible, avoiding out of stock situations, and optimizing the use of trade and marketing budgets to increase sell out. Perform duties in accordance with Malia Group Policies and Procedures. Duties & Responsibilities On Merchandising Possess comprehensive knowledge of merchandising fundamentals and abide by them when entering any store Report to concerned manager, market information related to competitor's activities (new launched products, price changes, initiatives, display modifications, promotion alerts); take pictures if possible Ensure that company's range of products are available on the shelves, if not; coordinate with the responsible at point of sale to fill-up the shelves from warehouse Optimize use of point of sales material and update them as needed ensuring that all company material is maintained in excellent condition Maintain store shelves to comply with set planograms and provide optimum display of products by removing damaged goods, tidying store shelves, making sure products are clean Ensure the execution and maintenance of contracts in assigned stores, in case of any discrepancies report to management Maintain healthy inventory by restocking shelves when empty, observing stock levels, advising responsible customer consultant to reorder when levels appear low and arranging return of defective products Inform management regarding performance of products (overstocking on shelves or in warehouse for a long period of time, under stocking, products positive shelf turnover...) to take corrective actions Set-up displays in case of promotion and ensure discounted price is visible on stand. Observe customer reaction to special promotions and provide feedback to management. Remove displays at the end of promotion Handle the return of expired promotional products: negotiate with clients in order to return products sent to warehouse and out them back on shelf. Make sure that defective products are returned to company warehouse Negotiate better visibility for the company's portfolio with client Propose to management to send goody bags to clients to stay on good terms whenever needed while remaining within budget assigned Support the customer consultant when needed by taking orders (only during shortages in warehouse) Submit to management on a weekly basis trade monitoring report (price fishing vs competition, product availability vs competitions, recommendations to improve visibility and availability) Qualifications Education Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration Experience Up to 1 year of previous related experience Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with INSHARO AI and Talent to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: INSHARO AI and Talent Job Description We are currently seeking a driven and innovative marketer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be tasked with developing and implementing strategies that promote our products or services, driving customer engagement and ultimately contributing to sales growth. As a marketer, your primary goal will be to increase our brand visibility, customer growth, and overall business success. Job Purpose The main purpose of the marketer role will be to conduct market research and analysis, apply creativity in campaign development, demonstrate strong communication abilities, and show proficiency in the use of digital marketing tools. By understanding consumer behavior and trends, the marketer will be able to identify and target the right audience, enhancing customer engagement and driving sales growth. Job Duties and Responsibilities Develop and implement marketing strategies to promote products or services. Drive customer engagement and sales growth through effective marketing campaigns. Conduct market research and analysis to inform marketing decisions. Utilize creativity in campaign development to attract and retain customers. Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with egtc group to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: egtc group Job Description We are on the lookout for a passionate Pastry Chef to join our culinary team. In this role, you will be responsible for creating a variety of baked goods and desserts of the highest quality. Your artistic touch and skilled hands should ensure visually appealing and tasty treats. Job Purpose The main purpose of the Pastry Chef is to create baked goods and desserts that not only taste great but also look great. You will leverage your skills in baking techniques, flavor pairing, and artistic decoration to achieve this objective. Beyond creating delicious goods, your knowledge in food safety, sanitation practices and effective time management will be essential to successfully perform in this position. Job Duties and Responsibilities Create a variety of high-quality baked goods and desserts. Demonstrate skills in baking techniques, flavor pairing, and artistic decoration. Ensure adherence to food safety and sanitation practices. Manage time effectively and also be able to work under pressure. Innovate new recipes while maintaining consistency in taste and appearance. Qualifications Required Qualifications Strong skills in baking techniques Expertise in flavor pairing Creativity and artistic decoration Thorough understanding of food safety Knowledge of sanitation practices Effective time management abilities Capacity to work under pressure Ability to innovate in recipe development Proven consistency in taste Proven consistency in appearance Jobs for Humanity is partnering with egtc group to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Company Description PrimeTalent, Recruitment Agency Job Description *‼ PRIMETALENT IS HIRING ‼* We are hiring a Female Media Billing Officer for a Media Company in Beirut. Key Responsibilities: • Liaise with media and financial teams to reconcile billing discrepancies • Ensure timely and accurate invoicing for media campaigns • Generate reports and assist in monthly closing activities • Maintain up-to-date records of all billing transactions • Manage and process media billing operations Qualifications Key Qualifications: • 2+years of Experience in billing, finance or similar • Visual Dolphin & ERP System are a MUST • Degree in Accounting, Finance or similar • Fluent in English & Arabic • Age between 25 - 35 Additional Information We are offering: • Working days from Monday to Friday, from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM • Salary around $1400 • Medical Insurance Interested candidates can apply via WhatsApp on 81795407 or email us at [email protected] mentioning Female Media Billing Officer in the subject line. Murex is a global fintech leader in trading, risk management and processing solutions for capital markets. Operating from our 19 offices, 3 000 Murexians from over 60 different nationalities ensure the development, implementation and support of our platform which is used by banks, asset managers, corporations and utilities, across the world. Join Murex and work on the challenges of an industry at the forefront of innovation and thrive in a people-centric environment. You’ll be part of one global team where you can learn fast and stay true to yourself. Your Mission As a Senior AI Engineer, you will play a key role in building and productionizing AI-powered applications within our AI Agent Engine Platform. You’ll work closely with the team in an agile environment, ensuring best practices in development, testing, and deployment. Your focus will be on delivering high-quality, reliable, and scalable solutions that combine AI services, backend microservices, and intuitive Angular UIs. Key responsibilities: Hands-on development of AI-enabled features and workflows using Python, LangChain, and RAG pipelines. Build and productionize LLM-based agents capable of complex task execution, reasoning, and tool usage. Implement backend services in .NET Core and integrate them with Angular UIs for seamless user experiences. Ensure development best practices in code quality, testing, CI/CD, and observability within the team. Collaborate in the agile team to refine requirements, deliver increments, and iterate on AI-powered solutions. Support and mentor junior developers, fostering knowledge-sharing and continuous improvement. Contribute to infrastructure and workflow automation, including containerization (Docker/Kubernetes) and orchestration (Airflow). Your Profile Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. 5+ years of professional experience in software development with strong hands-on expertise in any developing language, preferably .Net, Angular, Python Proven track record in building and shipping AI-enabled applications or data-intensive workflows. Strong debugging skills and ability to ensure system reliability and performance. Practical experience with microservices, APIs, distributed systems, and infrastructure-as-code. Experience working in agile teams, contributing across the stack. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Nice to Have Exposure to model fine-tuning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), or in-context learning patterns. Contributions to open-source AI tools (LangChain, LamaIndex etc.). Experience leading cross-functional initiatives involving researchers, engineers, and product managers. Prior experience building platforms for non-ML engineers to consume LLM services. Company Description We are Ethos, the fastest growing digital communication group in MENA. We think big and we make big ideas come to life. We are crazy about the digital world and we aim high. We are looking for talented and valued people with interesting and provocative ideas, along with bold and diverse perspectives. Our culture is all about the thriving young team of us in 4 offices around MENA, while we boldly help impact the success of leading brands like McDonald's, General Motors, and American Express. Job Description Project Planning & Strategy Execution Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of digital projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and client expectations. Translate strategic objectives into actionable project plans, timelines, and resource allocation. Collaborate with UI/UX, developers, and marketing teams to ensure seamless implementation from concept to launch. Customer Journey & Marketing Automation Oversight Oversee the design and execution of full-funnel customer experience journeys, including Welcome series, Abandoned Cart recovery, Post-Purchase engagement, and Retention flows. Ensure lifecycle marketing campaigns are executed across email, SMS, WhatsApp, and push notifications, following defined logic, sequencing, and timing. Coordinate setup and deployment of marketing automation flows using platforms such as MoEngage, CleverTap, and Adjust. Interface Development & Visual Collaboration Collaborate with UI/UX designers to ensure project deliverables meet strategic goals, usability standards, and brand guidelines. Review wireframes, prototypes, and interface designs to confirm alignment with client requirements and project objectives. Client Engagement & Communication Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, facilitating workshops, presenting project plans, and sharing performance insights. Deliver progress updates, presentations, and post-launch reports, including actionable recommendations for optimization. Cross-Team Coordination & Quality Assurance Manage project timelines, resources, and dependencies across internal teams and external stakeholders. Ensure quality, consistency, and performance across all digital assets and project deliverables. Mitigate risks, resolve issues, and maintain client satisfaction throughout project lifecycles. Qualifications 4+ years of experience managing digital projects with a strong understanding of digital strategy, UX/UI processes, and lifecycle marketing. Proven ability to oversee multi-channel marketing automation campaigns. Proficient in project management and collaboration tools (Figma, Miro, Jira, Trello, etc.). Strong communication and client-facing skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly. Detail-oriented, organized, and capable of coordinating cross-functional teams effectively. As part of a multinational company, we are dedicated to offering top-notch insurance solutions that cater to the diverse needs of our clients. Our commitment is to ensure peace of mind and security for those we serve through comprehensive coverage plans. Job Description As business development manager, you will play a pivotal role in recruiting, training and empowering a dedicated sales agent team. This is a full-time role for a Sales Business Development Manager located in Zalqa. The Sales Business Development Manager will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, developing strategic partnerships, and driving sales growth. Day-to-day tasks include conducting market research, developing and executing sales strategies, managing sales team, and achieving sales targets. This role requires effective communication with clients and team, training / coaching skills, goal setting, and staying updated with industry trends and competitors. Job Title: Personal Assistant to Retired Film Producer/Director
Description: Company Description Jobs for Humanity is partnering with HII to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we prioritize individuals coming from all walks of life. Company Name: HII Job Description We are seeking a highly skilled Personal Assistant for a retired but still very active film producer/director. This is a unique opportunity to provide support to an individual who has had an illustrious career in the entertainment industry. Job Purpose The main purpose of this role is to provide comprehensive support in managing the daily tasks and responsibilities of our client. This includes taking on tasks such as handling errands, overseeing household management, and coordinating transportation. Additionally, the role will involve performing various administrative duties. Job Duties and Responsibilities Provide comprehensive support in the daily life of the retired film producer/director. Handle various errands regularly to ease the workload of the employer. Oversee all aspects of household management, ensuring everything runs smoothly. Coordinate transportation, ensuring the employer arrives at appointments on time. Perform a range of administrative duties to support the employer. Use strong organizational abilities to manage multiple tasks. Maintain effective communication with the employer and any third parties. Demonstrate multitasking skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving. Qualifications Required Qualifications Proven experience as a Personal Assistant. Strong organizational abilities and effective communication skills. Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively. Proactive problem-solving abilities. Familiarity with the entertainment industry is a plus. Ability to handle various errands and household management. Experience in coordinating transportation and performing administrative duties. Company Description Supplyfied is redefining hospitality in high-growth markets with an AI-powered platform that automates 70% of hotel supply chain workflows. We’re looking for a driven, entrepreneurial Account Executive to lead our revenue growth in Saudi Arabia and MENA region. You’ll be the face of Supplyfied to our early agency and corporate clients — and a key force in reaching our first $1.6M ARR milestone. Why Join Supplyfied? Shape the sales foundation of a fast-growing, mission-driven startup Work directly with the CEO and be rewarded for your wins Job Description We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Account Executive to join our B2B SaaS sales team in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. In this role, you will be responsible for driving revenue growth by identifying, pursuing, and closing new business opportunities with enterprise clients in the region. Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve and exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets Prospect and qualify new sales opportunities through outbound calling, networking, and lead generation activities Conduct compelling product demonstrations and presentations to showcase our SaaS solutions to potential clients Negotiate contracts, handle objections, and close deals with C-level executives and key decision-makers Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful customer onboarding and satisfaction Maintain accurate records of all sales activities and customer interactions in our CRM system Stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitive landscape, and product developments Represent the company at industry events and conferences to expand our market presence Qualifications Proven track record of success in B2B SaaS sales, with 3-5 years of experience in enterprise software sales Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business, Marketing, or a related field Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of an organization Excellent negotiation and closing skills, with a history of consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets Proficiency in CRM software, preferably Salesforce Outstanding presentation and public speaking abilities Exceptional time management skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment In-depth understanding of SaaS business models and the B2B technology landscape Fluency in both Arabic and English is required Willingness to travel within the region as needed Additional Information Supplyfied is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, particularly those from underrepresented groups in technology. Ajax Systems is an international technological company and Europe's largest security system manufacturer. In addition, the company offers solutions for video surveillance, smart homes, fire detection, and flood prevention. The product portfolio includes 185 wireless and wired devices for security and automation. Today, Ajax protects over 4 million users in 187 countries worldwide. The company employs 4,100+ specialists. We develop local teams because we understand that local experts best comprehend market specifics. The company has sales representatives worldwide, including Italy, Spain, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, the USA, Australia, South Africa, and other regions. The Global Business Development team is a group of like-minded people who share the ambitious goals of Ajax Systems. The best software combined with powerful hardware has forever changed the perception of security systems for users and industry professionals. Being recognized at the biggest specialized exhibitions such as IFSEC, Expoprotection, and Intersec, as well as winning prestigious awards from industry-leading media like PSI magazine and GIT SECURITY, today Ajax is one of the most awarded security systems in Europe. Ajax Systems' production includes three factories, two of which are located in Ukraine and one in Turkiye. At the same time, the company's certification according to the ISO 14001 standard ensures a minimal impact of production on the environment. The selection of components for Ajax device manufacturing is determined by the presence of manufacturer declarations confirming compliance with RoHS requirements. The company emerged against the backdrop of revolution and war. That's why resilience is the cornerstone of the brand's DNA, and the fight against evil by creating the best security and automation devices is Ajax's unwavering mission. Ajax Systems is a Ukrainian success story, a place of incredible strength and energy. Key Responsibilities: Area of responsibility - Middle East region CRM leads management, analysis, and follow-up Partner Portal quarterly results management, analysis, and follow-up Distributors' events: Invitation and follow-up, checking lists of participants, event feedback, and improvements to increase sales and leads Ajax events: leads qualification/tracking and participants' follow-up Make outbound calls to potential customers to promote and sell the company's solutions Respond to inbound sales inquiries and follow up on leads generated by other sales channels Build and maintain relationships with customers, understand their needs, and provide solutions to meet their requirements Keep accurate and up-to-date records of customer interactions and sales activities in the company's CRM system Collaborate with other departments to ensure a seamless customer experience and resolve any issues that arise Provide regular updates to the management on performance and progress Managing and maintaining a database of all sales data (orders, payments, forecasts, performance, BDMs call cycles) Prepare proposals and other sales-related materials Coordinate sales events, demonstrations, and presentations Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets Qualifications: Proven experience in inside sales, preferably in an IT, IoT environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Arabic Goal-oriented mindset with a passion for achieving targets Ability to build rapport and establish long-term customer relationships Proficiency in CRM software and the MS Office Suite Self-motivated, resilient, and adaptable to a fast-paced sales environment We offer: Opportunity to work in one of the most recognized and innovative security manufacturers. Opportunity to take on new challenges, advance your career, and make a meaningful impact. Opportunity to be part of a fast-paced and dynamic environment that encourages creativity, critical thinking, and the exploration of new ideas. Competitive compensation that includes a base salary and performance-related bonuses. Work tools are covered by the company. In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible. JOB OBJECTIVE As Data Engineer, you will participate in the different phases of Thales Digital Transformation Projects by collecting, modeling, and rendering our data in order to help end user to perform an accurate analysis of their business through reports and Dashboards. ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES Assembling large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements Developing reusable ETL Jobs use cases Conception of connectors/jobs Development of Talend Jobs, deployment and commissioning of the interfaces Identifying, designing and implementing internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes Building required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using ETL and SQL technologies Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and customer acquisition Significate experience on data engineering Cloud environment (azure), especially on data services (incl. ADLS Gen 2, Synapse, ADF, Azure SQL DB, Analysis Services, Power Bi Services Highly skilled in Microsoft SQL Server Stack (Data Base Engine, Integration Services, Analysis Services, Power BI Reporting Services Advanced SQL, DAX, MDX and Query performance tuning Skills Very good Knowledge on Design Pattern of Data Product Demonstrate ability to manage multiple interfaces & deal with IT resources in international context Familiar with fully automated CI/CD Pipelines (Azure DevOps) for code deployment, integration and test automation, code quality and orchestration for automated build and release. Ability to manage Row Level Security on each Layer of the data Chain Familiar with ETL Feeding mechanisms (Delta/Full Loading ,Historical data) Experience Building and Interacting with Data Lake Solutions Good knowledge on agile methodology Working with stakeholders including data, design, product and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues Build Data Warehouses, Data Marts and Data Cubes Maintain the ETL in operational condition Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues Integrate Business Data Support the qualification of the projects, extraction, transformation and load of the data (Data Scoping / Discovery) Technical Framing : Feasibility study, expression of needs, estimation of the load and timeframe Writing Technical Specifications Ensure documentation of achievements Enrich solution components catalogue User Support Customer oriented Quality minded and proactive approach QUALIFICATION, CERTIFICATION & EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS Tools : Talend Studio, Talend Data Integration Platform, Gitlab, Azure DevOps, Visual Studio, SQL server Management Studio, Dax Studio, Tabular editor Expertises : CI/CD notions, Data Modeling, Talend, SQL,Agile,SSAS Educational : In a master’s degree in computer science/statistics/mathematics fields PREFERRED SKILLS Fluency in English, both written and verbal. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Team work and willing to perform trough cooperation. Strong attention to details. Willingness for change and solving problem. Be passionate about digital transformation. Strong analytical mindset. Data oriented. At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Company Description Veolia Water Technologies provides the complete range of services required to design, build, maintain and upgrade water and wastewater treatment facilities and systems for industrial clients and public authorities. Job Description Job Purpose: To assist the senior design engineer to prepare effective process and mechanical designs for the treatment plants, for both municipal and industrial projects in Lebanon and across EMEA Responsibilities: Assists and participates in the compilation of basic process design data; finalizes process scheme & equipment selection Assists Senior Design Engineer for process and design Carries out & reviews process, detailed designs; piping & gas Prepares preliminary design, drawings, detailed drawings and fabrication details Follows up with draftsman on work progress Participates with the Senior Mechanical Design Engineer in the final selection of process, plant and equipment Manages project engineering documentation (submittals, filing etc.) Carries out any other duties related to his area of expertise as assigned by the Senior Mechanical Design Engineer Processes Calculation Notes, Hydraulic Calculation Notes, conceptual design validation,validation of drawings, specifications QHSE Commitments Take ergonomics and safety issues into consideration during drawing preparation following the design and corporates standards Ensure the applicable QHSE Policies and standards/requirements/procedures are being applied and maintained Liaise with the internal or external interested parties during the QHSE audits/inspections Ensure to report incidents (near misses, unsafe conditions, unsafe actions & etc.) Keep the documented information as evidence ensuring the compliance to QHSE Management System Qualifications BA in Mechanical, Chemical or Environmental Engineering 0-2 years of experience in the field or similar Languages: English, French and Arabic Additional Information As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination. Job Title: Senior Indirect Procurement Officer- Information Systems
Description: Murex is a global fintech leader in trading, risk management and processing solutions for capital markets. Operating from our 19 offices, 3 000 Murexians from over 60 different nationalities ensure the development, implementation and support of our platform which is used by banks, asset managers, corporations and utilities, across the world. Join Murex and work on the challenges of an industry at the forefront of innovation and thrive in a people-centric environment. You’ll be part of one global team where you can learn fast and stay true to yourself. Team & Context As a senior procurement officer and under the supervision of the Indirect Procurement Manager you will be responsible for leading Information Systems procurement activities. Acting as a strategic business partner to help operational teams anticipate, formalize and negotiate their purchasing needs, you will manage the end-to-end procurement cycle in accordance with company guidelines while ensuring a high internal satisfaction, and will work in collaboration with your manager on selected deals. On a daily basis, and by sharing and driving improvements, you will as well contribute to the evolution of the Murex procurement organization Your Responsibilities Strengthen cooperation with the maininternal teams to identify purchasing priorities upstream, as well as areas for optimization. Establish and manage a panel of preferred suppliers on the basis of cost, quality, risk and sustainability criteria, in accordance with the procurement guidelines. Manage and monitor the full contract life cycle, ensuring supplier risk management and supplier performance tracking Participate with operational teams to sourcing initiatives and fact-based negotiations (supplier and industry analysis, benchmarks, cost structure analysis). Manage RFxs by Participating in the development of specifications by challenging the needs of operational internal teams as a Business Partner, Launching and executing RFIs and RFPs, Negotiating contracts and ensuring alignment with legal policy, quality and cost targets. Deliver relevant reporting and KPIs on your activity. Support the implementation of procurement policies and processes across operational teams and regions and identify innovative procurement solutions that provide process efficiencies for the organization. Maintain key contract and supplier information in our contract management system, to ensure an up-to-date contract and supplier repository. Your profile Holding a degree in Procurement, Business and/or from an engineering school with a minimum of 5 years of successful professional experience as a Buyer in a Procurement organization or as a consultant in a technological/fintech environment with a strong interest in technological aspects (software, cloud, SaaS…). Strong technical knowledge of IT procurement (especially software) to effectively interact with Operational Teams as well as suppliers. Ability to understand, pre-analyze contracts and collaborate effectively with the Legal team Familiarity with procurement best practices and tools; advanced Excel proficiency. Proven negotiation, influencing, and stakeholder management skills. Excellent interpersonal skills, persuasiveness, empathy, and adaptability. Autonomous and results-oriented, with the ability to manage ambiguity and drive initiatives. Fluent in English and French; and comfortable working in a multicultural, fast-paced environment Murex is a global fintech leader in trading, risk management and processing solutions for capital markets. Key Responsibilities: • Advise on cash flow, capital allocation, risk management & investments • Provide financial guidance, planning & analysis to support growth • Review performance, identify improvements & cost optimization • Oversee reporting, forecasting & ensure regulatory compliance • Implement financial policies and controls to enhance efficiency Qualifications Key Qualifications: • 6+years of Experience as CFO, Financial director or similar • Experience in European market & financial regulations • Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or similar • CPA or CMA are MUST • Age between 30 – 55 Additional Information We are offering: • Remote, hybrid & flexible working hours • $Competitive Package Interested candidates can apply via WhatsApp on 81795407 or email us at [email protected] mentioning CFO Consultant in the subject line. Company Description We are Ethos, the fastest growing digital communication group in MENA. We think big and we make big ideas come to life. We are crazy about the digital world and we aim high. We are looking for talented and valued people with interesting and provocative ideas, along with bold and diverse perspectives. Our culture is all about the thriving young team of us in 3 offices around MENA, while we boldly help impact the success of leading brands like McDonald's, General Motors, and American Express. Job Description Strategic Conceptualization & Wireframing Develop comprehensive digital strategies and translate them into detailed wireframes and user flow diagrams. Lead collaborative wireframing sessions with a two-person executive team to define information architecture and key user journeys. Partner with UI designers to evolve wireframes into refined interface concepts, maintaining alignment with strategic goals. Continuously challenge and optimize content strategy to ensure clarity, consistency, and alignment with user experience objectives. Customer Journey Design & Marketing Automation Design full-funnel customer experience journeys including Welcome series, Abandoned Cart recovery, Post-Purchase engagement, and Retention flows. Map lifecycle touchpoints across email, SMS, WhatsApp, and push notifications, tailored to behavioral triggers at each stage. Define logic, sequencing, and timing for automated campaigns to maximize engagement and retention. Produce detailed documentation for journey flows and technical setup using tools such as MoEngage, CleverTap, and Adjust. Interface Development & Visual Direction Collaborate closely with UI teams to transform strategic wireframes into high-fidelity interface designs. Provide iterative feedback to ensure visuals meet usability, accessibility, and brand standards. Present polished interface concepts and interactive prototypes to stakeholders, backed by clear strategic rationale. Ensure design consistency and brand integrity across all digital assets and user touchpoints. Client Engagement & Strategic Presentation Develop and deliver compelling strategy presentations incorporating wireframes, lifecycle journeys, and interface designs. Facilitate workshops with clients to gather insights, define needs, and present tailored digital solutions. Pitch new digital initiatives using visual storytelling, journey mapping, and marketing automation frameworks. Share post-launch performance analytics and deliver actionable optimization recommendations. Project Management & Cross-Team Coordination Oversee project timelines from initial wireframe development through to interface delivery and journey automation. Coordinate across executive stakeholders, UI designers, developers, and automation specialists to ensure seamless execution. Manage setup and deployment of marketing automation flows across all relevant platforms. Maintain oversight on quality, performance metrics, and client satisfaction throughout project lifecycles. Qualifications 4+ years of experience in digital strategy with a strong background in wireframing and customer journey design. Proven expertise in planning and executing lifecycle marketing flows (Welcome, Abandoned Cart, Post-Purchase, Retention). Proficient in wireframing and journey mapping tools (Figma, Miro, etc.). Collaborative mindset with a strong ability to transform strategy into compelling visual interfaces. Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms including MoEngage, CleverTap, and Adjust. Strong client-facing communication skills and the ability to present data-driven performance insights effectively. We are Ethos, the fastest growing digital communication group in MENA. We think big and we make big ideas come to life. We are crazy about the digital world and we aim high. We are looking for talented and valued people with interesting and provocative ideas, along with bold and diverse perspectives. Our culture is all about the thriving young team of us in 3 offices around MENA, while we boldly help impact the success of leading brands like McDonald's, General Motors, and American Express. Job Description Strategic Conceptualization & Wireframing Develop comprehensive digital strategies and translate them into detailed wireframes and user flow diagrams. Lead collaborative wireframing sessions with a two-person executive team to define information architecture and key user journeys. Partner with UI designers to evolve wireframes into refined interface concepts, maintaining alignment with strategic goals. Continuously challenge and optimize content strategy to ensure clarity, consistency, and alignment with user experience objectives. Customer Journey Design & Marketing Automation Design full-funnel customer experience journeys including Welcome series, Abandoned Cart recovery, Post-Purchase engagement, and Retention flows. Map lifecycle touchpoints across email, SMS, WhatsApp, and push notifications, tailored to behavioral triggers at each stage. Define logic, sequencing, and timing for automated campaigns to maximize engagement and retention. Produce detailed documentation for journey flows and technical setup using tools such as MoEngage, CleverTap, and Adjust. Interface Development & Visual Direction Collaborate closely with UI teams to transform strategic wireframes into high-fidelity interface designs. Provide iterative feedback to ensure visuals meet usability, accessibility, and brand standards. Present polished interface concepts and interactive prototypes to stakeholders, backed by clear strategic rationale. Ensure design consistency and brand integrity across all digital assets and user touchpoints. Client Engagement & Strategic Presentation Develop and deliver compelling strategy presentations incorporating wireframes, lifecycle journeys, and interface designs. Facilitate workshops with clients to gather insights, define needs, and present tailored digital solutions. Pitch new digital initiatives using visual storytelling, journey mapping, and marketing automation frameworks. Share post-launch performance analytics and deliver actionable optimization recommendations. Project Management & Cross-Team Coordination Oversee project timelines from initial wireframe development through to interface delivery and journey automation. Coordinate across executive stakeholders, UI designers, developers, and automation specialists to ensure seamless execution. Manage setup and deployment of marketing automation flows across all relevant platforms. Maintain oversight on quality, performance metrics, and client satisfaction throughout project lifecycles. Qualifications 4+ years of experience in digital strategy with a strong background in wireframing and customer journey design. Proven expertise in planning and executing lifecycle marketing flows (Welcome, Abandoned Cart, Post-Purchase, Retention). Proficient in wireframing and journey mapping tools (Figma, Miro, etc.). Collaborative mindset with a strong ability to transform strategy into compelling visual interfaces. Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms including MoEngage, CleverTap, and Adjust. Strong client-facing communication skills and the ability to present data-driven performance insights effectively. We are Ethos, the fastest growing digital communication group in MENA. We think big and we make big ideas come to life. We are crazy about the digital world and we aim high. We are looking for talented and valued people with interesting and provocative ideas, along with bold and diverse perspectives. Our culture is all about the thriving young team of us in 3 offices around MENA, while we boldly help impact the success of leading brands like McDonald's, General Motors, and American Express.
